story:
Short Summary

I am Ross DeOtte, better known as the Tickled Wizard. I channel my Love and Truth to Hip-Hop beats - sharing great perspective and insight into ourselves and the world. Earth is going through some serious changes right now and I am using my art to heal our people and planet. Offering a new perspective could just be the medicine this world needs. A quick BIO on me:

~In 2012, the old me died. I was reborn and began seeking answers to the most fundamental questions of Life; namely my Purpose. 

~In 2013, I graduated from Texas A&M University with my Master's in Entrepreneurship. I rejected the 8-5 corporate world, knowing my talents could be better used to serve this planet. 

~I spent 2 years intensively studying 'spirituality' and other metaphysical concepts. 

~In 2014, I began channeling my learnings and Love to Hip-Hop beats. Select recordings are available to stream for FREE here. I connected with many other conscious rappers from across the country and joined Extra Terrestrial Alience: a hip-hop group dedicated to bringing higher-levels of consciousness to Earth. I am fortunate to have produced an EP with this group called  Mind Gems, which is available for FREE to download here.  

~In 2015, I wrote and published my first Album: Welcome to the World Of Wizarding.  This leads us to now.

I am seeking financial support to publish and promote this conscious work of art on outlets such as iTunes, Pandora, Spotify, Google Play, Amazon, and many others. This is to spread Light, Love, and awareness to our people. 

Side note: I live on and manage a 175-acre Organic Farm, which feeds hundreds of people with some of the highest quality produce that Dollars can buy. On many levels, I focus my efforts on changing myself so I may be a shining example for all. Living by Ghandi's quote: "Be the change you wish to see in the world"


What We Need & What You Get

Funding for the publishing and promotion of Tickled Wizard's album: Welcome to the Wizarding World. The fund will be spend as follows:

  • $75 to tunecore.com for publishing album on iTunes, Spotify, Amazon, Google Play, etc. 
  • $400 to radioairplay.com for guaranteed play on various internet radio stations (Enough to cover 1 years service)
  • $302 to publish physical CD's through tunecore.com. Complete with pictured album artwork and lyrics. 
In exchange for your donation, you will receive a complimentary download of my new album: Welcome to the Wizarding World~ which contains the most Enlightened Hip-Hop music on Earth today. You may also receive satisfaction knowing you are supporting a paradigm shifting move to benefit the world. 


The Impact

YOUR SINGLE DONATION MAKES A HUGE DIFFERENCE! 

  • I am only seeking a relatively small amount of funds, so every dollar makes a HUGE difference and is felt and appreciated by me. 
  • You will be sponsoring one of the few Hip-Hop artists dedicated to bringing Truth and Light to an otherwise Dark music genre. 
  • Making a REAL impact on my life personally- helping me achieve my mission of waking up this world to our Divine Nature. 


Risks & Challenges

As I have already written, recorded, and produced this album, there is minimal risk and challenge in uploading and promoting it. The largest challenge I face is seeking funding to publish my work. Donating helps mitigate that risk ;-) 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have Dollars to contribute to my campaign, you reading this helps me. So, thank you. You can also spread the awareness of this campaign to your friends. Other ways to help me: 

~Become a fan: we've got FREE downloads of our EP, Mind Gems, available on DatPiff.com. I also have many songs on my Soundcloud to stream completely free. Listen, Learn, repeat :-) 

~Above anything (even giving me dollars), you can help by shining your Light of goodness to this world. Whatever happiness is to you, may you continue to find it and bless us with your existence~

story:
“He’s the painter, I’m the canvas.” Carlos Devone embodies this. Over the past 25 years, God has been faithfully creating a man useful to love and build up his people.
It started in Jacksonville, Florida as the 90’s opened. Carlos grew up, as too many of us do, in a broken home, the father skipping out before the son could process his presence and absence. Carlos’ mother remarried, but domestic violence came hand in hand with the wedding vows.

So Carlos Devone turned to sports, finding some success as a running back. Football and school took him to Grinnell College in Iowa, famous for its progressive and top-tier academics. Ironically, it was at this proudly secular school that God grabbed Carlos. After injuries killed his football career, he started focusing on music as a way to express what was going on in his life, and it was natural that his music focuses on sharing the love and forgiveness that Christ had given him. He began recording and has since released 9 projects.

Having recorded and released nearly 150 tracks, Carlos Devone has developed his sound and is focused on broadening his fan base and laying the groundwork for the future. Carlos is bringing a southern hip-hop sound paired with influences from across the musical spectrum, from reggae to rock, and any other sound that reaches him.

-Written by William Goad

Why THIS album?

Simply put, because we all want to be happy and happiness and joy drive so many of our decisions in life. Yet, when I survey the landscape and even my heart, there are so many things competing for our affections. What I have experienced is that I am only satisfied and fully happy when I am beholding something greater than myself. As William Blake said, "We become what we behold". I want to invite listeners into my experience of this greater Joy sonically and lyrically, with the aim of bringing hope and encouragement through the ups and downs of life. 



What the money goes toward.

In order to execute this album I need:
Musicians
Production
Mixing and Mastering
Duplication and Distribution

I have already been graced with the opportunity to have production from Dove Award winning music producer D-Flow who has produced for Grammy Award winning Lecrae and Andy Mineo. As well as production from JahRock'n Productions who as also produced for Andy Mineo . Now I need your help to finish making this album a reality.  

The majority of the production will be done by Ordinary Sounds. Ordinary Sounds is a music production company out of Cedar Falls, IA. Their mission is simple. They strive to provide the artist space and opportunity to make unique records that capture a unique story. They diligently work to help artists create a personally tailored sound based on personal content and personal style. You can check out some of their work on their website, www.ordinarysounds.com  



How you can help.

If you are ready to give click the pink CONTRIBUTE NOW button and follow the instructions. As I said earlier I want this to be an album for anyone who listens. Because this is your album, I want to also reward you with insider perks for making it possible. To the right, you will see these perks for giving. There are perks at many levels of giving, so browse through and see which one (or more) you would like!

Other Ways You Can Help.

I understand if you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. You could:

  • Share this on your social media page
  • Share this video with family and friends over the holidays
Thank you so much for visiting! Now let's make some music!

story:
Bref résumé

Les contributeurs financent des idées qui leur plaisent et des personnes en qui ils ont confiance. Voici quelques pistes à suivre dans cette section :

  • Présentez-vous et parlez de votre parcours.
  • Décrivez brièvement votre projet et pourquoi il est important à vos yeux.
  • Expliquez l'importance du projet auquel les contributeurs vont participer.

N'oubliez pas, restez concis mais original. Demandez-vous : si quelqu'un s'arrêtait de lire à cet endroit, serait-il prêt à faire une contribution ?

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Fournissez plus de détails aux gens :

  • Expliquez le montant du financement dont vous avez besoin et à quoi il va servir. Soyez clair et précis : les contributeurs ont besoin de vous faire confiance pour vous aider.
  • Parlez de vos contreparties uniques. Suscitez l'intérêt de vos visiteurs !
  • Décrivez où les fonds iront si vous n'atteignez pas complètement votre objectif.

L'impact

N'hésitez pas à expliquer votre projet plus en détail et indiquez aux visiteurs en quoi leur contribution fera la différence :

  • Expliquez pourquoi votre projet est précieux pour le contributeur et pour le monde.
  • Mettez en avant vos expériences réussies sur des projets tels que celui-ci (si vous en avez).
  • Rendez votre projet concret aux yeux des visiteurs et suscitez la confiance.

Risques et défis

Les gens apprécieront la transparence de vos propos. Soyez ouvert et démarquez-vous en exposant les risques et les obstacles auxquels vous allez peut-être faire face pour atteindre votre objectif.

  • Expliquez pourquoi vous pensez être en mesure de relever ces défis.
  • Décrivez comment vous comptez résoudre ces éventuels problèmes.

D'autres façons d'aider

Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas aider :

  • Demandez aux gens de passer le mot et de faire de la publicité autour de votre projet.
  • Rappelez-leur d'utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

Et le tour est joué.

story:
Hey FeldFanFam Welcome 2 The "Elev8or 2 Ascension" Fund Raiser Page!

WELCOME!

Thank U 4 stopping by 2 check out my campaign. Here's what's going on:

I know the questions most of U must be thinking right now...questions like...Why have I brought U here? What is this all about? And most importantly Y would a Movie Star like U be asking us 4 $? Dont U have your own $? And Y R U asking us 2 help when U R already successful. Let me do my best 2 answer those questions.

#1. Yes I have been fortunate 2 keep myself steadily working as an actor 4 many decades. 

#2 Yes I have had some success in my career.

However as U probably know making films is my bread & butter, it is how I earn a living. It is my means 2 an end as it were....

Music however is my Love, my Passion, my Heart & soul. Music is the thing I feel I was truly meant 2 do, had my parents not made the choice 2 throw me in front of cameras at the tender age of 3, & kept me there 2 earn a living & financially support my family until I was legally emancipated at the age of 15.

 Acting was NOT my 1st choice. Nor was it my choice at all. However, I have grown 2 LOVE it. Acting is now as much a part of my being as breathing, eating, or drinking. I have been programmed that way. It was inevitable & unavoidable.

But locked deep inside & lying dormant 4 many years, was a burning passion 2 create music! I love writing songs, and I love expressing myself through music. I love producing interesting sounds & creating original beats. I love writing my innermost personal feelings into a  catchy jingle that people can instantly relate 2, & find themselves singing along with. And most of all, I LOVE performing! I love going out on that stage & coming alive with the lights, & the roar of the crowd. I LOVE making the audience scream n shout, & dance the night away. I LOVE the togetherness that can only happen from a LIVE musical experience.

However unfortunate as it was, once I was established as an actor, I found it increasingly harder 4 anybody 2 give my music a chance. Although I started songwriting at 13, & began doing Live concerts at 15, I was not able 2 release my 1st album until I was 22 yrs old via a small indy label. No major  record company would take me seriously. I was never told "The music stinks" or "I just don't hear it", as typical turn downs from major labels go. No! Instead I got lots of weird excuses like "The songs are catchy, but do U have 2 sing them"? or "Not bad 4 an actor, but we don't feel U will have the time 2 dedicate 2 a music career", I was blown off, laughed at, & the doors were continuously slammed in my face. Never because of a lack of talent, but rather because of a prejudice, how could I succeed when so many others had tried before me and failed?

I became a statistic.With albums released by peers like John Travolta, Scott Baio, William Shatner, & Alyssa Milano as examples, the idea of actors making music became laughable, and fell under the catergory of "a joke". That was it I was dead & buried in the music industry before I started.

Fortunately I didnt let that stop my new album project. I have also toured America 4 times in total, twice w my band & 2 solo tours. I have never stopped writing, recording, and performing my music 4 LIVE audiences. Because whenever we toured, U were there 2 C it!

However I have NEVER made music 4 financial gain. I have never become rich making music. In fact my last band album cost me $100,000 just 4 the production of the album, and due 2 lack of promotional & marketing funds I made very little of it back. However it isnt about making $ 4 me, in fact its quite the opposite, I have spent and lost massive amounts of $ by continuing my music career. It is all about the LOVE and passion I derive from simply creating my music. U C  in all of this time I had never earned a commercial or mainstream hit.....UNTIL RECENTLY....

However, I might not have kept going, had nobody gotten it or appreciated it. But thats just it, my true fans who took the time 2 actually listen 2 what my music was saying, immediately fell in love with it. Actual Music critics (tabloids aside) have given consistent positive reviews. Friends & peers have given me much strength & support through positive feedback, but the number 1 thing that has kept me making music is the overwhelming amount of praise & appreciation that I receive from U..THE FANS!

U R the reason I keep going. Your comments, your letters, your words of encouragement. U alone lift me up when I get weak, & scared, & think its just not worth it anymore. But then I do a concert & look out & C thousands of screaming fans, singing along 2 every word, just as I would while watching my favorite artists. Because of this I finally accepted there was an audience 4 what I do, & it seems that audience has continued 2 grow through the years at a rapid pace. Now more than ever I find new fans commenting on age old recordings I thought were long since forgotten.

As many of U know, I have been hard at work 4 quite a while on my new album "ANGELIC 2 THE CORE".  This is not your average musical project. It is a labor of Love. It is the most imaginative, diverse, daring, creative, & personal solo album I have made 2 date. This is a very important work 4 me, This album has literally taken a decade 2 create. I know that is an extraordinary amount of time 2 spend on 1 project, but once U hear the entire album U will understand Y.

"Angelic 2 the Core" is my 1st ever double album. It has 22 songs on it. The album truly shows my diversity as a songwriter & producer, covering all fields of the pop music spectrum. Part pop, part Rock, part EDM, part Hip Hop, and all soul, this album truly has something 4 EVERYBODY!

4 the 1st time in my musical career U will hear songs which were largely recorded privately in my Home Studio. It also happens 2 B the 1st time I have endeavored 2 play all of the instruments on many of the songs. So now U R probably thinking...Well if its done in your home and U R playing all the instruments, how come it took so long?? I will explain....

Yes it is a "solo" album, and yes I am a multi instrumentalist on many of the tracks....HOWEVER....this album is a culmination of a large cast of incredibly talented singers, songwriters, producers, musicians, rappers, and artists, coming together, 2 help me create this.

This album features 5 generations of Hip Hop artists including several legends of the art form. It also features some of the greatest vocalists, & musicians of our time. Here is a list of some of the incredible people who were kind enough 2 dedicate their time, talents, & energy 2 make this dream a reality:

Fred Durst (Limp Bizkit), Kaya Jones (Pussycat Dolls), R1ckone (Black Eyed Peas), Scott Page (Pink Floyd), B.Howard, Kurupt, Snoop Dogg, Doc Ice (Whodini/UTFO),Thomas Van Musser (Black Eyed Peas songwriter) Dave Dunn (Infectous Grooves)The Wizards (Production team) Jon Carin (Pink Floyd), Demario "SB"( New Rap artist), Manny Mijaris (EDM Producer)Thomas Van Musser (writer for Black Eyed Peas), Jon Carin (Pink Floyd), Corey Haim (Film clips), Jameson Newlander (Film clips) Glasses Boys (EDM collective), Michael Debarge (Debarge), Truth Movement, Tommy Daugherty (Death Row recording engineer), Angel Courtney Anne aka DJAC, and of course  Coreys Angels (backing vocalists) plus many more...

In the 10 yrs I've been working on this album I have completely self funded this project 4 my very own label CiFi records.  I created CiFi 4 the purpose of releasing my music direct 2 U, without the financial aid, or creative influence of Big record company executives. I have done this album all on my own 2 insure that U will get 2 hear my vision directly. However after 10 years of financially backing this project, as I near the final stages of its completion, I have come 2 realize that although I have created a work that is sonically superior 2 all of my other solo projects, & has many hit worthy songs, 1 thing is impendingly clear.....I have no budget left 4 Mastering, artwork, duplication, distribution, or marketing.

Now let me explain Y the last part can prevent me from ever getting this album released.

There R enormous costs in the process of making an album. From engineers, 2 instruments, from equipment 2 software, from computers, 2 hard drives, there R many costs that come along with running your own studio, espescially in a modern world where technology is constantly evolving. Constant software updates. Constant additions of plug ins and Pro Tools upgrades can be quite costly. In order 2 keep the music sounding fresh & relevant, U must constantly upgrade & change the sounds in every song 2 continue keeping up w the evolution of sound & technology. An album that takes a decade, means every few years I have had 2 reopen the older songs and update certain sounds. In some cases I have had 2 completely rerecord the song because it has become dated, which wont work with a modern pop album. On top of all of that I have also had 2 pay 4 the release of every single (their have been 5 singles 2 date), the production of both music videos, & the artwork 4 each of the singles, & the distribution costs of each single & the EP.

With all of that said, now that I have finally completed the production work on all 22 songs, I have started budgeting 4 the final stages of the process & 2 my surprise the most expensive part has yet 2 come. 

In the modern age of music, it is a very exciting time 4 independent artists like myself, because now 4 the 1st time in my career, I have been able 2 release singles 2 radio, create and release my own videos, & make my music available 4 digital download all over the world by the push of a button. However 1 thing hasn't changed....

The complete domination of Big Corporations & Big Record Labels who pay massive amounts of advertising $$ 2 propel their artists 2 the top of the Billboard charts. This is Y U rarely C a new artist break in2 the charts, Because the Big Labels have complete worldwide domination over radio. Companies like Clearchannel who own & operate just about every top 40 station in the world, have a stronghold over the industry. Basically the only way 4 a little guy like me 2 B able 2 compete, & actually make a dent, is 2 fight power with power. Which means fighting $ with $.

It seems almost impossible 4 a little known musical artist like me 2 get played on mainstream radio. ALMOST impossible....but not TOTALLY impossible. 

U C the way it works is if a guy like me has the financial backing 2 pay 4 ads in music magazines, radio spots, & radio station magazines like HITS, &  with the right radio promotion team behind me, I can take out enough ads, & make enough noise 2 get the musical directors of those stations 2 notice.

Now if I didnt think the songs had what it takes 2 B contemporary chart toppers, I wouldnt even try 2 compete. But lets take a look at the release of my singles so far & their success rates. The 1st single & video I released was "Ascension Millennium" as my 1st single 4 the album & with my 1st video ever, I immediately gave the rights exclusively 2 MTV. It was a shot n the dark. But 2 my surprise the video garnished the coveted "Buzzworthy" status within the 1st 12 hrs of its release. By the end of 2 weeks it had earned a quarter million views on MTV giving it the claim of a video gone viral. 

At that time I created & launched my own YouTube channel. Within a months time the quarter million views jumped 2 a half a million. By the end of the 2nd month it had earned 750,000 views. Shortly thereafter my channel was taken down by the powers that be citing they had no confirmation that I was really me & that my music was under my official license. When that happened I lost all of the views, & monetary gain that should have been awarded by those views.

So I started over. I am happy 2 say that video is now back up 2 almost 300,000 views again. With well over a Million views worldwide we made such an impact that the video has now become that of legend, & has been parodied, & imitated many times over. It was even joked about last year in the final season of Glee.

The next video was released which was called DUH! However this time we released it exclusively 2 an internet channel called FilmOn where we created a Live talk show featuring myself as the host & Angel Courtney (DJAC) as my cohost, & eventually moved it 2 my YouTube channel, where it gained a quarter Million views as well. However I still hadn't attempted a radio push.

The next single I pushed even less, in fact I gave away "Mercy" feat B Howard 4 free. It was released over Easter weekend, & as the song was spiritual in nature w a real Gospel choir I just didnt feel right charging the listener 4 the experience, & I never released a video or released it as a radio single, something I would still like 2 do, as its such a terriffic song.

Finally with my next single "Everybody" feat Doc Ice I rolled the dice & put some $ into radio promotions. With the small amount of capitol behind it "Everybody" climbed the independent, & digital radio charts finally making its way 2 the #13 position in both the R&B/Hip Hop & Hot AC music charts. The song maintained the #13 spot 3 weeks in a row. It also climbed 2 the top 40 in the top 200 list. However the charts I climbed were the Digital Radio Tracker & Top Adds charts, which R cool, but still not Cash Box or Billboard.

So with my next single "Remember 222 (Corey's song) " I pushed it even harder (meaning more ad dollars) & with that I earned my 1st ever #1 Hit! The song climbed 2 the top of the indy charts on a Live streaming network called Lucky Star radio which can be heard from LA 2 Australia via the internet, It also gained the attention of the 2nd biggest chart in the world which is Cashbox & made it all the way 2 #23 on that chart. But again still not enough 2 break Billboards top 200.

With all of that said, I have released some strong singles off the forthcoming album, but the best is yet 2 come. I have saved the best 4 NOW!

As I am finally finished w the album & have so many incredible songs left 2 unveil, now is the most important part. I know from the track record I'm on my way 2 breaking into the Billboard charts, I BELIEVE with the right backing and financial support I have got what it takes 2 get my 1st official Billboard hit.

In the coming months it is my intention 2 finally cross over & after 4 decades of recording music, I can finally make my biggest dream a reality & get myself in the mainstream of contemporary pop music. I know that the next single I release can do it! The songs that I am set 2 release will be the most catchy, & playable songs I have ever written & recorded. Espescially with the powerful chart topping artists I have alligned myself with, I know this album can truly be a MONSTER! But the simple fact is I cant do this alone. I just dont have the resources that I need 2 make a run against the giant powerhouses that fuel the radio industry. Not without YOUR HELP!

So that is why I come 2 U, my most loyal fans, who have become my surrogate family. I never had a mother or father 2 support me. I never had a college fund. I never had family security. I never had someone 2 lean on or turn 2 when times got rough. So now in my hour of desperation, I must turn 2 the only support group, the only "family" I have ever know....THE FELDFAM! 

I know with your help I can finally get my music out..... not just 2 U... but 2 millions of people who dont even know that Corey Feldman has records out. This is my only chance 2 get my music heard by the masses. Lets face it, I'm not getting any younger! In a few short years I wont have the stamina, or the physical ability 2 go out there & create a LIVE experience, worthy of what U expect from me. When I put on a show, I give it 100%! I give U my all, my everything! With the success of this album I will launch the most incredible LIVE performance U can imagine. A 2 hr plus show, where I can sing all of the songs U have grown 2 LOVE through the years. 

I will finally perform the songs from my past albums and films that Ive never been able 2 perform LIVE. I will be able 2 perform all the Movie soundtracks, the songs U know & LOVE, & of course many of the Amazing songs from the new album that U havent even heard yet. This tour will be the pinnacle of my live performances as a solo artist. As the album will become the 1 that puts my music on the map 4 the rest of the world.

I know I'm asking a lot. But what choice do I have? Its now or never! Do or Die! And as U know Goonies NEVER SAY DIE! So that leaves me only 1 option....2 DO IT!

So I come 2 U my "Feldfam" in my hour of need & ask U 2 PLEASE CONTRIBUTE 2 help me FINALLY REALIZE my lifelong dreamof sharing my music with not just U but also with the rest of the world. So I can finally spread my message of PEACE & LOVE through the joyous & incredible movement of MUSIC! 

I KNOW wholeheartedly that this album has really got what it takes 2 top the Billboard charts, & the singles that I am preparing 2 release will be the MOST POWERFUL & have the MOST POTENTIAL of any in my long career, with the help of some of todays greatest chart topping artists! This DREAM must become a REALITY but simply said I NEED U 2 STAND BY ME.....because..... Its OUR TIME!



Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Hey FeldFanFam Welcome 2 The "Elev8or 2 Ascension" Fund Raiser Page!
WELCOME!
Thank U 4 stopping by 2 check out my campaign. Here's what's going on:
I know the questions most of U must be thinking right now...questions like...Why have I brought U here? What is this all about? And most importantly Y would a Movie Star like U be asking us 4 $? Dont U have your own $? And Y R U asking us 2 help when U R already successful. Let me do my best 2 answer those questions.
#1. Yes I have been fortunate 2 keep myself steadily working as an actor 4 many decades. 
#2 Yes I have had some success in my career.
However as U probably know making films is my bread & butter, it is how I earn a living. It is my means 2 an end as it were....
Music however is my Love, my Passion, my Heart & soul. Music is the thing I feel I was truly meant 2 do, had my parents not made the choice 2 throw me in front of cameras at the tender age of 3, & kept me there 2 earn a living & financially support my family until I was legally emancipated at the age of 15.
 Acting was NOT my 1st choice. Nor was it my choice at all. However, I have grown 2 LOVE it. Acting is now as much a part of my being as breathing, eating, or drinking. I have been programmed that way. It was inevitable & unavoidable.
But locked deep inside & lying dormant 4 many years, was a burning passion 2 create music! I love writing songs, and I love expressing myself through music. I love producing interesting sounds & creating original beats. I love writing my innermost personal feelings into a  catchy jingle that people can instantly relate 2, & find themselves singing along with. And most of all, I LOVE performing! I love going out on that stage & coming alive with the lights, & the roar of the crowd. I LOVE making the audience scream n shout, & dance the night away. I LOVE the togetherness that can only happen from a LIVE musical experience.
However unfortunate as it was, once I was established as an actor, I found it increasingly harder 4 anybody 2 give my music a chance. Although I started songwriting at 13, & began doing Live concerts at 15, I was not able 2 release my 1st album until I was 22 yrs old via a small indy label. No major  record company would take me seriously. I was never told "The music stinks" or "I just don't hear it", as typical turn downs from major labels go. No! Instead I got lots of weird excuses like "The songs are catchy, but do U have 2 sing them"? or "Not bad 4 an actor, but we don't feel U will have the time 2 dedicate 2 a music career", I was blown off, laughed at, & the doors were continuously slammed in my face. Never because of a lack of talent, but rather because of a prejudice, how could I succeed when so many others had tried before me and failed?
I became a statistic.With albums released by peers like John Travolta, Scott Baio, William Shatner, & Alyssa Milano as examples, the idea of actors making music became laughable, and fell under the catergory of "a joke". That was it I was dead & buried in the music industry before I started.
Fortunately I didnt let that stop my new album project. I have also toured America 4 times in total, twice w my band & 2 solo tours. I have never stopped writing, recording, and performing my music 4 LIVE audiences. Because whenever we toured, U were there 2 C it!
However I have NEVER made music 4 financial gain. I have never become rich making music. In fact my last band album cost me $100,000 just 4 the production of the album, and due 2 lack of promotional & marketing funds I made very little of it back. However it isnt about making $ 4 me, in fact its quite the opposite, I have spent and lost massive amounts of $ by continuing my music career. It is all about the LOVE and passion I derive from simply creating my music. U C  in all of this time I had never earned a commercial or mainstream hit.....UNTIL RECENTLY....
However, I might not have kept going, had nobody gotten it or appreciated it. But thats just it, my true fans who took the time 2 actually listen 2 what my music was saying, immediately fell in love with it. Actual Music critics (tabloids aside) have given consistent positive reviews. Friends & peers have given me much strength & support through positive feedback, but the number 1 thing that has kept me making music is the overwhelming amount of praise & appreciation that I receive from U..THE FANS!
U R the reason I keep going. Your comments, your letters, your words of encouragement. U alone lift me up when I get weak, & scared, & think its just not worth it anymore. But then I do a concert & look out & C thousands of screaming fans, singing along 2 every word, just as I would while watching my favorite artists. Because of this I finally accepted there was an audience 4 what I do, & it seems that audience has continued 2 grow through the years at a rapid pace. Now more than ever I find new fans commenting on age old recordings I thought were long since forgotten.
As many of U know, I have been hard at work 4 quite a while on my new album "ANGELIC 2 THE CORE".  This is not your average musical project. It is a labor of Love. It is the most imaginative, diverse, daring, creative, & personal solo album I have made 2 date. This is a very important work 4 me, This album has literally taken a decade 2 create. I know that is an extraordinary amount of time 2 spend on 1 project, but once U hear the entire album U will understand Y.
"Angelic 2 the Core" is my 1st ever double album. It has 22 songs on it. The album truly shows my diversity as a songwriter & producer, covering all fields of the pop music spectrum. Part pop, part Rock, part EDM, part Hip Hop, and all soul, this album truly has something 4 EVERYBODY!
4 the 1st time in my musical career U will hear songs which were largely recorded privately in my Home Studio. It also happens 2 B the 1st time I have endeavored 2 play all of the instruments on many of the songs. So now U R probably thinking...Well if its done in your home and U R playing all the instruments, how come it took so long?? I will explain....
Yes it is a "solo" album, and yes I am a multi instrumentalist on many of the tracks....HOWEVER....this album is a culmination of a large cast of incredibly talented singers, songwriters, producers, musicians, rappers, and artists, coming together, 2 help me create this.
This album features 5 generations of Hip Hop artists including several legends of the art form. It also features some of the greatest vocalists, & musicians of our time. Here is a list of some of the incredible people who were kind enough 2 dedicate their time, talents, & energy 2 make this dream a reality:
Fred Durst (Limp Bizkit), Kaya Jones (Pussycat Dolls), R1ckone (Black Eyed Peas), Scott Page (Pink Floyd), B.Howard, Kurupt, Snoop Dogg, Doc Ice (Whodini/UTFO),Thomas Van Musser (Black Eyed Peas songwriter) Dave Dunn (Infectous Grooves)The Wizards (Production team) Jon Carin (Pink Floyd), Demario "SB"( New Rap artist), Manny Mijaris (EDM Producer)Thomas Van Musser (writer for Black Eyed Peas), Jon Carin (Pink Floyd), Corey Haim (Film clips), Jameson Newlander (Film clips) Glasses Boys (EDM collective), Michael Debarge (Debarge), Truth Movement, Tommy Daugherty (Death Row recording engineer), Angel Courtney Anne aka DJAC, and of course  Coreys Angels (backing vocalists) plus many more...
In the 10 yrs I've been working on this album I have completely self funded this project 4 my very own label CiFi records.  I created CiFi 4 the purpose of releasing my music direct 2 U, without the financial aid, or creative influence of Big record company executives. I have done this album all on my own 2 insure that U will get 2 hear my vision directly. However after 10 years of financially backing this project, as I near the final stages of its completion, I have come 2 realize that although I have created a work that is sonically superior 2 all of my other solo projects, & has many hit worthy songs, 1 thing is impendingly clear.....I have no budget left 4 Mastering, artwork, duplication, distribution, or marketing.
Now let me explain Y the last part can prevent me from ever getting this album released.
There R enormous costs in the process of making an album. From engineers, 2 instruments, from equipment 2 software, from computers, 2 hard drives, there R many costs that come along with running your own studio, espescially in a modern world where technology is constantly evolving. Constant software updates. Constant additions of plug ins and Pro Tools upgrades can be quite costly. In order 2 keep the music sounding fresh & relevant, U must constantly upgrade & change the sounds in every song 2 continue keeping up w the evolution of sound & technology. An album that takes a decade, means every few years I have had 2 reopen the older songs and update certain sounds. In some cases I have had 2 completely rerecord the song because it has become dated, which wont work with a modern pop album. On top of all of that I have also had 2 pay 4 the release of every single (their have been 5 singles 2 date), the production of both music videos, & the artwork 4 each of the singles, & the distribution costs of each single & the EP.
With all of that said, now that I have finally completed the production work on all 22 songs, I have started budgeting 4 the final stages of the process & 2 my surprise the most expensive part has yet 2 come. 
In the modern age of music, it is a very exciting time 4 independent artists like myself, because now 4 the 1st time in my career, I have been able 2 release singles 2 radio, create and release my own videos, & make my music available 4 digital download all over the world by the push of a button. However 1 thing hasn't changed....
The complete domination of Big Corporations & Big Record Labels who pay massive amounts of advertising $$ 2 propel their artists 2 the top of the Billboard charts. This is Y U rarely C a new artist break in2 the charts, Because the Big Labels have complete worldwide domination over radio. Companies like Clearchannel who own & operate just about every top 40 station in the world, have a stronghold over the industry. Basically the only way 4 a little guy like me 2 B able 2 compete, & actually make a dent, is 2 fight power with power. Which means fighting $ with $.
It seems almost impossible 4 a little known musical artist like me 2 get played on mainstream radio. ALMOST impossible....but not TOTALLY impossible. 
U C the way it works is if a guy like me has the financial backing 2 pay 4 ads in music magazines, radio spots, & radio station magazines like HITS, &  with the right radio promotion team behind me, I can take out enough ads, & make enough noise 2 get the musical directors of those stations 2 notice.
Now if I didnt think the songs had what it takes 2 B contemporary chart toppers, I wouldnt even try 2 compete. But lets take a look at the release of my singles so far & their success rates. The 1st single & video I released was "Ascension Millennium" as my 1st single 4 the album & with my 1st video ever, I immediately gave the rights exclusively 2 MTV. It was a shot n the dark. But 2 my surprise the video garnished the coveted "Buzzworthy" status within the 1st 12 hrs of its release. By the end of 2 weeks it had earned a quarter million views on MTV giving it the claim of a video gone viral. 
At that time I created & launched my own YouTube channel. Within a months time the quarter million views jumped 2 a half a million. By the end of the 2nd month it had earned 750,000 views. Shortly thereafter my channel was taken down by the powers that be citing they had no confirmation that I was really me & that my music was under my official license. When that happened I lost all of the views, & monetary gain that should have been awarded by those views.
So I started over. I am happy 2 say that video is now back up 2 almost 300,000 views again. With well over a Million views worldwide we made such an impact that the video has now become that of legend, & has been parodied, & imitated many times over. It was even joked about last year in the final season of Glee.
The next video was released which was called DUH! However this time we released it exclusively 2 an internet channel called FilmOn where we created a Live talk show featuring myself as the host & Angel Courtney (DJAC) as my cohost, & eventually moved it 2 my YouTube channel, where it gained a quarter Million views as well. However I still hadn't attempted a radio push.
The next single I pushed even less, in fact I gave away "Mercy" feat B Howard 4 free. It was released over Easter weekend, & as the song was spiritual in nature w a real Gospel choir I just didnt feel right charging the listener 4 the experience, & I never released a video or released it as a radio single, something I would still like 2 do, as its such a terriffic song.
Finally with my next single "Everybody" feat Doc Ice I rolled the dice & put some $ into radio promotions. With the small amount of capitol behind it "Everybody" climbed the independent, & digital radio charts finally making its way 2 the #13 position in both the R&B/Hip Hop & Hot AC music charts. The song maintained the #13 spot 3 weeks in a row. It also climbed 2 the top 40 in the top 200 list. However the charts I climbed were the Digital Radio Tracker & Top Adds charts, which R cool, but still not Cash Box or Billboard.
So with my next single "Remember 222 (Corey's song) " I pushed it even harder (meaning more ad dollars) & with that I earned my 1st ever #1 Hit! The song climbed 2 the top of the indy charts on a Live streaming network called Lucky Star radio which can be heard from LA 2 Australia via the internet, It also gained the attention of the 2nd biggest chart in the world which is Cashbox & made it all the way 2 #23 on that chart. But again still not enough 2 break Billboards top 200.
With all of that said, I have released some strong singles off the forthcoming album, but the best is yet 2 come. I have saved the best 4 NOW!
As I am finally finished w the album & have so many incredible songs left 2 unveil, now is the most important part. I know from the track record I'm on my way 2 breaking into the Billboard charts, I BELIEVE with the right backing and financial support I have got what it takes 2 get my 1st official Billboard hit.
In the coming months it is my intention 2 finally cross over & after 4 decades of recording music, I can finally make my biggest dream a reality & get myself in the mainstream of contemporary pop music. I know that the next single I release can do it! The songs that I am set 2 release will be the most catchy, & playable songs I have ever written & recorded. Espescially with the powerful chart topping artists I have alligned myself with, I know this album can truly be a MONSTER! But the simple fact is I cant do this alone. I just dont have the resources that I need 2 make a run against the giant powerhouses that fuel the radio industry. Not without YOUR HELP!
So that is why I come 2 U, my most loyal fans, who have become my surrogate family. I never had a mother or father 2 support me. I never had a college fund. I never had family security. I never had someone 2 lean on or turn 2 when times got rough. So now in my hour of desperation, I must turn 2 the only support group, the only "family" I have ever know....THE FELDFAM! 
I know with your help I can finally get my music out..... not just 2 U... but 2 millions of people who dont even know that Corey Feldman has records out. This is my only chance 2 get my music heard by the masses. Lets face it, I'm not getting any younger! In a few short years I wont have the stamina, or the physical ability 2 go out there & create a LIVE experience, worthy of what U expect from me. When I put on a show, I give it 100%! I give U my all, my everything! With the success of this album I will launch the most incredible LIVE performance U can imagine. A 2 hr plus show, where I can sing all of the songs U have grown 2 LOVE through the years. 
I will finally perform the songs from my past albums and films that Ive never been able 2 perform LIVE. I will be able 2 perform all the Movie soundtracks, the songs U know & LOVE, & of course many of the Amazing songs from the new album that U havent even heard yet. This tour will be the pinnacle of my live performances as a solo artist. As the album will become the 1 that puts my music on the map 4 the rest of the world.
I know I'm asking a lot. But what choice do I have? Its now or never! Do or Die! And as U know Goonies NEVER SAY DIE! So that leaves me only 1 option....2 DO IT!
So I come 2 U my "Feldfam" in my hour of need & ask U 2 PLEASE CONTRIBUTE 2 help me FINALLY REALIZE my lifelong dreamof sharing my music with not just U but also with the rest of the world. So I can finally spread my message of PEACE & LOVE through the joyous & incredible movement of MUSIC! 
I KNOW wholeheartedly that this album has really got what it takes 2 top the Billboard charts, & the singles that I am preparing 2 release will be the MOST POWERFUL & have the MOST POTENTIAL of any in my long career, with the help of some of todays greatest chart topping artists! This DREAM must become a REALITY but simply said I NEED U 2 STAND BY ME.....because..... Its OUR TIME!

story:
Hello.

My name's Yan, yet people who listen to my music mostly know me as Jan Amit. Born and living in Moscow, Russia, I've been producing electronic music since 2009. I'm running off this campaign in order to get closer to my eldest dream and to record an experimental long-play album which would fully unfold my everlasting intention to find a happy mean between electronic tunes, acoustic sounding, ambient moods and sound design. 

Brought up by music of Enigma and Jean-Michael Jarre, at the age of thirteen I started to work out my own vision of the atmospheric sounding. After several tryouts in ambient and chill music, I came to deep experiments with sound design within post-EDM manner. Since then, I make music blending sounds received from almost everywhere: synthesized waveforms, live instruments, reprocessed field recordings, kitchen-made foley - this row seems to have no visible end. All in all, after almost seven years of production, I've decided to take it to a completely new level, either technical or conceptual one, with the aid of my team of instrumentalists.



I've been thinking of starting the album work for the last two years, yet it came to action only under certain vital circumstances. The concept of the album itself refers to hard times of my biography, as well as to the idea of a life as an everlasting peregrination in search of home. Since then, this album turned out to be even more personal than any of my work I made before - that's what makes it really important to be done.

However, unfortunately, I'm unable to make it through without a certain financial backing at the moment. Luckily, music is not all about making money out of it, yet I faced a vast amount of difficulties while planning out what I really aim to do due to a lack of room to move on. The vast majority of required $10,000+ will be put towards studio work with session musicians and necessary hardware. Moreover, I also aim to release the result of this work physically via CD and vinyl - considering merchandize like prints and other cool things, so much expected but also requiring additional expenses (not to mention world shipping of all this stuff, by the way...) - oh, and, finally, to organize a live band tour to present the album for all what's left.



Your support and, what's more, your faith are essential things that motivate me the most to keep up my work, so I'd love to feel certain for contributions to be fairly rewarded. Even a simple dollar brought into this album is already a huge step forward closer to its release. Thus, as soon as I finish all the album work - means September, 2016, - I'll be personally signing some limited edition copies and, moreover, give an opportunity for someone to be directly involved into the production process. Also, since a huge amount of my listeners are producers too, I've made some extra perks for those who may need some encouragement to keep up producing music, such as exclusive sample packs and tutorials which I'm currently working at.


To be honest, for this moment, it's not about getting all the necessary equipment to build a studio from scratch. I perfectly understand that the campaign might not reach its goal, and in that case, I will still sure finish the album but it won't already be the work I'm dreaming of. Anyway, the primary objective is to do it at all cost, but the real goal of it (and I know, you guys who make music know what I mean by this) is to make an A1 thing. And yeah, I understand that some may not able to make a contribution for some reason, and that makes absolutely no trouble. Any support, either a donation or just a click on a share button, is endlessly appreciated. Keep in mind that simply making people know that there's a guy who needs a hand is a real aid too.

Maybe you're a fan of my works I've done before, maybe you're thinking of an investment into the future of this project. At any rate, this album will sure be the most impressive among all my music. I truly hope that things I do make sense.


By the way, the artwork for the album will be made by Funilab, known by paintings for Inspected and Soda Island, on two canvases.

Here's an example of his art, the work for the album will appear here a bit later.
No, but really, this guy is mad.



There's no words I can imagine to express my gratitude to every single person who decided to be a part of this. Seriously, I can't, and not only because English is not my native language.


Thank.
You.
Much.

!

story:
Yokofeu; le groupe, la démarche.

 

Forts d’une participation aux demi-finales des Francouvertes 2015, tout en comptant les retombées scéniques qui ont suivi – BRBR (juillet 2015), Révèle la Relève (octobre 2015) et Coup de cœur francophone (novembre 2015) – les membres de Yokofeu sont fin prêts pour composer et produire leur premier album.

Cet été, le groupe a enregistré un album de six chansons et croit avoir été fidèle à sa véritable démarche, d’abord et avant tout scénique et théâtrale. 

Autrement dit, le groupe a capturé sur album l’énergie et l’urgence de la scène, ce qui fait sa force.

Alors voilà, maintenant que l'album est enregistré, Yokofeu fait appel à vous pour la suite des choses.

Votre contribution servira a financer la deuxième étape des mixes, le mastering, l'impression des vinyles et la fabrication des vêtements à l'effigie du groupe. Nous pensons pouvoir parvenir à nos fins, et aux vôtres, avec un budget de 3000$.

La musique est un matériau vivant qui bouge et se transforme; les membres de Yokofeu n'ont pas voulu perdre cela de vue, et avec ce qu'ils ont entre les mains en ce moment, ils sont persuadés qu'ils pourront vous offrir un record fidèle à leur vision.

Le lancement de l'album se fera vendredi le 28 octobre 2016, stay tuned.

*** À NOTER QUE TOUTES LES CONTREPARTIES COMPRENNENT UN TÉLÉCHARGEMENT GRATUIT DE L'ALBUM VIA BANDCAMP ***

 

Yokofeu : l’esthétique.

 

Yokofeu est fortement attiré par la branche motorique du mouvement krautrock (musique allemande des années soixante-dix) et par le postpunk anglais dans la veine de Joy Division. 

Des groupes comme NEU!, Kraftwerk, Cluster et Can sont des références communes et inspirantes pour les membres du groupe.

Les expérimentations électroniques de l’époque, le caractère aliénant et hypnotique de ces compositions, dû à des répétitions inlassables et à de longues compositions épurées (à d’autres moments surchargées) sont autant d’aspects qui se retrouvent dans la musique de Yokofeu – canalisés, bien évidemment, dans un cadre plus pop.

Les inspirations mentionnées ci-dessus ont mené au son sur lequel Yokofeu a tant travaillé et qui fait son originalité. 

C’est au sortir de ces influences que le groupe a trouvé le support musical idéal pour bien rendre son propos : mettre en musique la violence du monde.

Le chanteur, qui écrit les textes, essaie de ne pas se mettre en scène dans ses paroles. Il met de côté la représentation de soi et s’il utilise le « je », c’est un « je » qui peut être celui de tous. Il mise plutôt sur la musicalité des mots, sur leur pouvoir imaginaire et met en musique des instantanés poétiques qui traitent de désordre, de chaos, d’anarchie, bref, du monde tel qu’il le conçoit.

Vous vous êtes rendus jusqu’ici? Alors merci à l’avance de votre contribution.

Avec amour et à jamais reconnaissant – Yokofeu.

story:
A Short Summary

It's been a long journey. Finally after years of shows, an EP, and hundreds of hours of composing we 're ready to make our first full length record.

O Frontera is a Toronto-based music project lead by Sebastian Cushing (guitar, vocal), Emily Yun Wang (viola, pedals) and Sarah Riegler (cajon, glockenspiel, vocals).  What began as an indie-folk project has blossomed into an experimental collage of classical, avant-garde, minimalism, pop music with a dash of post-rock. 

We've developed a collection of songs that we're incredibly proud of. We've woven in influences from our favourite artists including Radiohead, Sigur Ros, Phillip Glass, Erik Satie, Other Lives and Andrew Bird. 

Now we need your help!

To finally finish our first record we're turning to people like you. A dream of ours from the beginning was to make a full length album. However, as passionate and as dedicated as we are, we can't do it on our own. We're so close to achieving a dream 3 years in the making which you could be a permanent part of.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown.

Studio time and Engineer: $2800

Master Engineer: $500

CDs: : $500

Vinyl Records: $2400

Publicity: $1500

Studio Musicians: $500

Album Art: $300

--------------------------------------------------------------

TOTAL: $8500

Being independent artists affords us a lot of creative freedom -- the flip side of which are financial limitations.

To help us get to our goal we've come up with some unique perks. These include everything from signed copies of our record to us playing a live acoustic set in your home!

Even if we don't reach our goal, everything raised will go towards the record and we'll carry on with shows until we can fund its completion. 


The Impact

We've brought together elements of music that rarely share the same space. It has taken years for us as musicians to cultivate a sound that we strove to achieve from the beginning. We've been performing our new material and getting great feedback--now we want to capture it and share our true voice with the world.

With only $700 and 5 songs, we accomplished so much with our debut EP:

-We received regular airplay on CBC Radio 1.

-We played numerous performances at some of the most reputable live venues in Toronto including The Horseshoe Tavern, The Drake Underground, and Cameron House.

-We've had publishing houses include us in their collections for TV and film.

Imagine what we can accomplish with a proper studio album with support from you! It's a struggle to put into words how excited we are.


Risks & Challenges

Your money deserves to yield results. The last thing we want is for you to contribute to a project that no one gets to listen to. This is why we've made it a priority to leverage our PR contacts so that people hear the album you contributed to.

This includes: 

-Building ties with a PR agency

-Sharing our new music with our CBC Radio 1 contacts for airplay

- Connecting with publications who have promoted us before like Now Magazine and building relationships with new publications like Exclaim! and Chart Attack

-Providing our publishing representatives access to our music for inclusion in other media like film and TV


We recognize that once the record is released we need to hit the ground running to get it in as many ears as possible.


Other Ways You Can Help

We get it. Money is tight. A million people are asking to get a dollar from you, and you'd love to support us but don't have the funds. No problem! Even if you just share our campaign you've done something to help us.
Indiegogo has share tools at the bottom of our page which can help you get the word out.

Thank you all for being a part of our dream,

O Frontera

story:
The Music

Adey is recording her first professionally produced album, a long awaited follow up to 2013's powerful and gorgeous full length offering, Vesica.  

Adey will bring together her stunningly soulful, angelic voice, unreal piano chops and repertoire of soul-stirring, deliciously composed originals to create an album unlike any other. 

With 25+ years of piano playing and singing under her belt, she’s got the talent of Tori and the charisma of Madonna, singing us back to the fullness of who we really are. 

Hailed as an Oracle, her embodiment of raw emotion leaves us with no choice but to feel- deeply. Her performance, a journey to the Underworld and back, will transport you to an oasis for the soul. A place to find the lost pieces of yourself, and if you let it- it will transform your life.

Can't wait to hear the album? Team Adey would love your support in making this project happen with grace and ease!


What We Need & What You Get

Between recording, mixing and mastering (among other things!) professionally produced albums can cost a lot of money, but we've got this one dialed in perfectly to maximize quality while minimizing precious studio time:

  • We're raising $10,000 to cover the studio time, mixing, mastering, album art, and cd production.
  • When you contribute you can choose from a number of amazing perks you won't find anywhere else.
  • If this campaign is successfully funded, Adey will be able to spend the ideal amount of time in the studio to record and capture her vision for this album. If only some of the funds are raised, the process will unfold at a slower pace. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! 

You can help by:

Post this campaign on your Facebook page

Share this campaign with someone who loves gorgeous healing music (like Tori Amos, Joni Mitchell, Madonna, etc).

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
We are Iz'em. A mismatched group of creative, open minded individuals who have combined sounds to create an album that is so diverse it just might make you think. We want to share our art with you and the world. 

Our mission is this:

Art isn't always about what people WANT. Sometimes it's about what they NEED. We have created an album inspired by our daily lives, dirty thoughts, and a deep sense that there is more out there. We want people to listen to this album, and then get out and do something. We are on the brink of an enormous change in our society, but no one is talking about it. Somewhere in between particle accelerators, corporate government takeovers, lost loves, and globalization there is our future. We want to inspire you to start the conversation. 

We have the album heres our challenge:

Before we can launch our album we have to break through a blockade: Advertising. If no one knows who we are we won't be able to get people talking. A basic campaign for a new band to advertise is around $10,000. That is our goal! If we meet our goal we will be able to advertise our music on various platforms such as social media, radio and television. 

Its time for the perkilator: 

There are some great perks we have for you guys!! We want to be honest with you, if you are looking for the best deal it is the $25 perk! If you are looking for more we have that as well. You can have us prank call one of your friends or have us be your b*#%&es for a night and cook you dinner. Our main goal here though is to get the album in your hands so every perk comes with a digital copy of our CD! 

Upon success of this campaign there are a few outcomes:

Chances are we could promote the album and it just isn't what people are looking for. Music and its industry can be as unpredictable as the weather so money alone isn't going to buy us success. 

However, being able to reach out to markets outside of our normal fan base could help get us fans in areas we haven't been able to reach on our own. How can a brand new band draw an audience in an area it hasn't played before? This is a big catch 22 of the industry. If new groups of people see our ads and download our music there is potential we can have fans waiting for us in places we haven't been yet. Booking a tour would become much easier if there are venues that have already heard of us. 

If you have already donated help give the campaign a boost and share it on your social media! We can do this!! 

We want to also thank our fans who have gotten us this far. It has been your support and attendance of our shows week after week that funded the recording process of the album. We love you guys and we can't wait to share this album with you!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hello and welcome to Enerv8's Indiegogo campaign I am Chris KG the founder of Enerv8. This is a band I have believed in since high school and though it has seen it's fair share of band mates I've always remained true to its cause and survival. Music is my passion and I refuse to stop writing it no matter how hard it gets. For awhile we where just a few guys from high school jamming on the weekends but as time went by we started to take things more seriously as writing skills developed. I have always been the main song writer in the bands history so even though the line up has changed I still keep the same sound Enerv8 has to offer to the world.


I took a break from music for a few years while working at a call centre and after awhile decided it was time to get back into the groove of things so I teamed up again with my old friend Mike the original bass player for Enerv8 and Matt whom we met while working at the call centre and discovered he was an amazing singer.

Things where going we'll for a few months we even got another member to join on the drums, it turned out Matt was not only a good singer but also a talented song writer so we teamed up to work toward our first ever EP album and even had plans to start recording in Hamilton Ontario but things fell through as Matt later on had personal matters to attend to and left the band. Things once again fell apart for ENERV8 and after Matt left so did the other members. I took some time off and traveled to Asia where I lived in Thailand for awhile. I worked on a rice farm and while I was living their I kept writing songs on me acoustic guitar. The experience was so inspiring I had to write music about it.  Now I'm back home and have lots of new material.


I just want to take the time to release at the very least one full album as it would be a shame to not share these songs with the rest of the world. I believe I have enough songs to actually finish 2-3 albums but for now I will focus on one and after that if all goes we'll I can release the rest of my songs later on.  I do write lyrics but I am not good at singing and for now I will be releasing an instrumental but I have been talking to a few singers and hopefully I will be able to add some tracks with vocals if not all.


I will always keep writing music no matter what even if things never seem to go far but I believe if I stick with it things will turn around and perhaps if I am fortunate enough I can turn this into a living. Thank you for all your support and helping get the project off the grounds as it means the world to me.


Best wishes,


Chris KG.



What I Need & What You Get

Break down:



I need a total of $4,200 to fund this project. Most of the funds will go towards the recording and mixing of the album. The rest will go towards Ad campaigns to promote the album and also to cover the expense of some of the perks I am giving away as gifts to generous contributors.

Some of the perks will include free digital downloads of the album once it is completed. I also well be giving away Band t-shirts and posters etc. as extra perks.


Cost Break down:

-$2,800 will cover the cost of recording, mixing and producing the actual album.

-$500 will cover the cost of the Ad camgaign I plan on releasing with Google Adsense to promote and get the word out about the album.

-$336 will cover the fee's for Indiegogo and third party payment processing.

-$564 will cover the cost of perks such as t-shirts, posters etc.


Even if I do not reach the full goal I will still write music and use whatever funds I have gained to put towards the album. Depending on how much is actually raised may delay the release date of the album but I will try and work with what I get and if it's to low I will simply run another campaign and hold on to past funds until I have enough to work with. I hope to have this album finished in the next 6 months if enough money is raised :O)


 


Other Ways You Can Help

You can always contribute as money isn's the only ting that matters. Tell your friends and family and anyone you know that might be interested in my music. They can fund my campaign or just fallow me on YouTube (linked in my profile) and even visit my Google Artist Hub Store @ https://play.google.com/store/music/artist/Enerv8?id=Aixsd6lwillvtxchu4bhrsmxhjy&hl=en

Here my music and watch other great videos @  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JJywfg_FY5c

Thank you all for your help and in considering my campaign, get the word out :O)

story:
Help produce Legendary, a documentary by the Young H.O.G.G.S.

  • This Legendary quintet rap group from Compton, is back on the scene. The Young H.O.G.G.S. (Hustlers Out Getting Green Successfully) began working together during their high school years with artists such as Ice Cube, W.C., Mack 10, 50 Cent, Young Jeezy, Juvenile, Bones Thugs n Harmony, Crooked I, and Glasses Malone, as well as super producers Ricc Rude, THX, DJ BattleCat, and Dow Jones.
  • Also, we are putting together a special soundtrack for Legendary, a documentary project, which will be dropping mid August. The project will highlight our humble beginnings, the catastrophic loss of two group members, and the group’s latest developments.
  • We want to continue bringing the best music to YOU, our fans. We can't do this without you and truly need your support.

Why support?

It's very challenging for independent artists/groups in this industry to support their craft and establish funding for projects. With our family, friends, YOU our fans by our side, we believe that we will succeed with our project. Through the documentary, we want to bring out the best of our music and share it with the world.

Why now?

It's now, It's time, It's Legendary.

  • We want to give something back to our families, fans, and the community. Depending on the amount of your support, as a thank you, don't forget to select your perk.
  • The Young H.O.G.G.S have always been on the grind. In the past, we have sold over 50,000 mix tapes, mostly out of our trunks.
  • Our most successful project to date was the several tracks we've had on Mack 10's album Ghetto, Gutta, and Gangster, released in 2003.
  • Recently, we have built some positive momentum with our newest street single and video MAX ME OUT through an all-digital release on June 1, 2015.
  • Straight out of Compton, The Young H.O.G.G.S want to show the world just how Legendary the group really is. 

Where does your money go?

Our $5,000 goal will help us with:

  • 10-14 days in the studio with the music engineer (Film production and recording studio time for soundtrack and documentary).
  • Pressing for our first ever  DVD release!  Plus CDs, T-shirts, etc.
  • A modest budget to work with a publicist on the documentary and soundtrack release.

Here is how you can help spread the word!

Can't afford to support the movement?  No problem!  You can support by telling your friends on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter why they should help us take our group even further.  Share our campaign and music video on social media as many places as you can!

story:
Italian Version

English version below

Il progetto

Valmaradio: la radio dei giovani per i giovani!

Valmaradio nasce da un'idea di alcuni ragazzi della campagna Riminese (Valmarecchia) che vogliono un luogo dove ritrovarsi e far sentire la propria voce. Il progetto? Creare una radio che parli dei giovani e ai giovani.

Prima di tutto è uno spazio di aggregazione e divertimento (che si sa, in campagna non c'è molto da fare per i ragazzi) ma è anche un'occasione per riflettere su ciò che è dentro e fuori da noi e raccontarlo nel linguaggio radiofonico.

In una società che non ha più speranze nel futuro Valmaradio vuole essere un'occasione per confrontarsi, raccontarsi e sognare in grande!

La storia

ValmaRadio nasce nell'autunno 2014 quando un gruppo di giovani di Villa Verucchio (RN), incoraggiato dal parroco e dalle istituzioni del paese, decide di fondare una radio.

Subito si sparge la voce e si forma un primo nucleo che, senza alcuna competenza tecnica, ma con tanta voglia di fare e di imparare, comincia a informarsi e chiedere aiuto ma soprattutto a interrogarsi su cosa fare. Già, perché avere un microfono non basta, bisogna sapere cosa dire.

Cose da dire ce ne sono tante e diverse! Nasce così l’idea di una radio radicata nel territorio, ma che guardi ben oltre i confini del paese! Una radio che passi molta musica di ogni genere, lasciando anche spazio a racconti, storie e notizie. Una radio aperta a tutti, che possa diventare un punto di riferimento per i giovani che vogliono far sentire la propria musica e la propria voce ben più lontano delle quattro sedie di un bar.

Il nome è presto detto e anche il motto nasce naturalmente.

ValmaRadio

…perché la musica è parecchia in Valmarecchia!

Il gruppo cresce ed emergono le prime idee per i programmi, mentre lo studio della radio comincia a prendere forma all’interno del campanile di Villa Verucchio, grazie alle attrezzature gentilmente donate da tanti amici.

Ad aprile 2015, dopo un mesetto di rodaggio, ValmaRadio comincia a trasmettere sui 103.85 FM in Valmarecchia e in streaming dal sito www.valmaradio.com.

Stiamo ancora crescendo e per farlo abbiamo bisogno anche di te!

Il tuo contributo

Adesso tocca a te!

Con il tuo contributo aiuterai il team di ValmaRadio a raggiungere i 10.000€ necessari ad allestire degli studi accoglienti e funzionali, che permettano alla radio di farsi sentire forte e chiara (e di restituire agli spazientiti proprietari tutte le attrezzature prese in prestito!).

Nello specifico, il tuo contributo ci aiuterà a sostenere le spese per:

- Mixer studio

- Cuffie 

- Mixer portatile per gli eventi live

- PC portatile per gli eventi live

- Stand per gli eventi live

- Insonorizzazione e allestimento studio

La meta dei 10.000€ è ambiziosa e, anche qualora non venisse raggiunta, tutti i soldi raccolti andranno a finanziare l'acquisto delle attrezzature.

Ti piace il nostro progetto, ma non puoi contribuire economicamente? Nessun problema! Puoi aiutare ValmaRadio spargendo la voce! Condividi questa campagna sui social e invita i tuoi amici a contribuire.

-------------------------

English version

The Project

Valmaradio: the young radio for young people

Valmaradio project started thanks to some guys from Marecchia Valley ( in the countryside of Rimini, Italy) who needed an occasion to express themselves. The idea was to create a radio station to speak about young people and to young people.

First of all a place where we can meet and have fun (there's no much to do for young people in countryside) but also an opportunity to think about what is inside us and around us and to tell everyone by mean of the radio.

In a society who has lost its hope in future, Valmaradio wants to give a chance to kids to discuss, to talk about themselves and to make big dreams!

Our history

Valmaradio born in the autumn 2014 when a group of kids from Villa Verucchio (a town near Rimini), encouraged by the priest and by local institutions, decided to found a radio station.

Once words got out a first group of people started meeting. Without any technical knowledge, but with strong will to learn, they began looking for help and information and above all to ask themselves what to do. Because a microphone is not enough if you don't know what to say.

They realized they had a lot of things to say and they decided to create a radio with its root in the local community but with a strong will to broaden its horizons. They want to transmit al kinds of music and still leaving space for updates, news, and stories. They dreamt of a radio open to anyone who wish to speak up and to be heard way more far than the local bar.

Name and motto come easily:

ValmaRadio

…perché la musica è parecchia in Valmarecchia! (Because there is a lot of music in Valmarecchia!)

More people joined the team and they came up with the first ideas for the programming, in the meantime the radio station is set inside Villa Verucchio bell tower, thanks to many generous friends who donated the initial equipment.

In April 2015 Valmaradio took its first steps and transmit on 103.85 FM for the local area and online on www.valmaradio.com

We are moving forward but the way is still long and we need your help, too!

Your contribution

Now it's your turn!

With your contribution you will help Valmaradio to earn enough money to set up comfortable and functioning spaces that will allow us to speak out loud (and to return all the borrowed equipment to the too much patient owners!).

In particular, your contribution will be necessary to sustain the cost of:

-sound mixer for the station

-headphones

-portable mixer for live events

-laptop for live events

-stand for live events

-radio station setting up and soundproofing

€10.000 is an ambitious goal and in case we won't reach it, all the raised money will be used to buy new equipment.


Do you like our project but you can't donate? Don't worry! You can help Valmaradio anyway. Just share this campaign on social networks and invite your friends to contribute.

story:
"Arctic" is the debut CD of a unique jazz sextet, Ratatet.

Would you like to support  a new, out of the mainstream, creative project?

Ratatet is a drummer led sextet with a front-line of bassoon, trombone and vibes; and a traditional back-line of keys, bass and drums. This is a unique and exciting  configuration for a jazz group, and it allows for some fresh sonic possibilities.

Would you like to see jazz continue to grow and evolve?

The music on "Arctic" is all original and doesn't easily fit into pre-existing categories such as "mainstream", "fusion"," avant-garde", "acid jazz" or " latin-jazz". It is melodic, rhythmic, complex, and rich. We borrow inspiration, rhythms and sonorities from South America, classical music, pop, jazz and movie scores.

Would you like to support a creative project that contributes a percentage of sales to a worthwhile cause?

 10% of all "Arctic" sales from the www.ratatet.com website will go to Relay for a Cure of The American Cancer Society  to aid in the fight against cancer. Several members of the band have lost family members to cancer.

Would you like to help a group of stellar musicians continue to thrive?

Ratatet is Paul Hanson on bassoon, John Gove on trombone, Dillon Vado on vibes, Greg Sankovich on keys, Jeff Denson on bass and vocals and leader Alan Hall on drums. Collectively we've worked with a who's who of talented artists, groups and organizations including: Bela Fleck, Cirque du Soleil, Art Lande, Lee Konitz, Kenny Werner, Cuong Vu, The Paul Dresher Ensemble, The Oakland Symphony, Ray Charles, Kai Eckhardt, Kit Walker, Paul McCandless.

Are you a visual art fan?
Ratatet's drummer and leader, Alan Hall, is also a visual artist in mixed-media, photography and painting. Some of his art work is offered in our contributor incentive packages.
