story:
James Everett - A Timeless Season Project

Hello friends, I am writing to you for two purposes; the first is to introduce you to what I’ve been working on, and the second is to request your support in bringing my new album  “A Timeless Season” to fruition.

Currently, I’m working with some of the Bay Area’s top musicians on my very first Christmas recording project called a Timeless Season, which includes original songs as well as my own covers of popular Christmas standards. The completion is targeted for Mid August 2016 in order to generate buzz and release it in time for the holiday season. I also plan on producing a music video to accompany the campaign.


My goal is to raise $25,000 before August 15, 2016. 

Accomplishing this alone while working, rehearsing, and spending countless hours driving all over the bay area, has proven to be incredibly challenging. So I’ve decided to reach out to you... my friends, clients and the community that I love for financial support. Your contributions would play a major role in the completion and overall success of my dream project. 


Here’s an idea of what your contributions will greatly help pay for:

Musicians  

Studio time

Mixing 

Mastering

Production

Filming and Editing

Artwork

CD manufacturing 

Marketing / PR

I’ll be using the platforms of CD Baby, iTunes, Reverb Nation, Google Play, You Tube and several other social media (digital streaming) networks to build an audience and hopefully catch someone’s ear that can push my music further (record label, etc). I believe in my vision, my music, and the supportive community that surrounds me. 

 Plus, every year for decades to come a portion of the revenue generated from "A Timeless Season" will be donated to San Francisco and Oakland Food Pantries, assisting those struggling with  homelessness and hunger. That’s my independent artist game changer plan. Help me to help others.


The Impact

As a kid living in a single famly household with five siblings,  I would listen to just about anything musically.  I would sing songs, write them and then hide them, because we weren't allowed to sing songs outside of our religious beliefs.  But I never stopped writing or singing. 

It was my big sister who would always encourage me to keep singing. Today, she's battling with stage three ovarian cancer. Still has a ways to go, but she’s doing much better.  She's a fighter. Her strength inspires me to believe that something amazing will come out of making this dream project a reality. I’m doing this for her, but also musically for me as a singer and songwriter. I have a lot to be grateful for and to sing about. I have hundreds of original songs to share with the world. 


Risks & Challenges

I realize that my journey through song thrives on hope, unity, friendships and support. I also understand that such financial decisions need to be a two-way street and because of this, I am always ready, willing, and able to help my generous donors receive the recognition they deserve. If the campaign doesn't reach it's funding goal, I will still get the album made. There might be a few set-backs on things like publicity, artwork and video clips, but I am in this 100% committed and you will recieve all of your rewards as promised regardless. I appreciate your trusting spirit and support in that matter.

As a contributor, you would have the opportunity to attend live recording sessions via Webinar, Skype or in person. You'll be invited to attend the CD release party, local performances and receive a signed CD with a big thank you above your name as a contributor printed on the back. Additional opportunities include producer credits and more... 

I'm really excited and nervous, but I can see the light. Thank you for your time, consideration and generosity. 

Cheers,
James Everett (aka, JJ)    Singer-Songerwriter

P.S... Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute please feel free to get the word out, tell a friend or a coworker. Share the campaign vid with FB friends. Tell them to share as well. Email the link. Let's make some noise! Oh yeah, and don't forget to use the indiegogo share tools!

story:
WHAT IS MUSICSOUL?

"The MusicSoul is a social entrepreneurship  developer and promoter of  independent musical talent." The project was started by David Noceda, a passionate of music in 2013 as an idea of social network different to Facebook or Reverbnation that could help new musicians to sell their albums, products and even be hired.

Since 2014, our team is creating a revolutionary proposal that seeks help musicians in their development and promotion to ease their  way to success. In over a year, we have managed to bring together 135 musical projects of Latin America on our website by providing presentations, contracts, professional projection and close contact with their fans. 


Interview with a Mexican band :Coctel Calavera

Our business model is designed to consider three important parts of music: fans, artists and producers, thus achieving contribute to creating an ecosystem for independent talent who want to succeed in their career.

That's why we need your support to continue to fulfill the dreams of thousands of musicians further through the development of a mobile application that will generate royalties and contract opportunities as well as performing concerts online.

Your contribution will be not only for that, because it will allow fans of the independent scene, meet new proposals for high musical value and invest in those that are more to their liking. In addition, resources will be allocated in 100% to the consolidation of our website and the mobile application within one year. Time where you will see the results on a few months, due to the great commitment of our team with the project. e

WHY WE NEED THE MONEY?

When David Noceda and David Limon started the idea, it was so difficult to find people interested on the developing of the website. Many people and musicians tought we were going to steal their music, even when they really need more spaces for presentations. 
In 2014 we notice that the cost of inversion was very high, so we organized concerts and tours to raise money. Our first inversion was of $5,000 for the website, then we planned the "MusicSoul Beyond the Walls" Festival in the city of Puebla. The concert was so successful that many musicians around Mexico contacted us. Right now we have on the website bands and solo projects from: Coahuila, Baja California, Puebla, Mexico City, Tabasco, Yucatán, Quintana Roo, Monterrey, Sonora, Veracruz, Chiapas and even from Argentin or Los Angeles.
This year, we need more money for the developing and consolidation of the app not only in Mexico, because we want to expand to North America and Europe. The app is just the first part of MusicSoul, in 2 years we want to produce and create a company for independent music plus an own place for concerts. The cost of the app is high as a result of  the lack of programmers in our contry. So it would be amazing if other people get involved into the project.

REDEFINING MUSIC

If you are an independent musician or you have friends in the business, surely you'll be interested in MusicSoul.

This year we have launched a campaign to raise USD $ 19,000 for the development and consolidation of our website and the creation of a mobile application (www.music-soul.com). 

Home of website


Artist profile



WEBSITE AND MOBILE APPLICATION PROJECT


HOW DOES IT WORK?

MusicSoul has created a website for :

  • Musicians
  • Fans or followers
  • Recording Studios
  • Managers

The platform seeks to connect these four elements to establish some kind of relationship that allows them to develop in the field of music.

There are two types of accounts for musicians.

a) Begginers: They have a free profile in the website, where they can share music, videos, photos and comments.

b ) Semi-professional musicians: This accounts are tested by the quality of the songs and image. If the account is approved the artist obtained royalties for every number of Plays in his songs , as well as gains for contracts or  product sales. Our most innovative proposal are the online concerts, that will allow musicians to receive donations for their followers if the concert is of their liking. MusicSoul will not stay with those gains,  because they will go directly to the musicians.

There are two types of accounts for fans or followers.

a) Freemium: Fans can access to a limited profile of the artist and listen music for 5 hours per day.

b)Membership: followers pay for a suscription  and they can access to an unlimited version of MusicSoul where they have original independent music all day and discounts on the purchase of products. They participate giving votes for their favorite bands and help them to become trends.  With this membership, fans contribute to the career of an artist, so they become an important part of their life.

Recording Studios or Producers have two types of accounts

a) Freemium: Producers can offer their services on a limited version.

b) Membership: Producers offer their services without restriction and MusicSoul handle the advertisement of them on the different platforms to get customers quickly.

Managers are also included in our proposal,  we offer them the posibility to contact groups worldwide and reach agreements to organize concerts together.

SOCIAL IMPACT

Our campaign offers an alternative to the musicians to promote themselves. Currently the most used platforms to disseminate original music are: Facebook, Spotify, SoundCloud, ReverbNation, Youtube and Myspace. However, for beginning artists it is too expensive to pay for advertising to these social networks.

On the other hand, these companies do not offer guarantees to the musicians that they will facilitate its path to success. That's why MusicSoul is a unique space for independent music from different genres, which is committed to make a possitive change into the lives of people through music.

SUCCESS STORIES / CONCERTS OF MUSICSOUL

REWARDS

Some of the rewards we have for you!

  

                                  





RISKS AND DIFFICULTIES

Since 2014, MusicSoul has faced enormous difficulties. Our first challenge was to develop the website, this because programmers believed that the project was not good enough and would not generate gains in a short period of time. It was then that we started organizing concerts with different bands of Mexico to raise funds to build the website to function as a social network where artists can showcase their music, presentations, videos and even travel on a tour.

At first, some radio stations decided not to support us because we did not have enough resources to pay the advertising fee. Bars and concert halls not trust in our idea and refused to cooperate with us, and we also had to convince many musicians that MusicSoul offered something really different for the independent music scene.

In Mexico the music scene remains in the hands of record companies or the national television, so independent music has to fight against it. On the other hand, bands or solo projects suffer the informality of the promoters or managers who usually steal their money.

MusicSoul has contacted more than 1,000 independent music projects in Latin America, of which only 135 have decided to collaborate with us. These 135 projects have achieved concerts, contracts, recordings and photographic sessions to promote their music.

Our core values ​​are honesty, hard work, discipline , professionalism and respect. That is why we seek only musical proposals that think like us , in addition to seeking to change the lives of people with his songs and positively impact the world.


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If you like our project you can help us sharing it on social networks. We need our project reaches more people around the world to change the music industry, so invite your friends and family to participate.

You can find our social networks, youtube account and official website at the top. We believe that you can change history as we are doing it.

THANKS FOR SHARING...

story:
Walk the Earth in Harmony

Medicine Music birthed from a sacred space of healing, where I have studied with shamanic traditions and magical plants. Fueled by adventures across the world and crafted in my current home, a healing center I built in the Amazon jungle. It's time for this music to spread it's wings, for the message and vibrations to inspire more love and evolution wherever it may land.

It won't take much to set these sounds free, let's walk the earth in harmony.

How you can help ?
I am looking to raise $3000USD to travel to Cuzco and record an album. This album will be shared with you, my supporters and then continue to be sold through our healing center El Jardin de la Paz  to raise further funds for our philanthropic projects; preserving nearby rainforest, medicinal plants and supporting the local indigenous community. Also once the album is produced I have plans to create some amazing inspirational music videos also. 
What will this album change in the world?
I was born in England,  spent years surfing, traveling and exploring the natural beauty of this world. Eventually my path led to discovering the way sacred plants are gateways to spirit that can teach and heal, ever since I have studied these shamanic traditions in Peru. 

The plant spirits have taught me simple truths that I share through my music; The value of an open heart, harmony with nature, trust in self, love, humility, community, family, spirit, kindness, courage.

I've seen the way these sounds can inspire deep healing and transformation. Music is medicine.

More positivity, more love, more uplifting vibrational medicine that's a gift this world needs right now. A message and a feeling that can open hearts to the beauty within us all, and from that place a natural impulse for good action arises, kindness and harmony.

This is my purpose, this is how I serve.

    How else can you help?
    If you cant donate with money please spread the word of this campaign, share the video, spread the music. Listen, enjoy, dance and open your heart to the inspiration around you.  Blessings!

story:
What Is #HoldOn Movement?

We are group of artists and passionate individuals who came together to create a movement to help end VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN & GIRLS, and help raise SUICIDE AWARENESS (visit HoldOnMovement.org for more info).  You can help us do that!

T.E.A.R.S.

I am T.E.A.R.S., the artist who wrote and recorded the song "Hold On."  I'm a Boston native, currently residing in Los Angeles, CA.  My purpose for starting this movement is to do my part as an artist and songwriter to bring these two important causes to the forefront of music.  In my life, I've experienced personally my mom and my sister go through physical abuse.  I have female loved ones who were sexually abused, and I understand the pain that it causes in so many ways.  I also have family and friends who have been affected by suicide and attempted suicide.  The hurt and hopelessness that causes one to feel that their only option is ending their life - is a reality that too many people struggle with today.  So for me, these are two important issues that need to be addressed in the right way, and it's my honor to be a leader in this movement through my music.

The Campaign In Short

Our campaign is aimed at raising funds to promote the single "Hold On" and the Official Music Video for the song.  We are reaching out to everyone on social media to collectively seek as much support as possible.  The financial contributions will tremendously help us in our efforts to get this song heard/played, as well as the video seen, by hopefully millions!  If we hit our goal, we will be able to potentially get this song aired on FM and Online Radio, and the music video aired on Television (as well as seen on various Online Platforms).

Simply put: WE NEED YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS TO HELP US SPREAD THE MESSAGE OF "HOLD ON" THROUGHOUT THE WORLD!

The Funds

We are looking to raise $12,000 with this campaign.  All of the funds we collect will be used to promote and advertise the song "Hold On", the Music Video, and The Movement.  Our strategy is to run promoted campaigns on Twitter, Facebook, and YouTube, as well as pay blog sites to spotlight the song, the video, and our movement.  We will also utilize these funds to pay for a service that will distribute the music video to television networks (note: making it on the air is not guaranteed, but we're excited and hopeful).  This should hopefully generate a buzz around the hashtag "#HoldOn" and our movement.

Aside from the social media paid campaigns and the blog advertisement, we will be using the funds to generate traffic to the song (on iTunes) and drive single sales.  Ultimately, our goal is TO RAISE $1 MILLION THROUGH 100% OF THE PROCEEDS OF THE SONG AND OTHER DONATIONS - WHICH WILL BE DONATED TO RAINN.org AND SAVE.org (equally).  For further information about this, please visit our website www.HoldOnMovement.org.

The Perks

Now the juicy part!  Every contributor will receive a shout out on our Hold On Movement Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram pages.  Some contributors will receive a personal shout out on our movement's website, and even a personal shout out from my official Twitter and Instagram pages!!  For those who contribute substantially, we will be sending #HoldOn wristbands, signed photographs of yours truly (not that full of myself, just saying...), and arranging a Skype session to discuss ways to further the movement with us!!!

My True Vision

#HoldOn Movement is really about taking a stand and encouraging people.  I know that one song cannot change the entire world, but somehow I'm inspired to believe that with a lot of people's support this song can change many people's lives!  I really believe that.  I wrote the song so that my mom and my sister can hear it and be inspired.  I wrote it so that every woman and every girl can hear it and be inspired!  I wrote it so that no matter what gender you are, everyone can relate to it and find hope and strength in themselves to hold on!!

I have to say that I DO want to change the world…but I can't do it by myself, and I do not have the funds to promote my message the way it needs to be promoted.  I really hope that those of you who dared to click on the link you received and continued to read this far will find it in your hearts to bless me and my team with a contribution so we can bring our message and music to the world!

Will The Funding Work?

The real answer is, I don't know.

I have invested over $5,000 of my personal money and I have no way of determining if people will listen to the song, let alone buy it so that I can donate to charity.  All I can do is strategically plan to use the funds in a way that will reach a specific audience and hope that they like the song and watch the video.  

At the end of the day, its not about me as an artist getting my song or video played. Its about people thinking about the issues that our movement represents, and being inspired by the message within the song…HOLD ON!  If we can change someone's life or motivate them to overcome their current circumstances, then we succeeded - and you will be a vital part of that success.


Tell A Friend

If you can contribute to this campaign, THANK YOU!  If you cannot contribute financially, you can still help us.

Please take a few moments and tweet or post a message with the link to our IndieGoGo Campaign, the song on iTunes, and the video.  Share it with your friends and let them know what we are doing.  You may end up inspiring someone to hold on!

THANK YOU!

THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

We are The Dear Kills and we need your help! With our 2015 west coast tour fast approaching, the thought of our lack of accommodations is frightening! With your help, acquiring a safe place to lay our heads and stash our gear doesn't seem so out of reach. 

What We Need

We are humbly hoping to raise $3000 to put towards a tour trailer, but any contribution will be beneficial to our cause. Any additional funds we receive will be put towards our first western Canadian tour. With your help, we will have a comfortable place to sleep out of the elements and peace of mind that our belongings will be safe and secure. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially to our cause, we would love to see you out at our shows. We owe our success 100% to our fans, friends and family and your support means the world to us. Even by sharing this link you're helping us in a huge way. Thank you!! 


- The Dear Kills

story:
About the band

Daily Basis is a rock band from Los Angeles California founded by Tommy & Darrel Dearth. Their first album, "Music Asylum," pushed the limits of the rock genre to the next level. "Tomorrow Never Comes," their new, upcoming single, incorporates a full orchestra as well as electronics; bringing a revolutionary new approach to rock music. With this release, Daily Basis is going to the next level with their epic, action-packed music video that is only possible with your support! Are you ready to rock?!

Treatment

An asteroid hits the city. The city burns. 

Tommy, Darrel, Juan and Gaku are in the middle of chaos and destruction. They must figure out what is happening.  People are running in one direction as everything around them burns.  Zombie-like people are attacking just behind them. We follow each character and their fight to survive.

They must fight their way out and find a safe zone. They reach a cliff, a drop-off, only to realize that the world is coming to an end.


(1st draft of script pg. 1 of 14)


Storyboard example



Concept special effects makeup



We need your help and support!

To move forward and make this music video a reality, we need your help in raising funds to pay for the extra costs. Part of the costs include securing locations, renting equipment, dressing our set, and making sure our cast and crew are taken care of. 

Costs:

Pre-production
1. Script
2. Storyboard
3. Casting
4. Location
5. Equipment rental
6. Insurance
7. Set design - props, insurance

Production
1. Cast + Crew (Max Days: 3)(12hr shoots)
2. Craft Services

Post Production
1. Picture Editing
2. Visual Effects
3. ADR
4. Sound Editing

Meet the band!

    Tommy Dearth           Darrel Dearth            Juan Portillo              Gaku Murata

    Singer/Guiratist               Drummer                          Bassist                         Guitarist
story_txt:
About the band

Daily Basis is a rock band from Los
Angeles California founded by Tommy & Darrel Dearth. Their first album,
"Music Asylum," pushed the limits of the rock genre to the next level. "Tomorrow Never Comes," their new, upcoming single, incorporates a full
orchestra as well as electronics; bringing a revolutionary new approach to rock music. With this release, Daily Basis is going to the next level with their epic, action-packed music video that is only possible with your support! Are you ready to
rock?!


TreatmentAn asteroid hits the city. The city burns. Tommy, Darrel, Juan and Gaku are in the middle of chaos and destruction. They must figure out what is happening.  People are running in one direction as everything around them burns.  Zombie-like people are attacking just behind them. We follow each character and their fight to survive.They must fight their way out and find a safe zone. They reach a cliff, a drop-off, only to realize that the world is coming to an end.
(1st draft of script pg. 1 of 14)



Storyboard example


Concept special effects makeup








  We need your help and support! To move forward and make this music video a reality, we need your help in raising funds to pay for the extra costs. Part of the costs include securing locations, renting equipment, dressing our set, and making sure our cast and crew are taken care of.  Costs:Pre-production
1. Script2. Storyboard3. Casting4. Location5. Equipment rental6. Insurance7. Set design - props, insuranceProduction1. Cast + Crew (Max Days: 3)(12hr shoots)2. Craft ServicesPost Production
1. Picture Editing2. Visual Effects3. ADR4. Sound Editing

Meet the band!


    Tommy Dearth           Darrel Dearth            Juan Portillo              Gaku Murata    Singer/Guiratist               Drummer                          Bassist                         Guitarist

story:
If you can believe it, you can achieve it!

Life is tough, for some, there is no doubt about that. But we believe humans are tougher!
We believe the human spirit is strong, powerful & irresistible.
We believe any human being with the right mindset can achieve ANYTHING they desire to achieve in this world.
We create motivational speeches and motivational music to remind everyone, that needs reading of this one very powerful principle:
You Can Achieve Anything That You BELIEVE IS POSSIBLE.

 


              


All of us go through tough times, failures, set backs and struggles.

But we also get to decide how we choose to react to these events. Some may be tougher than others, some may have been dealt a tougher hand than most, but we ALL decide on our own how we choose to live our lives... In gratitude of what we do have, or in complaining of what we don't.

Through our music and through our speeches, we try to remind everyone they can live life on their terms.

We try to inspire and motivate people to achieve THEIR BEST. To live fully. To stay strong and show character through the hard times, so you can enjoy the good times.




Lets Make A Difference Together

Every day we receive emails, social media messages, youtube comments telling us what an impact our music and videos have had on peoples lives…

“This is life changing ...thank you for sharing this”
“Love your videos!!! Really give me the strength to push for my dreams with everything I have”
”This was exceptionally inspiring. Thank you"
"This Gets me through anythng. Thanks Great work”

We may have only been alive for 5 months but our music and motivational speeches are already having a positive impact on so many lives…



What We Do:

It’s Life Inspiration, It’s Workout Motivation... but it is SO MUCH MORE than that to so many people. It helps inspire them to bigger & better things in their lives... it gives them the courage to try something, or maybe just the strength to get through the day.

We create unique motivational speeches that are blended with powerful, emotional music to make unique inspirational tracks which inspire many worldwide.
Our work is already making a big impact on many lives, we know that because we are told every day via email, private and public messages.

How You Can Help:

  • Share This Campaign On Your Social Media, Facebook or Twitter.
  • Spread The Word about Fearless Motivation on Social Media, Facebook or Twitter
  • Share one of our YouTube Videos, SoundCloud or Spotify Music Tracks
  • Stay Connected with us - Be our friend on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram
  • Support our music by purchasing tracks on iTunes, Google Play or Amazon MP3
  • GIVE YOUR FEEDBACK! What would you like to see us do? What is important to you? We love getting feedback from our fans. Some of our greatest decisions have come about through criticism and honesty from our fans, nothing is off limits. 

Our Vision

Our Vision is to create the Number 1 Motivational Website & Best Motivational Music Tracks in the world!

Above all of that, we want to make a positive impact on as many lives as possible.
We already know we are doing that, but we want to do it on a much larger scale. Personally i know these type of tracks and various motivational speakers changed my life, my aim is to do the same for others.

story:
Our choir, Le Cantanti di Chicago ("The Singing Women of Chicago"), was founded in 2014 by  Dhilanthi Fernando, who is also the director. A group of very diverse women, ranging in age from teenagers to octogenarians, from very different ethnic, racial and regional backgrounds, we strive to use our voices to uplift the human spirit and bring wholeness to our lives, and through that, to the world. We are proud to have been selected to participate in the 2017 Serenade! Choral Festival, in Washington DC. This festival is organized by Classical Movements, Inc., in partnership with the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, to celebrate the 100th birthday of President John F. Kennedy and founding of the Peace Corps. We are thrilled and honored to be selected, but we need your generous support to make our trip a reality.

We will join select choirs from the US and around the world to participate in performances and service projects in the Washington, D.C.,area from June 27 to July 3, 2017. The choirs will also participate in educational events focused on how music promotes friendship, peace, and cultural diplomacy, and how it brings joy and wholeness to all the peoples of our world.

The festival culminates in a Massed Choir Grand Finale at the Kennedy Center, on July 3, with Joshua Habermann, Director of the Dallas Symphony Chorus and Santa Fe Desert Chorale, conducting a choral work specially commissioned for the festival.

With hope and optimism, we have committed to participating in this once in a lifetime opportunity, and we request your help to raise a total of $48,000, which will fully fund our entire choir’s expenses, including room and board and round trip airfare, and other miscellaneous expenses that will arise. 

You can support our work in sharing the joy of music and promoting the ideals President Kennedy championed—Courage, Freedom, Justice, Service, and Gratitude—by contributing at any level that is comfortable for you. Please consider funding a full travel scholarship for a singer ($1700) or a partial scholarship in any amount. 

Le Cantanti di Chicago is a 501(c)(3) organization. Thus, your contribution will be tax-deductible.

This celebration provides Le Cantanti an unparalleled opportunity to fulfill our mission to “use our voices to uplift the human spirit and to support causes that promote peace, hope, and wholeness in the world.”  By supporting our trip, you help bring our choir and the city of Chicago to the national stage.

Gratefully,

The Women of Le Cantanti di Chicago

story:
A Left-Handed Way

I am Thomas Newbold and I grew up in Petaluma in the north San Francisco bay area. I have lived in Southern California and studied Music, Percussion Performance, and Music Therapy since the year 2000. The longer I live in So-Cal the more I appreciate family and romanticize the bay as the beautiful place where I grew up and learned to think and feel.

I have written songs that represent this love for people, music, the bay area, California, nature, and how all these things effect us in the human experience. I have created this album and am asking for help getting it off the ground so that I can share it with any and all who may enjoy it. 

If I didn't think there was a real chance of you liking this record, I promise, I would never ask.

Why $4230?

I am conservatively estimating everything at $5000 and have raised $770 at a kickoff event. Below is a detailed breakdown of where the money will go.

Recording/Engineering/Mastering: $2000

I have a professional studio lined up with a platinum record producer and engineer who is offering recording, mixing, and mastering, at the extremely reduced price of $250 per song (total!). I am looking to do 8 songs for an approximately 40 minute album to fit on LPs.

Musicians: $1000

Most of the instruments will be played by myself and my producer/multi-instrumentalist, Doug Grean. I will be seeking a Pedal Steel Guitarist (This is one of my biggest dreams for the record), and Hammond Organ player who I am hoping will enjoy the project enough to join in "on the cheap."

LP and CD manufacturing: $2000

I have a quote for small run CD manufacturing complete with gate-fold jacket and booklet insert (for artwork, lyrics, thank you's, etc.)  $700 for 100 CDs/Booklets/Jackets

I have a quote for small run vinyl manufacturing with sleeve, plain jacket with black writing, and cellophane wrap: $1300 for 100 (White Vinyl with white writing on a black label).

The Impact

If you've ever seen me perform in the rock/pop/country realm then, hopefully, you agree that I always do my very best to leave my heart and soul on the stage and provide the best renditions possible of any music, mine or covered. This project will provide a new avenue for creative expression and you can be a part of fostering and sharing in this endeavor. It could potentially springboard a new touring and performing act, many more new records, or at the very least more audience-inclusive, intimate house concerts and parties. I'm not out to get rich and famous, I'm here to share and entertain. Just to create good, homemade, enjoyable music.

Risks & Challenges

There is always some risk involved in any project creative or otherwise. My biggest fear is that if I don't raise enough money to really get this thing cranking that I may take too long working on it, while also caring for my twins and budgeting for our family life. I promise to do my very best to compromise my dreams with the realities of a reasonable timeline and the expectations of the beautiful and wonderful people who have donated. I have carefully budgeted and laid out the numbers above,but should there be any "leftover" funds at the end of recording and manufacturing I promise to use them to A) Give back through throwing another house concert/party for donors. B) Use the money to promote the record online/radio/etc. OR C) Use the money to record more songs either for this record or future singles/EPs/LPs, which will be made available to contributors. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use Indiegogo/facebook/twitter/snapchat share tools!

THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
My Story

I began my bachelor's studies at the University for the Arts Bremen (HfK), Germany, in cello performance. My time at the HfK was very important. Over the years in Bremen I developed my taste in music and special interest in orchestral and chamber music of various genres. I also was able to dig into the professional world by holding a 3-year internship with the NDR Radiophilharmonie in Hannover.

Tanglewood

I always knew this place through my mother, who spent a summer there in the 70’s. I was around 2 years old when I first visited. This summer was my 5th time making music at Tanglewood, which has become a special place for me, because of its tradition and the opportunities I have been given. I have performed with some of the finest young musicians in the US and with artists such as Emanuel Ax, Mark Morris or Dawn Upshaw. In 2014, I was principal cellist of the Tanglewood Music Center Orchestra under Charles Dutoit and got to lead the cello section this summer under the Boston Symphony Orchestra’s music director Andris Nelsons in an all Brahms program.

Rice University

My being at Rice is the perfect example one thing leading to another. If I had not joined the Tanglewood Music Center in 2014 I would not have met Norman Fischer, who I’ve had the pleasure of studying with for 2 semesters already. I feel I was able to improve my playing quite a bit in the past year, focusing on technique and healthy playing, which will be essential the longer I want to play the cello at a high level. I have gained deeper interest in the technical aspects of cello playing and now understand, that it's important to be able to say what I want to say on the instrument. Music of course comes first, but knowing very vividly what you’re doing technically will lead to a more successful performance, that will captivate an audience.

The New Bow

The more I went into detail about my cello playing, the more I was able to make a judgement about my equipment. When I played several bows belonging to my teacher, it occurred to me how important a good bow is; in fact it is just as important as the instrument itself. The bows I tried were manufactured by David Hawthorne in Cambridge, Massachusetts and I was able to play all of his models. Because the only bow I own is a $300 carbon-fiber bow, I decided to assign Mr Hawthorne to manufacture a bow for myself, which was also adjusted and customized for my needs on the instrument. The bow is a copy of a bow by Francois Lupot, which Yo-Yo Ma owns. I received the bow mid-june and was able „to get to know it“ while I was at Tanglewood. Instantly I felt like this was a huge upgrade to my playing. It draws a beautiful, rich sound from the instrument and I am still discovering more and more options for different colors. The bow allows me to be in control when playing technically challenging pieces and gives great response with any possible stroke. The best part about it is that I know I can rely on it, which makes me feel more comfortable when I perform.

THIS IS WHERE I NEED YOUR HELP

This bow is an essential tool to improve my playing and your kind donation would not only help to finance the bow, but would also support my efforts of becoming a better player. For your support I would like to thank all donors in advance.

 

Photographs by Heide Benser

story:
Operation Streetwork Cali

We are The Present Elders, an electronic duo that specializes in unforgettable performances where all the music you hear is composed and manipulated live through synthesizers, samplers, sequencers, drum machines and FX.  We take a craftsman approach to electronic music where we use hardware instruments instead of computers.  We're made up of Brother El and Radius ETC, two veterans of the Chicago electronic and hip hop scenes.  Our focus has been to create incomparable music that represents a new sound and style while sending only positive, warm, healing vibes wherever we play. 

Now we want to take our show on the road to California.  We will be traveling while playing a series of free pop up shows across the Golden State.  Everyone knows Chicago winters are brutal and not suitable for much outside activity, including street performing. Our goal is to start a movement that breaks barriers.  A movement to demystify electronic performance.  A movement to spread healing vibrations through music and genuinely connecting.  And a movement to give the power back to the artists - we want to be close to the people, not the politics.

  • While we also perform traditional shows, we've recently made it our mission to remove the barriers between electronic performers and the attendees through impromptu pop up shows throughout different cities.  These are free, live and open to the public as we create and manipulate beats after quickly materializing before you on the street.
  • Over the summer, we held 15+ pop up shows throughout the city of Chicago and found that this was one of the most free and real way to connect with like minded people.  We are now taking the show on the road to The Golden State.  First we plan on stopping in LA at the beginning of the month then heading north to The Bay Area.  We are documenting our trip both with videos and sound recordings so you can follow us on our journey. 
  • While we we see this trip in our mind, we need your help willing it into existence.  Any contribution would be an amazing help to cover the cost of a month of free shows that we are playing across California. 

 

Recent Updates

We're out here in Cali doing our special brand of street level musical healing.  We popped up at the Vinyl Dreams record store and threw down a set of spontaneously composed house-hop.  Check it out below:

 

We also stopped by Main Drain Studios in Oakland for a live factory session.  Watch and listen here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JT3WWHcYGy4 (We start at 52minutes in)

Follow "The Present Elders" on facebook and instagram to see where we pop up next and come jam with us live and direct!

About Us

My name is  Brother El, I am a spontaneous composer and multidisciplinary creative who uses music and visual arts to express ideas while connecting people to a higher plane of consciousness. Raised in the hip hop ascetic and DIY movement, I constantly look to push the boundaries of music as an expert in the Live PA field. Formally trained as an Audio Engineer and Graphic Designer, I have acquired many different skills running The Beat Bank, an independent record label.  My sets often include using sequencers, synthesizers, drum  machines and samplers with doing fully improvised and live beat-making.  My unique style has been described as Chicago’s pulse, the breath of hip hop, the heartbeat of club respiration and the clashing fusion of South Side meeting ancestral roots.

My name is Radius, I'm from Chicago and I started crafting beats in 2001 with a focus on multi-dimensional "post-genre" based compositions. After producing tracks for local rappers, I began to further hone skills as a producer/live performance artist, by winning Chicago area beat battles and later performing in various hiphop and electronic showcases with the Moment Sound Crew (Garo, Lokua & Slava). I'm known for my improv live PA/beat sets with hardware. The music exhibits a wide variety of tempos & sounds. I'm highly inspired by hiphop, jazz, dub & house music roots; due to my Chicago upbringing.  I am also head of Etc Records (Ear To Chicago) and curate showcases to help bridge the live electronic music community.

Together, we make The Present Elders, a genre bending spontaneous composition duo focused on spreading positive vibes and creating hard hitting electronic music.  

 

Come Together To Help Each Other

What we're looking for is help to create this movement while documenting our journey with videos and a record.  Because these shows are spontaneous, free and completely open to the public we are just asking for help covering travel and production costs:

  • We're thinking that costs come down to a few categories - travel, equipment and production.  We are asking for about $3,000 for each.  For travel we need flights, a car to rent, gas.  For equipment, we need a generator to power the show and a PA speaker.  There are also costs for Videographers and  actually producing the record of our performances across California.  Add in a few things like food, insurance and licensing the grand total is about $10,000
  • We've got lots of ways for you to potentially contribute!  Some of the more interesting ones are: the record we produce from our performances in Cali, a The Present Elders T-Shirt, digital EP of your choice among radius's and brother el's records all signed for $100.  There are also options to purchase each of those items individually ranging from $10-$25.  Other packages include us performing for you live or writing you a personalized song!  At the very least, we'd like to personally thank anybody for joining the cause via video if they can give us a five spot.
  • By the way, we're doing this regardless of whether or not we reach our goal, but your contributions go a long way to make sure we can keep going and put on as many quality shows as possible.

Join a Cultural Movement

Our mission is to bring people together in the community while taking the power of music back to the people in the streets.  We want to be able to interact directly with the audience in a raw setting to help demystify what we do with our instruments. 

  • People at our shows enjoy themselves and the atmosphere is full of healing vibes.
    Our main purpose is to have a celebration of community, music and togetherness with any and all who would like to join us.  Our goal is to ultimately create a movement to take the power of music back to the people.  We've seen our music resonate positively for people from all walks of life and of all ages.  You can see children, old folks, businessmen and the homeless all dancing throughout our many videos.  We want to continue to share this positive energy and vibration across the country with as many people as possible.
  • We are both veterans of the electronic music scene both in Chicago and internationally.  This past summer we've shifted our focus from traditional shows to pop up performances.  We've popped up at places like the Chicago Cultural Center, Ohio St. Beach, Garfield Park Conservatory and many other culturally significant areas throughout the city.

Risks & Challenges

People value our transparency and we put ourselves out there each show and get immediate feedback from our audience.  Its a difficult operation, where we need to be careful navigating locations, police, weather, equipment and attendees. All of these issues are additional reasons why we need your help! We've got a lot of experience with pop up shows and while problems do arise, there are always solutions.

  • Over the past summer and fall, we did several (over 20) pop up shows across the city of Chicago.  On the streets, almost anything can happen. We've experienced rowdy people, drunk people, police and blockades. We've also dealt with equipment issues and weather problems.  Most importantly, we’ve helped to influence and bring people TOGETHER who are all looking to connect over music, beats and good vibrations

Follow The Journey

We understand that money, time and attention are all tough to come by these days.  If you're still reading at this point, much respect.  The last thing we wanted to talk about was how to help if you're tapped on the money part of the equation.  Basically, we ask that you join us.

  • Follow us on social media, where we'll post updates of where we are and where we'll be as we go around California spreading vibrations and frequency manipulations.  We'll be keeping you up to date on shows, our day to day on the road, and the friends we meet both old and new. 
  • Also, please share this across your networks and share the message of removing the barriers of traditional electronic music performance and bringing the power to the people.
  • You can also support us by purchasing music from either of our labels, ETC Records and The Beat Bank
  • Finally, if you're in Cali you should come out and jam with us!  Follow The Present Elders on social media and we'll let you know where we pop up each day.

story:
VENUE: THE SUBSTATION THEATRE, SINGAPORE

TIME: 8:00PM

DATE: 10TH DECEMBER 2015

TICKET PRICE: S$18 [available at initiation.peatix.com ]

_____________________________________________________________________________

Hello there!

Singapore musicians Jeffrey and Eugene's debut concert, 'INITIATION', was started in early 2015, during their apprenticeship under esteemed local arranger and composer, Felix Phang.

'INITIATION' is a self-organised original showcase of New-melodic Jazz, which entails the freedom of an improviser to communicate through a series of melodies that excites and captivates the listener, allowing them to experience a new sonic approach to hearing musical phrases. 'INITIATION' will also feature two compositions from Caleb Koa in the opening act.

The showcase will also feature many of Singapore's top musicians, including drummer Aaron James Lee (The Steve McQueens), bassist Jase Sng (The Steve McQueens), keyboardists Audrey Tengkey (TAJ) and Eugene Ang, as well as 7 other established musicians.


About The Project

There will be two different band line-ups in order to exhibit their unique, contrasting jazz-fusion compositions. Jeffrey writes for a string quartet, while Eugene writes for a horn trio (trumpet and 2 saxophones). Both bands are backed by a full rhythm section of keyboard, bass and drums.


The showcase aims to generate awareness and appreciation of jazz music, it being one of the least appreciated genre in Singapore. Starting from the local music scene, Jeffrey and Eugene have hopes of expanding Singapore's circle of jazz audiences, and letting local listeners know that jazz doesn't have to be abstract; it can be as listenable and enjoyable as pop music too. 

Not sure if you'll like our project?? Here's our demo. CLICK HERE!


Rewards

Pledge: USD 5

Thank you! Your name will be mentioned on our "Thank You" poster. Don't forget to sign on our poster at the concert before you leave! 

Pledge: USD 20

Signed concert CD or DVD! We'll send it right to your doorstep anywhere around the world. Let us know your preference and we'll get it done for you!

Pledge: USD 20

Signed concert T-shirt! 

It will be sent right to your doorstep. Remember to let us know the shirt size you prefer! Shirt sizing chart available below! 

[We recommend choosing one size smaller as the sizing is larger]


Pledge: USD 35

Signed concert CD or DVD of your choice along with Signed T-shirt and we'll send it right to your doorstep anywhere around the world. 

[Remember to let us know your sizing and preference.]


Pledge: USD 45

Signed CD/DVD, signed poster & signed T-shirt package. 

[Remember to let us know your sizing and preference.]


Pledge: USD 60

You're invited to our after-concert party! Have a beer or juice (if you prefer) and it's on us! You'll also receive signed poster, signed CD/DVD and signed T-shirt. 

[Remember to let us know your sizing and preference.]


Pledge: USD 80

An hour of bass / violin lesson with Jeffrey and Eugene at your preferred location. 

You'll also receive signed poster, signed CD/DVD and signed T-shirt. 

[Remember to let us know your sizing and preference.]


Pledge: USD 150

An hour of jamming session (any song) with Jeffrey and Eugene and some of our musicians. You'll also receive signed poster, signed CD/DVD and signed T-shirt. 

[Remember to let us know your sizing and preference.]


Pledge: USD 250

Our violinist, Jeffrey will perform solo violin for your event! (i.e Birthday party, wedding event) You'll also receive signed poster, signed CD/DVD and signed T-shirt.

[Remember to let us know your sizing and preference.]


Pledge: USD 500

We'll hold concert at your house or an event. (i.e Birthday party, wedding event) performed by Jeffrey (violinist), Eugene (bassist) and Caleb (keyboard).


Funding

We seek to raise $4,500 USD to cover musicians fees along with live audio and video recording. Extra funding collected will be used to cover other expenses such as venue rental fees and personnel fees. 

USD$4,500 may seem like a lot but here's the general breakdown: 

  • USD$1,700 on musicians
  • USD$1,500 for live audio recording for the CD by Geoffrey Low (Singapore's top audio engineer)
  • USD$1,300 for live video recording with 3 cameras (used to produce the DVD).


A BIG THANK YOU!

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you so much for taking the time to check this project out! I hope you can join us in making our concert a success. We promise that we will put in blood, sweat, and tears to present these songs to all of you guys the best way we can. Please support us and make a pledge today! Hope to see you at the concert.

We promise that we will put in blood, sweat, and tears to present these songs to all of you guys the best way we can. Please support us and make a pledge today! Hope to see you at the concert.

story:
Hi, I am Konstantin Kuchev from Bulgaria. My dream is to create a kids’ music album. I make up songs and lyrics from since I can remember. What's most exciting for me is to create music together with people who have a strong passion for expressing their inner world and meeting it with the worlds of others. Not surprisingly, children are often the ones who are most passionate and sincere in their way of expression. 

I teach music to kids. 

This summer I had everyday music classes with children at a summer camp. They didn't want to sing songs that were written by someone else, they wanted us to sing our own songs. And so we started creating songs based on their own lyrics and melodies. On this album, I want to have kids' songs and voices. I want to make an album created by kids and for kids. 

Let's make this album together! 

I'm always opened to new ideas. My aim is to create alive music 

that will reach the listener in as direct way as possible. Most of my music is composed  here and now, in the present moment. My concerts are based on participation with the audience, so they can take part in the creative process themselves. During a performance, my purpose is to discover a new and more flexible musical language. I have played for audiences of all ages in concert halls and theatres, in homes for orphan children and nursing homes. The audience always want to be part of the performance, they enjoy singing and playing with the musicians. Actually there is no more separation between artists and audience. I think music is for everyone and every person can be a great musician. 



This year I also discovered my favourite children’s author, Petya Kokudeva. She writes magical, but real poems and stories that both kids and adults can associate with. Now we are creating songs together. In several kindergartens and schools in Sofia they already know and sing our songs.



So today I have diverse and thematically related songs to form a kids album. I would like to create a colourful soundscape by mixing different voices and instruments. I've already chosen the songs - most of which are new and unpublished - as well as the musicians to record with. 

I need your help to make a quality record and pay the musicians for their work. 


My cost estimate is as follows:


1. Recording, pay musicians, mixing - €4000

2. Mastering, CD duplication, custom artwork - €1000

Total: €5000

I would very much appreciate your help for my project!

story:
Our Goal

With your help, we can create the World’s Largest Collagraph- composed of donated clothing, which represents someone who fought cancer in our community. It is a special opportunity to honor someone in your life, giving thanks to the impact they made on YOU.

To make Impressions of Courage happen, we need to raise $20,000. Here is the great news! A $10,000 matching gift from Rudy’s Exotic Mushrooms means that every dollar you donate is doubled, up to $10,000!

Impact

Our connection to community driven art allowed us to see that in every community, there are people cancer has touched who are loved and supported and sometimes grieved for, and we wanted to recognize each of them, life-sized and by name. Clothing is such a fundamental way in which we express ourselves, that we felt it would be a great way to show the uniqueness and individuality of the people we want to honor.

Impressions of Courage represents an innovative way to pay tribute to people who have battled cancer. It does this by crowd-sourcing materials which have deep meaning and connection to individuals with the disease, as well as those impacted by it- honoring the uniqueness of each person through community action, while communicating a shared experience using personal symbolism to visually represent the physical presence of cancer on a monumental scale. The culminating event and sheer scale of the artwork challenges viewers to hold the weight of their experience and motivates them to bolster the community behind it. Due to the extraordinary scale of the finished artwork, community involvement, and anticipated media attention given to an attempt to set a world record, we believe our approach is a unique way to tackle the topic of cancer awareness.

From the parent who donates an outfit in honor of their child, to the volunteer who reverently attaches it to panel, to a massive line of clothing representing people we know and love, this project will create an unforgettable public event. With your help, Impressions of Courage will be a compelling portrayal of the humanity behind cancer in our community. 

What happens if you don't reach your goal?  We believe that crowdfunding is a powerful way to rally support, and get people involved in projects that matter and make our community better. All funds raised will go directly to producing the project. If we don't reach our goal through crowdfunding, we will continue to seek funding from additional sponsors, through grants and individual donors. 

What is the timeline for the World Record Collagraph?  Starting in late February, we will begin accepting  donations of clothing, and registering honorees. Submissions will close in May, and the record setting festival will be held in September, 2016. Donors receiving a collagraph print of their submission should expect those to be delivered by November, 2016. 

How do I submit an outfit, and register my honoree?  Donors will be contacted when the submission form is live online in February. All submissions must have corresponding clothing delivered in person or mailed to Studio 23, Attn: Impressions of Courage Project, 3300 West Clay Street, Richmond, VA 23230. Clothing submissions do not need to be the honoree's actual clothing, just represent them. Clothing will not be returned.

What are other ways I can help?  Get excited! Make a donation, and share this video all over the place! Make your co-workers watch it, bring it to Thanksgiving dinner, bug your friends to get involved too. The more people involved, the bigger the World Record! How often do you get a chance to honor someone you love, by name, on a World Record?!?  Spread the word, and Donate! We also need volunteers to help produce the event, and prepare the collagraph plates, so let us know if you are local, and want to help in these ways too!

About Art on Wheels

At Art on Wheels, we bring comprehensive arts programming to communities with limited access to the arts. Through our community focused art,  we facilitate dialogue and healing through monumental works that are created by the community, for the community. From The Veterans' Impact Project, where we empowered veterans to create their own monument to military service, to our massive, bicycle powered Zoetrope, to huge community murals, big, bold ideas with massive community involvement is the name of our game. 

About Studio23

Studio Two Three is Central Virginia’s only community printmaking workshop. We provide established and aspiring artists and craftspeople with studio facilities, education, artist residency, and open doors.

We are an energizing incubator for the current generation and the next one, keeping our creative community robust and evolving, producing the goods and services that move through our city’s galleries, businesses, schools, festivals, homes, and life.
story_txt:
Our Goal
With your help, we can create the World’s Largest Collagraph- composed of donated clothing, which represents someone who fought cancer in our community. It is a special opportunity to honor someone in your life, giving thanks to the impact they made on YOU.
To make Impressions of Courage happen, we need to raise $20,000. Here is the great news! A $10,000 matching gift from Rudy’s Exotic Mushrooms means that every dollar you donate is doubled, up to $10,000!

Impact
Our connection to community driven art allowed us to see that in every community, there are people cancer has touched who are loved and supported and sometimes grieved for, and we wanted to recognize each of them, life-sized and by name. Clothing is such a fundamental way in which we express ourselves, that we felt it would be a great way to show the uniqueness and individuality of the people we want to honor.
Impressions of Courage represents an innovative way to pay tribute to people who have battled cancer. It does this by crowd-sourcing materials which have deep meaning and connection to individuals with the disease, as well as those impacted by it- honoring the uniqueness of each person through community action, while communicating a shared experience using personal symbolism to visually represent the physical presence of cancer on a monumental scale. story:
Short Summary

  • I, Kuhoo Gupta, am an Indian singer who has always sung in Hindi ever since the age of 5.
  • Up until now, I sang well and projects came my way. While I was happy that my professional graph was surging ahead in the Hindi music industry, I was also a bit depressed because just like all other Hindi singers from India, I was continuously being slotted by the critics and stereotypes as just a "Hindi" singer who only had a slim chance in Bollywood.
  • Not that I was affected of being slotted that way, but I was not able to digest the fact that, most of the world thought "Hindi" singers could not sing in English. Most of the world thought that Hindi singers could never get into the international arena of singing in English.
  • A lot of my critics even discouraged me and told me that I could never be in the league of international artists. The fact that hurt me the most is that, just like all other Hindi singers, I didn't even have the team or resources to change this situation. As you all are aware, I come from a very middle-class background and I am striving hard to make a change for myself as an artist and the Hindi independent artist community at large.
  • This music album is my effort to prove to all those critics wrong. 
  • If things work right then I plan to do more of such music albums. However, there will be a "HINDI" and "INDIAN" touch to the music I'll be doing in my international albums in the future.
  • So this is a music album not just for me but to encourage every Indian singer. To tell the world and Hindi singers in India that we too can produce and record albums of international class and quality in English. We too can release our music internationally. We too can collaborate with the "WEST" and create a world class product.
  • I believe that India is the largest English-speaking democracy in the world and it is a pity that we are looked down upon when it comes to producing an international quality English album. 
  • In this effort, I am supported by teams from New Zealand (AIPC Entertainment - executive production), Malaysia (Flensa Production - Video Production) and South America (Franklin Ortiz - songwriter, composer without whom this project would never have been possible).
  • What you contribute will help us shoot music videos for the album we have recorded, do PR and Promos just like other international albums OR singers but more importantly it will drive a message to the music fraternity in India that we too can sing in English and make a world-class international product.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a bit more of the details:

  • We have already recorded all the songs of the album which you can listen to by CLICKing here.
  • Now we need to promote these songs by with some cool music videos, PR and LIVE performances in India and internationally.
  • We need a total of $36,000 to make all of this possible. 
  • $20,000 would be utilised in shooting 3 music videos in picturesque                 New Zealand to promote this album on a global scale.
  • $5,000 would be utilised in promotions and publicity in worldwide media. We plan to do a worldwide release from New Zealand with the active support of the New Zealand government agencies.
  • The balance $11,000 would be used to travel to international music festivals and do some promo shows. Of Course, I will be touring India and doing shows to promote this album.
  • We'll fly the first 2 contributors who contribute over $10,000 to New Zealand and offer them the unique opportunity of featuring in lead roles in the music videos.
  • In case, we do not reach the desired goal of $36,000 then we will make do with what we get and shoot maybe just one music video. Perhaps also cut down on our promotions and touring but we are determined to make this project happen come what may!

The Impact

  • Your contribution no matter how small or big will make a huge difference to the independent singers community in India. Especially emerging singers like myself who have to continuously face criticism from the international media.
  • We as Indians, too can sing in English and release an English language album internationally. Artists like AR Rahman have already proved it by winning awards internationally. However, it is easy for a popular artist to do a project like this because they have the media and financial resources to help them.
  • A project like this is only possible for a Hindi artist like me, if contributors like you, our friends, fans and family are a part of this journey.
  • Every cent of your contribution will give the much-needed encouragement to all those independent Hindi singers in India like me.
  • Every cent of your contribution will help us develop a more vibrant singing community in India that is truly global. I believe it will make us all and India proud.
  • As my fans, you have always supported me in all my efforts in Hindi. I look forward to the same support in this first English album of mine.

Risks & Challenges

If we are unable to achieve our goal, then there is a likelihood that we might not be able to shoot our desired set of 3 videos. There is also a possibility that we might not be able to invest in adequate PR & Promos. There might not be the promo trip as well if we fall short of funds.

  • We have envisioned that we might encounter such a situation. If so, the New Zealand government grant agencies have agreed to support us in the endeavour. They have been extremely helpful until date.
  • The New Zealand government agencies have promised us that, should we hit a roadblock like this, they will fund us with an equivalent amount to match the contribution made by you. 
  • As an example if we are able to raise only $18000 from this crowd-funding campaign then the New Zealand agencies will chip in another $18000 so that we have the entire amount of $36000 to make this dream project come true.
  • Other Ways You Can Help

Even if just can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Folks, please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to share it on your social media.

A project like this is only possible for a Hindi artist like me, if contributors like you, our friends, fans and family are a part of this journey.

There is also a possibility that we might not be able to invest in adequate PR & Promos. There might not be the promo trip as well if we fall short of funds.  We have envisioned that we might encounter such a situation. If so, the New Zealand government grant agencies have agreed to support us in the endeavour. They have been extremely helpful until date.
The New Zealand government agencies have promised us that, should we hit a roadblock like this, they will fund us with an equivalent amount to match the contribution made by you. 

As an example if we are able to raise only $18000 from this crowd-funding campaign then the New Zealand agencies will chip in another $18000 so that we have the entire amount of $36000 to make this dream project come true.


Other Ways You Can Help

 Even if just can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help:  Folks, please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to share it on your social media.

story:
Présentation

DEEP IN HATE est un groupe de métal français actif depuis plus de dix ans !

Nous avons beaucoup tourné pour faire découvrir notre musique. Vous nous avez peut-être déjà vus dans de grands festivals tels que le Sonisphere, le Hellfest ou encore aux côté de grands groupes tels qu'Arch Enemy, The Black Dahlia Murder, Aborted, Hatebreed, Napalm Death, Carnifex, Rise Of The Northstar, Veil Of Maya et bien d'autres

Notre groupe est constitué d'un staff de 8 membres comprenant 5 musiciens, un ingé son, un manager et un chauffeur pro.

Pour la totalité d’entre nous la musique est plus qu'une passion, c'est aussi une activité professionnelle. Cours de musique, masterclass, production, sonorisation, enregistrements, coaching.

En plus du trauma psychologique, de la crainte de perdre l’un d’entre nous et des images qui peinent à s’effacer tant le choc était violent en ce dimanche 14 Novembre 2015 (accident à 120 Km/H sur l'autoroute), la perte du van et les dégâts matériels sont donc un énorme coup dur pour le groupe, menaçant directement la pérennité de nos projets.


Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Ce fut la douche froide après l'accident de constater que le van était bon pour la casse et qu'une partie du materiel était cassé ou abimé. Après calcul des frais, les pertes sont encore bien trop gigantesques à assumer pour le groupe seul et ce malgré la participation de l'assurance.

Une fois la peur passée et le choc encaissé nous nous sommes dit que la tournée devait continuer malgré tout ! « Show must go on » ! Pour les prochaines dates nous louerons un van et du matériel, mais nos ressources sont limitées et nous ne pourrons le faire que sur un laps de temps très court.

Heureusement nous sommes tous en vie et en bonne santé, mais difficile d'être serein après une telle casse.

Si grâce à vous nous pouvons racheter un van et du matériel nous pourrions continuer à jouer et à vous donner du plaisir ! Nous aimons jouer pour vous, notre musique sans public n’a absolument aucun sens.

Nous n’aurions jamais pensé faire une campagne de crowfundings. Nous sommes toujours parvenus à financer seuls nos albums, nos tournées ou nos clips vidéos, et nous étions heureux de le faire sans vous mettre à contribution. Si nous faisons appel à vous c’est par la force des choses car nous sommes pris de cours.

Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour nous relever et continuer à faire vivre le groupe. Nous vous remercions chaleureusement pour toute contribution que vous donnerez, si petite soit-elle. Nous tenons à vous montrer notre gratitude et récompenserons le plus possible votre générosité !

Nous avons hâte d’oublier cet accident et de venir à votre rencontre, dans une salle de concert, fort de nos morceaux ! Mille mercis et à très vite !


D'autres façons d'aider

Le groupe est conscient que l'aide financière n'est pas accessible à tous.

Mais informer ou partager auprès de vos proches serait une manière de soutenir DEEP IN HATE dans ces heures noires.



Presentation

DEEP IN HATE is a French metal band active for more than ten years!

We toured a lot to share our music. You perhaps have already see the band at major festivals such as Sonisphere, Hellfest or with bands like Arch Enemy, The Black Dahlia Murder, Aborted, Hatebreed, Napalm Death, Carnifex, Rise Of The Northstar Veil Of Maya and more.

Our band is made of eight members including five musicians, a sound engineer, a manager and a pro driver.

For all of us the music is more than a passion, it is also a professional activity. Music lessons, masterclasses, production, sound, recordings, coaching.

In addition to the psychological trauma, fear of losing one of us and images that are struggling to fade because of the violent shock in this Sunday, November 14, 2015 (accident to 120 Km / H on the highway) The loss of the van and material damages are an enormous blow to the band, directly threatening the sustainability of our projects.

What we need and what you get

It was a cold shower after the accident, seeing that the van was completely dead and that some of the equipment was broken or damaged. After calculating the expenses, losses are still too huge for the band alone, despite the insurance.

Once past the fear and shock we said that the tour would proceed anyway! "Show must go on!" For the next gigs we will rent a van and equipment, but our resources are limited and we can only do that in a very short time.

Fortunately we are all alive and healthy, but it's difficult to be calm after such a break.

If this campain is a succes we can buy a van and equipment and then could continue to play and give you pleasure! We like to play for you, our music without audience is absolutely a nonsense.

We never thought of making a crowfundings campaign.

If we appeal to you it's by necessity, as we are taken by surprise.

We need your help to pick ourselves up and continue to live as a band. We warmly appreciate any contribution, however small it may be. We wish to show our gratitude and reward your generosity as much as possible!

We can't wait to forget the accident and coming your way, in a concert hall, to play our songs! Many thanks and see you soon!

Other ways to help

The band is aware that financial help is not easy for all.

But you can help by spreading the word or sharing with your friends. It would be a way to support DEEP IN HATE in these dark hours.

story:
Maureen Choi Quartet

We are a Spanish Latin jazz quartet based in Madrid. My curiosity and interest in Spanish music and Latin rhythms led me to put together this band when I moved to Spain from New York.

In the process of finding and creating the unique voice of Maureen Choi Quartet, we have created our latest album “Ida y Vuelta”, which reflects all of our personal influences and experiences, the sounds from our homes...from Cuba, South America, Spain, jazz and western classical music. 


South by Southwest and USA Tour

Our quartet has been selected to perform in South by SouthWest in Austin, Texas.

This invitation to participate in South by Southwest is such a huge opportunity to share the work that we have been doing with festival programmers, booking agents, and managers which will help us get the exposure that we need to perform our music world wide.

Unfortunately, the festival does not pay for the performance, the flights or the hotels. With this campaign we want to ask you to help us bring the quartet over to participate in this great event. 

To take maximum advantage of our trip to the US, we are going to the Midwest after Texas to perform a few concerts. Be sure to check out our perks for concert tickets. 

March 22nd- Chicago The Promontory

http://www.ticketweb.com/t3/sale/SaleEventDetail?dispatch=loadSelectionData&eventId=6494495&pl=promchi&REFID=wordpress

March 23rd- Detroit Cliff Bell's

http://www.cliffbells.com/shows/maureen-choi-quartet/

March 25th- Ann Arbor Kerrytown Concert House

http://www.kerrytownconcerthouse.com/index.php/events/event/maureen_choi_quartet_2016

Why we are asking for your help

The detailed list of our expenses for the 4 members of the band plus our manager:

Flights Madrid - Austin: $4500

Internal flights (Houston, Chicago, Detroit), Car Rental and Gas: $3500

Hotel in Austin, Chicago, Detroit and Ann Arbor. Total of 10 nights: $ 4000

Renting of drums, piano and other equipment: $1500

Production, management and marketing $1500

Even though the cost to bring the band is expensive, we feel as if we can't lose out on this opportunity to perform in the festival and maximize our visibility in the states. We have been wanting to perform in the US for quite some time and we feel that it is a huge step forward in our careers. We have been doing quite well in Spain, but have been feeling motivated and eager to spread our music to a wider audience. We only hope that this trip will bring us some luck to give us the exposure and the push that we need to play worldwide. 

We want to thank you so much for even taking the time to read/watch our campaign. We will always try our hardest to deliver the best of our abilities, to make the most out of ourselves and our music.  Thank you for all the love, support and consideration! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help by getting the word out. Any amount of noise about our campaign is truly appreciated! Thank you all so much!
story_txt:
Maureen Choi Quartet
We are a Spanish Latin jazz quartet
based in Madrid. My curiosity and interest in Spanish music and Latin rhythms
led me to put together this band when I moved to Spain from New York.
In the process of finding and creating
the unique voice of Maureen Choi Quartet, we have created our latest album
“Ida y Vuelta”, which reflects all of our personal influences and experiences,
the sounds from our homes...from Cuba, South America, Spain, jazz and western
classical music. 



South by Southwest
and USA Tour
Our quartet has been selected to
perform in South by SouthWest in Austin, Texas.
This invitation to participate in South
by Southwest is such a huge opportunity to share the work that we have been
doing with festival programmers, booking agents, and managers which will help
us get the exposure that we need to perform our music world wide.
Unfortunately, the festival does not
pay for the performance, the flights or the hotels. With this campaign we want
to ask you to help us bring the quartet over to participate in this great
event. 
To take maximum advantage of our trip
to the US, we are going to the Midwest after Texas to perform a few
concerts. Be sure to check out our perks for concert tickets. 



March 22nd- Chicago The Promontory
http://www.ticketweb.com/t3/sale/SaleEventDetail?dispatch=loadSelectionData&eventId=6494495&pl=promchi&REFID=wordpress
March 23rd- Detroit Cliff Bell's
http://www.cliffbells.com/shows/maureen-choi-quartet/
March 25th- Ann Arbor Kerrytown Concert House
http://www.kerrytownconcerthouse.com/index.php/events/event/maureen_choi_quartet_2016



Why we are asking
for your help

the band plus our manager:
Flights Madrid - Austin: $4500
Internal flights (Houston, Chicago, Detroit), Car Rental and Gas: $3500
Hotel in Austin, Chicago, Detroit and Ann Arbor. Total of
10 nights: $ 4000
