story:
Short Summary

My name is Greg Johnson.  Some of you may know me as the Director of Jazz Studies at the Marin School of the Arts, or for my varying roles as a saxophonist for Bob Mintzer's Big Band in Los Angeles or perhaps from my work with alternative band Saint Motel.  Maybe you've even played some of my big-band music in your high school, college, community or professional big band!

On the night of February 16th, I'll be presenting the world premier of my newest big-band suite "Visions of Kansas City."  This music is inspired by the great music of Kansas City era Count Basie.  The band will feature some of the best musicians from New York City, Los Angeles and the San Francisco Bay Area.  It will also feature a super special guest that not even the band will know about until the night of.  

 

    What We Need & What You Get

    To get the best product involving the best people, we need your help!

    • We need to raise $8000 to pay for personnel, production costs and travel expenses.
    • Contributors will have a wide variety of packages to choose from including performances, educational clinics, concert tickets and much more.  

    The Impact

    I've seen the impact of supportive, arts-inclined patronage positively affect communities in Pennsylvania, Colorado, Texas, Nebraska and California.   

    As a teacher I can't ignore the benefits of a good musical community to kids.  Having positive, supportive musicians around in my childhood was a key factor in my own choice to become a musician and a teacher.   Now as a director of music at the Marin School of the Arts, I am seeing my students thrive in a definitive way when they receive the support of the community.

    On a personal note, big-band music has been the central focus of my life for the last decade.    Having written over 200 compositions and arrangements, big-band music has allowed me to express my take on humanity and has helped me connect with hundreds of people in places that I never would have imagined.  The high-quality media that will come from this project will allow me to make myself more visible as a big-band composer to the world at large. 

    Risks & Challenges

    It is challenging to put together a project like this.  On one hand, I'll need to finish the two hours of music that I'm in the midst of.  On the other hand, I'll need to pay for the time and energy of 18 amazing professional musicians who will be coming from all over the country.  This is not only expensive, but an extremely rare opportunity.  

    While my life will be busy up until the day of the concert, these challenges are what I live for.  To perform my own music with people I admire in front of people that I love is a dream.  

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    The fact that you are reading this lends to the fact that you are interested in supporting this project!  If you can contribute, that is amazing!  If not, you can still help make this a reality.  Here are a few ways:

    • Use the Indiegogo share tools!  Share the link to this page to your favorite social media platforms.
    • "Hey, my neighbor/mom/friend/long lost cousin loves the music of Count Basie."  Far out!  Kindly inform them of this amazing concert and the chance to contribute to the creation of their favorite kind of music!
    • If you play in a Jazz band, inform the members that they can have the chance to buy my sheet music, have me as a clinician and/or guest soloist.  

    Thank you!  I hope to see you on February 16th!

story:
As a lot of you know I've been making music for a while. I usually record my music at home or with the generous help of my friends. I've been planning on recording a full-length for a while now. All the songs for the album have been written. I had been pushing off recording because I lacked the funds to record, produce, and print it in a way that best represents my artistic vision.   

This is where I need your help!

This campaign will help me with the costs for:

Hiring a sound engineer & outside musicians
Mixing and mastering
Updating my equipment and software
Merchandise: Vinyl, Tapes, Artwork
Indiegogo + shipping fees

I understand that not everyone is able to make a donation. If you are able to, please share this campaign and spread the word. I appreciate all your support!

story:
Short Summary

* One of the biggest Music Executives in the US has requested specific recordings and named specific reachable requirements needed for him to work with Jake and Denver after a meeting in which he expressed interest in their talent. We have a window of time to get his requirements met. This person is basically a very successful star maker and Jake and Denver's Manager Rey went to him for advice but he offered much more than just advice if we can meet his requirements. A very rare opportunity.

 

  • Once in a Lifetime opportunity to be showcased to all the biggest players in the American Music Industry through this person's unbelievable contacts.
  • Multiple Grammy Award winning Producer/Engineer David Hall has jumped on board our Team to help make this a reality and he has worked with the interested Executive before.
  • David Hall Bio- Multi Grammy Award recipient David Hall sits among a select group of top-tier engineers/producers based in Nashville which have had a resounding impact in the International Music Industry. With Grammy Award winning  productions such as Ricardo Arjona and Petra and artist discoveries such as Brett Young. He has engineered for a wide variety of Studios in Music City and was favored by greats like Quincy Jones, Csaba Petocz, Joe Chiccarelli. He spent many years working out of Music City's premier facility Blackbird Studios and has worked with an endless lineup of platinum selling acts such as Tim Mcgraw, Leann Rimes, Michael W. Smith, Hank Williams Jr., Gavin Degraw, Blake Shelton, Frank Sinatra and many others.
  • We also enjoy the advice, oversight, co-songwriting skills and contacts of a third team member. Hall of fame songwriter Stewart Harris, who discovered Travis Tritt and has written 9 #1 songs including I'm Gonna Be Somebody, Rose In Paradise, No One Else On Earth, Drift Off To Dream and Angels In Waiting

 

What We Need & What You Get

:

  • We need the funds in order to record with David Hall at top recording studios with both Denver and Jake. Costs include travel and lodging for all musicians, studio time, mixing for all songs, mastering for all songs, cd duplication, perk creation and some marketing for both artists.
  • We are not able to raise more funds traditionally because of the Coronavirus Pandemic. Not able to do live Fundraising Concerts.
  • Some of the perks we are excited to present are:
  • A custom Ensworth neck through body guitar hand carved from 200 year old wood rescued from a historic building by Master guitar smith Ed Harnage(retails for approximately $7500) Denver has been endorsed by Ensworth Guitars and the guitar he is shredding on in the video is his own custom line of Ensworth called The Melodee built using the same process as the Perk guitar but with Denver's personalized design
  • A compilation album of all of Denver's and Jake original music 
  • Montecristo Management Hats
  • Autographed Posters
  • Autographed Electric or Acoustic Guitars from the artists
  • Video Chat with the Artists
  • Guitar Lesson with either Denver or Jake
  • Executive Producer Credit on album
  • Spend a day with the Artists in Studio
  • We have a flexible goal so we will use any amount donated to meet the requirements 
  • We sincerely cannot thank you enough for taking the time to check our dreams and work out and your considering a possible donation.

The Impact

 

  • Our goal is to help bring back great music in the arenas of Rock and Country music
  • Montecristo Management is dedicated to helping very talented young acts and artists with little or no financial backing themselves to get opportunities which are usually only attainable with big money backing.
  • Our emphasis is in finding and developing artists in the old fashioned way which was based on finding Stars and developing them through great music and performances
  • We believe in exposing great talents to the world. Our requirements are purely based on talent, not money or connections or musical lineage. We seek to develop artists who have the traits of having that IT factor combined with an unbeatable work ethic and positive and willful personalities.

Risks & Challenges

 

  • Less than 1% of all pro artists ever reach fame. With your help we have this unique opportunity to reach main industry decision makers.
  • If you have great music, great talent and perseverance plus respect from industry players the emphasis is then placed on recording hit song level material and getting it to the masses. With a combined 100 years in the Music Industry our Team is prepared to take these great artists to the top and we will not forget those who give us a helping hand in the beginning stages of these two young talented artist's careers.
  • We would usually raise the money through traditional means or live shows by the artists but the Coronavirus Pandemic has greatly affected our ability to do this and we have deadlines to meet.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute funds then we would be extremely grateful if you would help us spread the word about the campaign in as personal a way as possible.

  • Please spread the word amongst your friends who admire great talent!
  • Please feel free to tag our campaign and share and forward our Indiegogo Link

We would usually raise the money through traditional means or live shows by the artists but the Coronavirus Pandemic has greatly affected our ability to do this and we have deadlines to meet.

story:
Project Summary

During times of uncertainty and challenge, we need the healing power of music more than ever!  Through this commissioning and recording project, we aim to create and share new beauty with the world through the production of 2 (TWO!) brand new major works for the flute, 2 new gorgeous albums of flute music, and a music video and DVD recording. Help support the arts while also being part of a bigger message of hope and beauty!

 

Project Details

Carnegie Hall performer Dr. Alyssa Schwartz has commissioned internationally acclaimed composer Dr. Daniel Baldwin to compose two new major solo flute works: a Concerto and a Sonata.  Our vision is to give a gift of peace and beauty to the world through music... and to add two new substantial pieces to the existing body of flute repertory!  

We have partnered with Polyphony Artist Management to produce two gorgeous new albums of flute music and a DVD recording of the Concerto.  The first album will include the premiere recording of Dr. Baldwin's new Flute Sonata and other works for solo flute that emphasize the beauty of the instrument.  The second album will include the premiere recording of Dr. Baldwin's new Flute Concerto.  The DVD will include the live recording of the world premiere of the Concerto as well as exclusive interviews with Dr. Schwartz and Dr. Baldwin.

 

Project Timeline

Dr. Baldwin's new Flute Sonata will be completed by May 2021, and the first album will be recorded by December 2021 and released shortly thereafter.

Dr. Baldwin's new Flute Concerto will be completed by December 2021.  The premiere live performance of the Concerto will be scheduled in the Spring of 2022, and the second album and DVD will be recorded by December 2022 and released shortly thereafter. 

*Please note: this timeline may be subject to change due to potential challenges related to COVD-19.  It is the hope of all involved that no changes will need to be made.  If any challenges or delays should arise, all donors will be notified in writing with as much notice as possible. 

 

Project Costs

This is a substantial and multi-tiered project, involving a large number of artists!  The total cost for the full project amounts to ~$11,500.00 and breaks down as follows:

 

    New Flute Concerto Commission: $4,500.00

    New Flute Sonata Commission: $1,500.00

    Recording Engineer for Album 01: $1,500.00

    Recording Engineer for Album 02: $1,500.00

    Videographer for DVD: $1,500.00

    Mechanical Licensing Fees, Album Art, and Distribution: ~$1,000.00

 

Dr. Schwartz, Dr. Baldwin, and Polyphony Artist Management are all investing in this project financially and are happy to do so!  However, through fundraising and CD pre-sales, we hope to offset some of the costs for these projects while also striving to share our music with as many people as we can. 

 

About The Artists

 

Dr. Alyssa Schwartz is the Visiting Assistant Professor of Flute and Musicology at Fairmont State University, Director of the Morgantown Community Orchestra, and Senior Instructor of Flute and Piano through West Virginia University's Community Music Program. She debuted at New York City's Carnegie Hall in November 2017 and returned for a second performance the same month as a result of winning  1st prize in the 2017 Golden Classical Music International Competition and 2nd Prize in the 2017 Concert Artists International Music Competition. 

Alyssa is a competitive performer, winning the 2019 Florida Flute Association Orchestral Excerpts Masterclass Competition, 1st Prize in the 2017 International Grand Prize Virtuoso Competition Senior Division for which she gave her debut performance at the Wiener Saal Mozarteum in July 2017, 2nd Prize in the 2016 International Grand Prize Virtuoso Competition,  and 2nd Prize in the 2016 Golden Classical Music Awards Senior Division. 

A new music advocate, Alyssa has premiered a number of new works including "Marcahuasi" for Solo Flute, Op. 10 by Manuel Carranza Cueto (December 2019), "Impression" by Reza Nakisa (January 2018), "Endless Endless Endless" by Shelley Washington (May 2017) and "Asphyxia" by Nicole Chamberlain (April 2016).  With BETA Quartet, she has premiered "Nuraghi Warriors" by Anže Rozman (February 2019), "Recitation Book" by David Maslanka, arranged for flute quartet by Tatiana Cassetta (February 2019), and "In Sight" by Matthew Heap (March 2018). 

 

Dr. Daniel Baldwin is quickly becoming one of the most highly sought after and widely performed composers in the world today. His music has been described as "epic", "refreshingly beautiful", "gorgeous and moving", and "beautifully inspired" by critics around the country.

He is an award winning composer who has been commissioned by performers from the top orchestras in the world to include the New York Philharmonic, Chicago Symphony, and National Symphony Orchestra, among others as well as prestigious ensembles to include the Lincoln Symphony, Tulsa Symphony, Los Angeles Philharmonic, and the West Point Band. His music has been presented on National Public Radio, in prestigious venues around the world such as Carnegie Hall, the Walt Disney Concert Hall, and the Oklahoma Jazz Hall of Fame, on hundreds of University stages around the world, and at National and International conventions around the world to include the Masterworks Festival, Midwest Clinic, MENC National Convention, Kansas Bandmasters Convention, and at the International Festivals of the associations of Clarinet, Horn, Trombone, and Double Reeds, among others.

An international composer, his music has been performed around the globe in Canada, Italy, Germany, Japan, China, Belgium, and Australia, just to name a few. His music is published exclusively by Imagine Music Publishing, through which he is the editor of a band/orchestra/choir series titled "The Pathways Series".

His music has been presented on National Public Radio, in prestigious venues around the world such as Carnegie Hall, the Walt Disney Concert Hall, and the Oklahoma Jazz Hall of Fame, on hundreds of University stages around the world, and at National and International conventions around the world to include the Masterworks Festival, Midwest Clinic, MENC National Convention, Kansas Bandmasters Convention, and at the International Festivals of the associations of Clarinet, Horn, Trombone, and Double Reeds, among others.
An international composer, his music has been performed around the globe in Canada, Italy, Germany, Japan, China, Belgium, and Australia, just to name a few. His music is published exclusively by Imagine Music Publishing, through which he is the editor of a band/orchestra/choir series titled "The Pathways Series".

story:
a baby blurb about me

I'm Sophia Inez, a 19 year musician and actor from Jersey. Like many of you, I initially felt that the pandemic completely threw my life off track. Being high risk meant I had to put both studying and pursuing acting on pause. Locked inside with nothing to do, I decided to spend my newfound free-time messing around on GarageBand. Soon, that messing around became something serious. I was creating things I didn't know I was capable of. With the help of my dear friend and producer JohnMark, my quarantine coping mechanism has become what I'm proudest of. I have the music- now what I need is you! 

what it means to support me :)

This campaign is not for profit, but for necessity. $$$ is required for digital and physical distribution, publishing, merchandise, music videos, and more. By supporting me, you are not only enabling me to do all these wonderful things; you're also becoming an integral part of the process, and getting fun perks along the way!! I make all the little scrapbooks, load the flash drives, put charms on wallet chains, and sign shirts/posters w luv <3 

other ways to help/get involved!

You can still join me on my journey without paying a cent! Follow my Bandcamp https://sophiainez.bandcamp.com to be added to my mailing list, where I'll be sending updates and exclusive content. It's a bit empty at the moment, but there's a lot coming. Share this campaign with your friends, and be sure to stream the ep when it's released on all platforms!

story:
ABOUT ME

Hi there! My name’s Madison Galloway, I’m a 19-year-old Canadian folk/rock/blues musician, singer-songwriter from Fergus, Ontario.

I grew up surrounded by collections of records, CD’s, and cassettes, which is where my love of music was born. At 6 years old, I began piano lessons, but it was when I started playing guitar at age 12 that I discovered my true passion! From there, I taught myself to play harmonica, ukulele, banjo and more. I then launched into writing my own songs and in 2015, I released my first EP entitled Who Knows Where. Since, I’ve played hundreds of shows from local concert halls to prominent festivals, including the iconic Mariposa Folk Festival and Riverfest Elora, while opening for renowned artists such as 54-40, Ron Hawkins (Lowest of the Low), Colter Wall, and Lindi Ortega. Now, with much anticipation, I am about to record my debut full-length album, produced by Canadian songwriter legend, Ron Hawkins!

 

ABOUT MY PROJECT

Right now, I am at a huge turning point in my career and this album is key in propelling me to the next level. Since releasing my debut EP in 2015, I have sold over 1,300 copies and my audience has grown substantially! This new LP will fuel my upcoming tour schedule, play an essential part in my efforts to gain interest from large festivals, and be a huge catalyst in growing my fan base.

In the past 3 years of travelling Ontario, dedicating myself to performing and writing, I have put together a collection of my songs that I cannot wait to share with you! This new album will be produced by acclaimed singer-songwriter, Ron Hawkins and recorded at Escarpment Sound Studio in Belwood, ON, with Brian Hewson, engineer extraordinaire.

This 13-song album will feature 12 of my original songs backed by a full band and special guest musicians playing sitar, tabla, and even a hurdy gurdy… yes, I have a hurdy gurdy player!! The songs will range from foot-stomping highs to ambient lows, while blending elements of folk, rock, and blues with flavours of the world, to create an eclectic journey of sound.

Since I was little, I’ve always wanted to create change and my hope for this album isn’t short of that. Whether it be making a positive influence to your outlook through the reflections told in some of my songs and influencing environmental and political activism in others, or maybe you just totally dig listening to it, either way, I hope to make an impact with this album. Through your support we can achieve this together!

 

MY TEAM

Ron Hawkins has long been revered as one of Canada's greatest contemporary singer-songwriters.

Ron Hawkins – Producer

Ron Hawkins is a Canadian songwriter and producer best known as leader of the legendary band Lowest of the Low, who were inducted into the Canadian Indie Rock Hall of Fame in 2008 and awarded gold records for Shakespeare My Butt. Hawkins has produced countless albums, including his own work with Lowest of the Low and the Do Good Assassins, and for other artists such as Myrle, Chris Scott, Dirty Smile, Too Many Sisters, and The Jeremy Hoyle Band. In 1996, 2000, and 2005 Chart Magazine honoured his group's 1991 album with top 10 spots in the Top 100 Canadian Albums of All Time. In 2000 and again in 2015, Hawkins was voted Songwriter of the Year by NOW Magazine's readers’ poll.  In 2000 was honoured with Toronto station 102.1 The Edge's Lifetime Achievement Award. Over the years, Hawkins has written and released 15 albums of original material and just released Shakespeare My Box a commemorative vinyl box set of the entire Lowest of the Low catalogue.

 

Brian Hewson – Engineer, Escarpment Sound Studio

Madison Galloway – Co-Producer, Vocal, Acoustic/Electric/Slide Guitars, Harmonica, Ukulele, Banjo

Jonathan Markov – Slide/Electric Guitars, Bass, Vocal

Breanna Morrison – Keys, Bass

Carmelo Anthony – Drums/Percussion

Jody Brumell – Drums

Savanna Oliver – Videographer

Sarah French – Publicist, Sarah French Publicity

 

 

WHY I NEED YOUR HELP

As an independent artist, I have the benefit of full creative freedom, but it also means paying for this project myself. There are huge costs involved in producing and marketing a record as it requires many skilled people to ensure its success. I’m certain that my team has what it takes to create an album that will launch my career to the next level and make you proud to say that you were a part of bringing it to life.


This project has a total budget of $35,000, which covers:

  • Producer
  • Engineer
  • Studio Rental
  • Musicians
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Album Artwork
  • CD & Vinyl Manufacturing
  • Publicity & Marketing
  • Music Videos

I have applied for funding through the Ontario Arts Council to cover 1/3 of the costs of this project. I will receive a response from them in April 2019 and am confident in the application I’ve submitted. I will be covering 1/3 of the expenses myself using my entire personal life savings, but I need your help for the final third! My campaign goal is $13,000 which will cover a portion of the recording, mixing, mastering, manufacturing, and marketing expenses.

You may be wondering “Why Indiegogo?”. Crowdfunding creates a community around a project and provides a way to give back as opposed to traditional fundraising. This platform allows me to reward you for your contributions and build community around my project!

 

MY GIFTS TO YOU

I truly appreciate your continued support, it is because of you that I’ve been able to do what I love! As my thanks to you for your support and generosity, I have created loads of awesome gifts that you’ll receive when you pick a perk*, such as CD’s, vinyl, t-shirts, ukuleles (hand-painted by me!), a VIP Experience, a cooking class (with Chef Galloway), having us come and play in your home, and even joining us in the studio to watch and be a part of the magic!

I am offering an EXCLUSIVE SUBSCRIBER-ONLY perk for those who are signed up for my mailing list! If you aren’t already signed up, you can get in on this offer by signing up here!

If you are not able to contribute financially, I understand. There are many other ways you can help. Please scroll down to the “Other Ways You Can Help” section. :)
 

*If you are uncomfortable making online payments, please email me at madisongallowaymusic@gmail.com to arrange a cash or cheque donation.

IMPORTANT SHIPPING NOTE: If you would like to save on the shipping and rather pick up your gift(s) from my house (Fergus, ON) or at a show near you, then please email me at madisongallowaymusic@gmail.com and I will happily refund your shipping payment!

 

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

With any project, there are risks and challenges that may arise, however, I have given this much thought and feel I am prepared to handle these circumstances. If I do not reach my campaign goal or my project is not selected for funding through OAC, I will have to limit my marketing budget, reduce the number of albums manufactured, and/or invest the money from my education fund. On the other hand, if I exceed my goal, I will add to my marketing & video budget, use towards touring costs, and keep back some of my personal savings for living expenses and future projects.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Sharing on social media is one of the most powerful and best ways to support the people, businesses, and causes you love! You can help me greatly when you:

1) SHARE this campaign with your friends, family and colleagues by some good ole’ word of mouth and on social media with this link: https://igg.me/at/madison-galloway

2) FOLLOW or "like" Madison Galloway on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and YouTube. Like and share my posts. Invite your friends to like my pages.

3) STREAM my music on your favourite site. Every stream gives me a partial penny, and more importantly, helps "the algorithm”.

I truly appreciate all of your support in helping me make an album that I can proudly share with you and the world! From the bottom of my heart, thank you, thank you, THANK YOU!!!

 

www.madisongalloway.com

Mailing List: Sign Up

story:
Wait: your kinda old to be starting a career in music aren't you?

Nope.  next question

Last year I was rushing and anxious to start recording and my son says: "Dad you only get one chance to make a first record.   Take your time and do it right". Sage advice.  So I asked him to draw me a logo since he is an amazing artist.  In no time the Stardog paw is born.  Wow.  Iconic.

I am a hard person to slow down.  I have had two major careers till now.  Theatre and Construction.  I have toured theatre shows all over this country,  but I am proudest of my time doing The Living Tarot.  I mortgaged the house, bought a 64 greyhound bus, toured the country for 4 years doing hundreds of shows.  An interactive show about and for community and unity.

Some people retire at this age...I am just getting warmed up.    

I can get things done.  Plan tours, travel, show up perform with gusto, repeat.  I love it.

I will use this abum to springboard my music to the world.  Music will become a part of my bigger plans to tour and engage communities everywhere.

You find me at a crossroads in my life.  I have left construction like a bad marriage.  It was time and now all of my pent-up creativity is pouring out.

I need help making my 1st album of original music.  The most personal challenge of my life. I have done many wild and creative things in my life but putting my music and voice out there is by far the hardest.

Your support will make a huge change in my life.  Your encouragement contributes to helping me do more of the critical healing work I do in communities everywhere.

I need you and I need your help to record this 1st album, it is US recording this music, it is WE playing these songs.

Can't you just record it on your cellphone?

Ummm No.  Next question

Today the music scene is bustling with bands and musicians.  You have to have a quality sound and an impeccable attention to detail to catch peoples listening ears.  So I've been prepping and writing and readying myself for an immersion in performance and recording.  I am opening up my artistic brain so watch out....no telling how far this could go.

This means I need $ for studio time $300/day, Engineer/super pro musicians ($2-300/day), backup singers, digital mastering, CD's and Vinyl printing costs not to mention artwork, social media help, digital releases, god it makes me dizzy just writing it down.  All in all I have budgeted and need to raise at least $11,500.  More donations help to record more songs for smaller releases I hope to release such things as a 5 song mini ep with my anti-war and social commentary songs about immigration, veteran suicide, guns, war, etc.

I have one song already in the can, as they say with my phenomenal engineer and amazing musician Darwin Smith.  In the studio we transformed a pretty simple acoustic guitar and vocal song into a trancy, hypnotic, hard hitting 9 minute psych rock song about a bombing of civilians in Syria.

Your funding will help me uncover the magic that is underneath my songs and release that magic to the world.  It is needed.

Its all about you Huh?

Nope.  I have created some really cool gifts as a thank you for donations of all sizes.  More will be added as the month of fundraising progresses

Big Bend  - Living Rock Desert Dwellings   3 years ago a friend and I bought an amazing piece of land above the ghost town of Terlingua (chili cook-off) just outside of Big Bend National Park.  We have 40 acres of land on top of a ridge above the town.  It is stunning.  We have 2 large Tipis, a small funky trailer and many campsites.  The most beautiful views in the world.  There are packages to fit ever budget with some nice splurging possible too.

Hot Tub Party, House Concerts, tattoos, t-shirts,  lots of cool stardog merchandise, digital downloads of the album as well as CD and Vinyl options

Shakey Graves designed the Stardog Logo so its got more bite than you think

Even If I don't reach my entire goal this album will be recorded.  There are a few banks nearby whose security is lacking or put it on credit cards but this is funner and I need more partners, I want to do this as a we.

But I don't even know you

Please know that your donation is critical for us as a culture to remain connected and to know what it's like to lift each other up, to break the illusion that we are too old, or too inexperienced or too out of touch.  Bullshit.  We are all one and I aim to prove it.  Thank you for considering donating.

story:
8 years in the making, WILDSTREET III is the dream that needs to be. Jimmie and Eric have narrowed the songs down to the 7 best, for an all-killer listening experience. Wildstreet III marks the beginning of a new era for the band, with Dom, Lock & Jonny, for our fans and our  music. We have rekindled, refined, revised & re-created our original vision of WILDSTREET: faster, louder, heavier and edgier. We believe that the music is great, the musicians are great, and we'd be stoked and very grateful to have you along for the ride! WILDSTREET fans are the best fans! 

Since 2012, WILDSTREET has been seeking the right opportunity to tour in Europe. This year, Bazzty Sleaze invited us to his annual (sorry to say this is the final year) Sleaze Rock Festival in Germany in March. Also playing are: LA Cobra, CrashDiet, The Cruel Intentions & more. 
 

With the help of South African rocker's, L.A. COBRA, we recruited Gav Jackson & Mandy Jackson Sleazy Rock Entertainment to take the helm and book this tour. 

Due to the many expenses that will come with a proper release & a tour overseas, we need your help to bring this project to life! 

WILDSTREET 

Eric, Jimmie, Dominick, Lock, Jonny D.

story:
It's been 5 years since my last album and I am delighted to be making a new one! I listen hard for direction about the work I should do. From 2008 to 2013 I wrote and recorded an album each year, touring and performing all over the US. Then, in 2014 I stopped making albums so I could give myself fully to developing the YOU ARE LOVED mural project. 

I never really stop writing songs though. The songs that make up Turn Again have been written over the last several years and express a serious recommittment to God, love, and the daily labor of living virtue in the world. 

These songs explore the hard work of forgiving, the deep desire to grow, human tenderness, communication, and acknowledgement of the eternal Good. They range from folk and country to a bit of reggae and rock. Some are just me and a guitar, and others have piano, cello, harmonica, rich vocal harmonies, drums and more. 

Whether it be murals or songs, I long with all my heart for my art to comfort, encourage, and delight. The further I go in my work the more confident I am that it can, and will. I know from experience that art and music save peoples' lives by reaching them in ways other things can't. Help me do that with these songs!

This album will be relatively inexpensive to produce because I did a lot of the recording myself! The costs I am hoping to cover here are $3500 for the recording, mixing and mastering I couldn't do myself, $1000 to make the cds, and $500 for shipping, fees, and taxes. 

There are lots of cool things to get for your donation. You can pre-order Turn Again (cd or download), and/or get any of my other albums (cd or download), YOU ARE LOVED bumper stickers, books of my poetry and lyrics, a live concert in your home or church, and more. 

Year after year I am filled with gratitude for the support I receive from my community. The fact that these works of art get made is a miracle. Thank you for your continued support!

Love, 

Alex

story:
PSA: Wake Me Up Before IndieGoGo!
 

...We are The Wild Strays!

A Staffordshire/Midlands band that's currently looking to fill your ears with more music and your eyes with more wonders!

Over the past year we have been quite successful in our ventures; playing some amazing local venues and gradually working our way outward, in attempt to spread our sound into the Wild!

But we crave more and we know that you do too! We already have one single; 9 Lives that has done better than we could've imagined. Now we are looking to do 500% more work and record our first EP!


Lyric Video for our First Single: 9 Lives
 

'So where do I come in?' You may be asking yourself as you sit in the silent aftermath of just hearing our single over on YouTube (No seriously, check it out above, It's pretty cool!)

Well, let us give you some details...
 

At it's core, we are seeking funding to help cover the costs of Studio Time and any additional costs towards releasing our EP.

We currently have 5 days in the studio scheduled, with several days of prep work planned in advance to ensure we maximise our studio time. Unfortunately, this can get quite pricey; up to £1,000 for the studio time alone!

So initially, we are looking for £850. This will cover 80% of the studio fees with the band members set to cover the last 20%, plus some extra fees (IndieGoGo need a little something something!) will be covered in the initial costs.

This ultimately ensures we can do all our studio days we have booked and hopefully make our 5 track EP available for download! But they say the sky's the limit and that's where we are aiming so...

IF we exceed our expectations and get more than we need, we will be prioritizing a full physical release of the EP! And everyone who pledges for a digital download will get the physical copy for FREE! That's pretty Wild right!?
 

Nobody does something for nothing and we don't expect you to either! The following is a list of what to expect in return for your help! Some rewards are based on the amount you pledge and are completely optional. Anything you're willing to give, we are happy to receive!

The Rewards:

- A Thank You from all of us Strays!
- Your name immortalized on our website!
- A Digital Download of the EP itself! (And a physical copy depending on funding!)
- Mini merchandise pack that includes: a poster, sticker and guitar picks!
- Opportunity to be in our first official music video! (To be announced)
- Opportunity to come join us for a mini house party BBQ to celebrate the launch!

On top of this, we have some stretch goals that will start to be announced as the wheels get turning! So make sure you spread the word, so we can give you all more stuff!
 

It means that we can achieve something we have tried so hard to achieve for the past year. Something we wish we could give you without your help but are saddened to know we can't...

It allows us to create something tangible and real that says to our future generations: The Wild Strays were here. Our mark on the worlds of Today, Tomorrow and Next Millennium.

But most importantly, it allows us to give our Bassist the farewell he deserves...

After playing with some of the members of the band for over 4 years; our Finger Maestro, Jake Adshead, is leaving us shortly after recording to do the most honorable of tasks: Fight for our Freedom as part of the British Army.

We can think of no better send off and act of gratitude than immortalizing him on record as a founding member of The Wild Strays!
 

No task is without it's challenges, fortunately for you, these will be our burden to bear. Nonetheless, here is a brief look at what's at stake...

Less pledges = Less Songs
If we fall too short of our mark, we may not be able to afford the studio time required to manage all 5 planned songs. Which may reduce the amount of songs on the EP and minimise the overall quality!

The Not So Physical Release
Physically printing a record costs upwards of £300, depending on quality. So we can only concern ourselves with such upon covering the studio time. We may be able to release the EP physically in the future, but we need to ensure there is enough songs on there to make it worth it! Even more reason to ensure our initial goal is met!

Crushing Disappointment
Not just for us but also for those we have looked upon for our help. Not achieving our funding could result in having to let down our Producer and Recording Studio and then we would all feel sad!

As it stands, we don't have any major financial commitments and we have little to lose at this point. This in a sense, minimizes our risks but hopefully doesn't diminish our need to achieve the goal!
 

We will be promoting this in every way we can because ultimately we want to give you the best that we can offer! If you've read this far, then you must be just as invested as us; so why not help us all out by strengthening our pack?

You can does by sharing this page like it's a box of After Eights at a dinner party...

In other words... Tell your friends, tell your family, tell your families friends pets mothers! Let everyone know our mission so we can make something truly Wild!

And last but not least...

Thank you for checking out our Crowdfund page, you have our gratitude for even reading this very sentence! If what you see doesn't interest you, then perhaps you know someone who it might...? It's up to you but we appreciate you all the same!
 

That's all for now! Stay tuned for more updates as the campaign goes on!

And just remember...
Keep it Wild, Strays!

story:
Short Summary

  • With the launch of MassOpera we are looking to cultivate experiences for artists and audiences that challenge the status quo and reflect our diverse community, including this new translation of Die Fledermaus
  • This campaign is important because we want to grow our new brand as MassOpera and show the world the groundbreaking work we are doing with workshopping new operas and reinterpreting classic ones too.  
  • Your contribution will go directly to paying artists for their work.  Every dollar donated will either go to one of our singers, orchestra members, designers, or other production staff involved in this production of Die Fledermaus.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $10,000 in order to ensure our production of Die Fledermaus is a success
  • Every single giving level comes with an awesome swag perk: from a Die Fledermaus Sticker all the way to a MassOpera Fleece Jacket, we have all types of cool perks available.  The more you give the more perks and swag you will receive
  • Every single donor, no matter how large or small, is invited to our Campaign Close-Out and Cast Party at Club Café on Tuesday April 16th, and will be listed in the program for Die Fledermaus.

The Impact

Your donation to this campaign puts MassOpera in an amazing place during our inaugural season:

  • Solid funding for Die Fledermaus means a stellar production
  • Donating during this, our 12th season as a company, and first season as MassOpera, means you are directly supporting this company push the art-form of opera forward

Risks & Challenges

About 70% of our annual revenue comes from individual contributions.  Ticket sales to our productions cover only a tiny fraction of the funds we need to produce artistically excellent and ground-breaking opera.

  • With your generous donation, and you wearing these swag items out and about, you will help get our new name, MassOpera, out there, AND you will be supporting emerging artists at the same time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate directly but want to help consider:

  • Getting the word out.  Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Consider volunteering for one of our events or performances by reaching out to info@massopera.org

story:
Positive Music

I'm Rhea, an Indian-Australian upcoming urban artist with a love for music! I want to give my music career a kickstart, with a goal to create a full length album! Come and join me on my journey!

 

Where Does The Money Go?

My starting goal is $5000 so I can fund my next singles (and album!) The funding will go to recording the songs, mastering them and creating film clips! We want to create the best music possible and most importantly music that inspires others.

We want to create music with impact.

 

The Impact

Music is in everybody's lives, everyday. Music is in our souls, hearts and minds. Creating good sounding and good feeling music is important in a world full of stress and negativity. The words of an inspiring song can turn someone's day around and bring a smile to their face.

That's what I wish to accomplish.

By supporting me, you can help support my dream and my music! (And get some rewards along the way too!)

 

Other Ways YOU Can Help!

If you like my music or my message but you can't donate, then tell a friend! Share my indieGoGo and my music on social media and let people know about it!

With your support, we can do this together! You make this happen!

Much love, Rhea

story:
Hello,

My name is Jordan. I am an actor, dancer, choreographer, director and filmmaker from Edmonton, AB. I come from a traditional Chinese Canadian family and grew up dancing. I studied musical theatre after high school and have been performing in musicals around Canada for the past 5 years, Most recently I was at the Charlottetown Festival where I met Alicia Toner, who is an incredible artist and her music is undeniably amazing.  From the first time I heard her music I wanted to create a dance concept video for one of her songs, and when I asked Alicia about it she told me about her new single she was releasing in 2019 - "Dangerous Home". This song deals with an abusive relationship and how hard it is to leave an abusive relationship when it's all you've known. This piece is extremely important to me because I feel it is an issue that needs to be talked about. I truly believe in doing things that can be terrifying. For me, that is putting my own artistic vision on an issue like an abusive relationship. Funding will push this project to the next level and allow me to really create what I have envisioned.

My goal is to raise $5,000 CAD, which will allow me to rent the proper equipment as well as the insurance coverage, plus pay the crew, cast and experts to film and edit this music video. It will also enable me to provide Alicia with a music video that she deserves. Artists should be compensated for the work that they do and any contribution to this project will allow that to happen. 

The Impact

The Arts are such an important part of life as they allow us to feel things we may subconsciously block out. Art gives us an escape and a way to express ourselves. For me, music and dance have always been ways to embody the more complex emotions. We have all gone through some kind of mental health issue or have witnessed a loved one suffer. I feel that society is starting to realize the positive impact art can have for our mental health. By contributing to this project, you are aiding artists such as myself in telling the stories and expressing the emotions that most of society bottles up. Finally, I hope this contributes to Alicia's future as an artist; she needs to be heard.  

Thank you for all your support, and I hope you will contribute to this project that is near and dear to my heart.

If you are unable to contribute at this time, please help me spread the word by sharing this indiegogo page. 

Sincerely,

Jordan Mah

story:
About Me

Hi, my name is Chad Matthews.

I'm a singer from Northport, Prince Edward Island, a small town in western Prince Edward Island, Canada. I am a single dad of four teenage boys - Joel, Nick, Zack, and Dylan. I fished for many years before taking a seasonal job as greenskeeper on a golf course in beautiful Mill River. I also play Canada's legendary entertainer Stompin' Tom in a dinner theatre in Skinners Pond, where Tom spent a few years of his childhood.

 

 

Lately I've turned to singing Gospel music, although I still love to sing Tom's songs when I get the chance. I believe the world needs the kind of calm, peaceful healing that inspirational music provides.

One of my favourite devotional tunes is The River by Brian Doerksen. Its soothing, healing melody and message seem divinely inspired. I can easily picture a music video where troubled souls come to a river to ease their pain. My music seems to connect with people. It's humbling to know that some folks play my songs over and over, that their souls are calmed by my voice and the message of light I feel compelled to share with the world.

I cannot imagine a greater gift than sharing this light with others via a beautiful music video featuring Brian Doerksen's amazing song. Contributors to this meaningful campaign will be an essential part of this incredible gift. Thank you!

What I Need

Living in a remote area has its challenges. In order to make this meaningful video, I need to bring in some folks with special skills. I have an incredible team who believe in me lined up and ready to go, with a shoot planned for over two days in July. Funding includes labour and gear as well as travel and accommodation costs overnight for crew who live two or more hours away. Our goal is $12 000 overall; apart from cast and crew, this also includes an amazing award-winning cinematographer as well as licensing fees for Brian's song. 

Perks for helping me out will include 

  • Signed call sheets from the shoot
  • A digital download card of my Gospel CD
  • Signed Gospel CD
  • Coffee time and signed CD
  • Campfire tunes with me at your cottage or home (P.E.I.)
  • Private concert with my band at your cottage or home (P.E.I.)

If we don't reach our entire goal, our team will come together to make a simpler video.

The Impact

I'm so blessed in that I have played many shows over the years that affect people's lives in positive ways. Stompin' Tom's songs are a lot of fun to share, and sometimes my shows are energized just by playing cover tunes. But it's the Gospel songs that are really touching souls and making a difference in people's lives.

How Great Thou Art and Amazing Grace are staples in my live shows these days. They are truly changing lives, as I hear almost on a daily basis.  My band and I play at seniors' homes; it's incredible how touched these people are by the gift of music, and I am grateful to be the one to bring it to them. I heard recently that a troubled teen listens to my Gospel CD every day and that it calms his soul. Lonely people rely on it. I am incredibly humbled by the gift of music, a gift that started back in my childhood when I needed an escape. That escape became music.

Risks & Challenges

It seems everything is risky these days with COVID around. It brings unknowns into our lives. I believe this is the biggest risk. I was recently the main character in an NFB documentary film so I know what's involved in shooting an intense story-style music video. I'm comfortable on camera and am used to functioning with a busy crew around me. I know and trust the people I'll be working with. We'll have fun; we're like family, and I can't wait to work with those folks again. My boys will be in the video too - what a special memory we will be creating together in our own little part of the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If it's not possible for you to help out with a monetary donation, you can help by listening to my songs on Spotify or another online music retailer, and spreading the word about my music. If you are local, we will need snacks and meals and accommodations. Every and all contribution is welcome. Sharing this campaign on social media will also be an incredible help!

I cannot thank you enough for believing in me and for helping me get this beautiful music video and song out into the world.

God Bless -

Chad

They are truly changing lives, as I hear almost on a daily basis.  My band and I play at seniors' homes; it's incredible how touched these people are by the gift of music, and I am grateful to be the one to bring it to them. I heard recently that a troubled teen listens to my Gospel CD every day and that it calms his soul. Lonely people rely on it. I am incredibly humbled by the gift of music, a gift that started back in my childhood when I needed an escape. That escape became music.

Risks & Challenges
It seems everything is risky these days with COVID around. It brings unknowns into our lives. I believe this is the biggest risk. I was recently the main character in an NFB documentary film so I know what's involved in shooting an intense story-style music video. I'm comfortable on camera and am used to functioning with a busy crew around me. I know and trust the people I'll be working with. We'll have fun; we're like family, and I can't wait to work with those folks again. My boys will be in the video too - what a special memory we will be creating together in our own little part of the world.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
 

If it's not possible for you to help out with a monetary donation, you can help by listening to my songs on Spotify or another online music retailer, and spreading the word about my music. If you are local, we will need snacks and meals and accommodations. Every and all contribution is welcome. Sharing this campaign on social media will also be an incredible help!
I cannot thank you enough for believing in me and for helping me get this beautiful music video and song out into the world.
God Bless -
Chad

story:
Return To Edinburgh

It is time.  We have been called back to the homeland to make the highly-anticipated follow up to 2018's "At Least We've Got This Madness".

Unicorns, Castles, Haggis, Scotch, and Luv.   And you.  You are the most important part of contributing to making the rock record that will save our world in 2020.  Don't delay.  You are needed now more than ever.  The human race needs you.

What We Need & What You Get

Music (Art) / Art (Music) is free in our day and age:

  • We are crowdfunding $8,000 to cover the costs of tracking, mixing, and mastering.  And flying and lodging and hiring local musicians.  Also, we occasionally like to feed Seanski.  He's getting a bit thin if you ask me.
  • Get EXCITED for exclusive, weekly LUV DOT GLUV interviews with band members, fans, and friends.  If you haven't met the GLUV yet, you are in for a real treat.  (See @luvdotgov on the Instagrams)
  • The album, of course, will be released on all streaming services for your listening pleasure.  Remember.  We do this because we luv it.  And yes, it's free to listen  - but it still costs thousands of pounds to create the things worth listening to.  

The Impact

Global Domination.  The planet needs LUV, now more than ever before.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign around to your friends and enemies on all social media outlets.  #luvdotgov2020

story:
Hey! My name is Kyle Duke. I’m a Brooklyn-based DIY songwriter and producer, and I need your help with my next project. 

When I was in my final year of high school, I started Kyle Duke and the Brown Bag Boys. I had been writing songs and playing in bands since before I could remember, and with the other members of my high school punk band graduated and out of town, I was left with a clean creative slate during the most exciting and turbulent time of my life yet. I had recently picked up bass and drums and had spent a bit of time interning in recording studios and learning the ins and outs of engineering, so rather than assembling a new band, I decided to try my hand at a solo project, playing and recording all of the instruments myself in an attempt to create a sound that was uniquely and entirely me. A few years later, I’m now working on the release of the 3rd self-produced Kyle Duke and the Brown Bag Boys record Amphibian, and a music video for it’s lead single “Sheena Doesn’t Mind."

The support of my peers has always been an important part of my music’s existence. From friends playing my earliest singles on their university radio shows and sharing my music on their blogs and podcasts to taking my older brother and two best friends as band members on tours of basements and bars up and down the east coast, my career would not exist if it weren’t for the generosity of others. In this same spirit, I have tried to gear my own creative work in a direction that supports other DIY artists, in recording and producing other underground bands, booking tours with fellow unsigned acts, and collaborating when I can with independent visual artists and filmmakers. When Emmi approached me about wanting to shoot a video for “Sheena,” I hadn’t even considered making a visual for the track. I was honored that the song had resonated with her enough to inspire an idea for a video, and excited by how driven she was to make it happen. She assembled an amazing production crew and just a couple months after our first meeting, we are set to go into production on November 9. All we need now is the support of our community to raise the remaining budget of this independent production.

Every donation in support of “Sheena Doesn’t Mind" will go a long way in insuring that we have the materials, locations, and crew necessary in bringing our group passion project to life. As a thank you, every donor will receive a handwritten thank you note and a free download of the single. Higher tier perks include a download of the currently unreleased track “Mood Swings," Special Thanks in the credits and an advanced link to the official video. 

We have all been humbled in the past by the generosity of our friends, family, and colleagues in helping bring our creative endeavors to fruition, and it would mean the world to have your support in this project.

Our Team:

This video will be produced by Brickhead, a music video production company co-founded Nick Freeman and Bre Kelly. 

Nick is a Brooklyn based producer and cinematographer who also works as a content creator for Universal Music Group. He has shot videos for a variety of artists and brands including Post Malone, NAV, Dean Lewis, Puma, Amazon Music, and the Foundation For a Better Life. Nick’s cinematography work will also be featured at the New Yorker Festival this year.

Producer Bre Kelly has held multiple project coordinating and creative positions in the music industry, primarily in A&R and music video production. She was formerly employed by Atlantic Records and now works for RCA. 

Director Emmi Shockley is a recent NYU Tisch graduate with a BFA in Film and Television Production. Her past directing work has included the shorts Don't Be a Baby and We Regret to Inform You and has screened in festivals such as The Cannes International Film Festival, The Bowery Film Festival, and The Tennessee Women's International Film Festival.

story:
My Story

Hi everyone, my name is David Galvan - also known as GALVN. I am a pianist/composer/songwriter. I’ve played the piano for almost 20 years now, and I need your help. A little backstory - I was born 3 months premature, and my parents didn’t think their one-pound baby would make it. They fought for me, and I fought to live. Among the various struggles, I didn’t talk until I was 3, but... music was my outlet. It always has been, and here I am today! It's been a blessing everyday to do music full-time, and I am truly grateful to everyone who has supported me.

Fast-forward to this campaign, doing a full length album has always been a dream of mine, and now, I finally have the chance to be able to do it with your help! I am currently finishing my final semester at my Conservatory with a major in Piano Performance, and once I finish, I will be working on my first full-length album. I have always wanted to create music that showed people what I've been inspired by musically throughout my life and that also told my life experiences. This album will involve some of my closest friends whom I have met through my musical journey, and it means the world to have them by my side. All of the funds will be going to producing, mixing, mastering, helping pay session musicians and any miscellaneous costs. With your donation, you’ll be able to choose between different perks such as a social media shoutout, a signed CD, a piano cover of your favorite song, one-hour piano lesson... I’ll even perform a piano concert at your house!

Thank you so much from the bottom of my heart to everyone who has supported me as well as my dreams over the years and to everyone who continues to support me! With your help, you will be helping me take the first step in achieving one of my biggest dreams. Anything and everything helps - even a share. I can't wait to share my dreams with you!

 

What You're Contributing To

I am hoping to raise $5,000 for this album. If we successfully reach our goal, I will be able to cover the costs of 

  • Producer Fees - I will be able to work with a very experienced and talented producer who will help shape the sound of the LP. He was an assistant under producer Malay (Frank Ocean, John Legend, Zayn Malik).
  • Studio Time - I will be able to rent out a professional studio 
  • Session Musicians - I will be able to pay different session musicians like string players, guitarists, and many more who will play on the album
  • Mixing and Mastering - I will be able to pay the sound engineer who will help mix and master the album (i.e. make sure the music you hear is of the utmost quality)
  • Distribution Costs - I will be able to distribute physical copies of the album and make it accessible through digital distribution (Spotify, Apple Music, Amazon Music, etc.)
  • Graphic Design - I will be able to hire a graphic designer to help design CD packaging, album art, and different merchandise that I will be selling such as T-shirts, buttons and dad hats
  • Miscellaneous Costs - Shipping fees, Indiegogo costs, unforeseen costs

Perks

  • $5 - Social Media Shoutout - I will give you a personal shoutout on my Instagram thanking you for your donation! Make sure to include your Instagram handle when you donate.
  • $15 - Digital Download of the Album - You will get a digital download of the album before it's even released to the public! You will also get the social media shoutout!
  • $25 - Signed CD - You will get a signed physical copy of the album shipped to you along with the Digital Download and the Social Media Shoutout.
  • $50 - Personal Shoutout / Piano Cover - I will give you a personal video shoutout and make a piano cover of your favorite song! I will post the video on YouTube and email you the MP3 file of the cover so that you can save it if you'd like! You will also get the the Signed CD, Digital Download, and Social Media Shoutout!
  • $80 - 1-Hour Piano Lesson (Limited Perk) - I will give you a one hour piano lesson whether it is on Skype or in person! If in person, you must be within a 50-mile radius from Los Angeles, CA. You will also get the Personal Shoutout / Piano Cover, Signed CD, Digital Download, and Social Media Shoutout!
  • $150 - Printed Album Thank You Credits - I will print your name in the Thank You Credits of the Physical Album and you will also get access to demos of different songs on the album! You will also get the Personal Shoutout / Piano Cover, Signed CD, Digital Download, and Social Media Shoutout.
  • $500 - In-House Concert (Limited Perk)​ - I will come to your house and perform a concert for you and your friends / family. Must be within a 100-mile radius from Los Angeles, CA. You will also get the Printed Album Thank You Credits, Personal Shoutout / Piano Cover, Signed CD, Digital Download, and Social Media Shoutout.
  • $750 - Customized Song (Limited Perk) - My producer and I will produce a song just for you. You can choose the style and genre, and if you are an artist, you can use it for yourself! You will also get the Printed Album Thank You Credits, Personal Shoutout / Piano Cover, Signed CD, Digital Download, and Social Media Shoutout.
  • $1000 - Executive Producer - You will be named as an executive producer on the album and receive ALL of the perks above! 

All of the funds that are donated towards this project will go towards the album. If I am not able to reach my entire goal, I will try to pay out of my own pocket. None of this would be possible without you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to contribute monetarily, sharing with your friends and family will help this project come to life. Please share this project with everyone you know!

Thank you EVERYONE for your help!

David / GALVN

David / GALVN

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! I am so excited to announce I am finally making my FIRST EVER ALBUM!! Music has been my lifelong love and something that has healed me time and time again, and I'm hoping I can do the same for others with my music. I have the songs written, now I just need your help to get into the studio and bring my work to life!! :')

What We Need & What You Get

This EP is going to be 4 songs, and every dollar earned will go towards production, mixing, recording, studio time, album artwork, streaming sites, etc. If I'm able to raise the full campaign amount, I'll be able to make a music video (which would be a literal dream come true!) but first things first:

In exchange for your support, I will be giving out 'thank you' gifts (check out the Perks to this project!) for your generous support. Whether it be one dollar or one thousand, I will cry happy tears and be eternally grateful. Your generosity means the whole entire world to me.

The Impact

I started my career as an 8 year old singing demo's and theme songs (such as Barney, Angelina Ballerina, Bob the Builder, etc.) for my dad in our in home studio. As you can imagine, these were some of my coolest and most special childhood memories with my dad.

For those of you who don't know, my dad, Mark Williamson, is one of the most amazingly talented musicians, songwriters, and producers to ever exist. He's worked with some of the most extraordinary icons, including Freddie Mercury and Roger Daltrey. My dad has been battling advanced Parkinson's disease for the last 20 years and has been unable to make music or sing at all due to his illness' progression, so I want to finish what he started. Growing up around all of this shaped me into the person I am, and I learned so much about following your heart and perseverance through from my dad. He gave me this gift and I'm going to use it! 

I can't wait to do this with you guys by my side! Thank you so much for your support, I am wholeheartedly and infinitely grateful.

Sincerely yours,

Danielle Rae Williamson

story:
Mike Randall & The High Road

Mike Randall & The High Road have been making authentic country music around the state of Texas and surrounding states for the last 3 years and are proud to introduce their first full length album release entitled "Bakersfield, TX".

The record takes you from the deserts of the West to the swamps of the South, to the honky tonk sounds of Bakersfield, CA and the country and bluegrass sounds of Nashville, TN and Dallas, TX.

  • HERE'S A LITTLE BIT ABOUT WHO I AM: I was raised the son of Baptist preacher, although music was just as much a part of our family foundation as anything else. In my adult life I've come to realize how blessed I was to be raised in such a musically rich family. With roots connecting to Billy Graham Crusades, churches and gospel music connections all across the country - it was a natural shift from Gospel music to Country Music for me. I was ready to spend the rest of my musical career in the church as a worship pastor but fortunately, God had other plans. After a rough divorce, my reality naturally became Country Music. With a handful of songs and broken heart, I started playing my songs and sharing my story to anyone and everyone who would hear. Thousands of miles later and close to 500 Live shows later - "Mike Randall & The High Road" are picking up steam and poised to start making real waves in the Country Music arena. 
  • "Bakersfield, TX" is my story through song, and I'm awful proud of it.  We recorded the album at "Acoustic Kitchen" - produced by Milo Deering and co-produced by his daughter Scarlett Deering. Acoustic Kitchen was built and designed by country music legend Charlie Pride. It was a joy spending three days laying down the tracks that would become "Bakersfield, TX".  Here is everyone involved in the project:
    • Mike Randall - Guitars, Vocals, Songwriter
    • Nik Lee - Lead Guitar (Texas Gentlemen front man and songwriter)
    • Scott Jenkins - Pedal Steel (Cody Jinks, and too many to name)
    • Ben Bigby - Bass Guitar (Summer Dean, RRM, etc)
    • Andrew Pederson (SouthFM and production guru)
    • Jenna Clark - BGV’s (Singer, Songwriter, Musician)
    • Milo Deering - Fiddle, Dobro, Pedal Steel, Mandolin (The Eagles, too many to name)
    • Scarlett Deering - Fiddle, Engineering (Zane Williams, The Eagles, too many...)
    • Mixed by Taylor Tatsch 
    • Mastered by Justin Perkins
    • Art Work by Pecos McCool

What We Need & What You Get

Cutting to the chase: The record is made, artwork is being made, but....we still have work to do, and it ain't cheap. Here are the basic #'s of what we are looking at.

  • Mixing & Mastering = 2.5K
  • Physical Duplication (CD's & Vinyl) = 2.5K
  • Radio Promotion = 1K

The Impact

We have come a LONG way with this record. It's something we are all proud of and can't wait to share with you. It's a genuine tale of life, love an heartbreak - told in honky tonk style. 

  • Country Music needs this record, and so you do!
    • We all know that the world needs more great, authentic country music.
  • At every show people come up and thank us for the real music and real lyrics.
  • If my story can help one person get through their struggles, then this is all worth it.
  • This record will open doors for us like never before, in a very real way.

Risks & Challenges

The good news is that we are so close to getting this baby brought to full term and brought into the world! The record is being mixed as we speak. The mastering guru is patiently waiting, and the Vinyl is warm and ready to be pressed - but this all takes money. As the Covid-19 pandemic took our main source of income away (live shows) our need for capital funds became very real, very quickly. But we have a plan, and this is where we need your help!

  • Once the record comes back from being Mixed, it goes straight to Mastering.
  • Once we have the record in hand, we can begin utilizing our connections and resources to start distributing this album properly to radio and retail outlets as well as agencies and potential labels.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can help to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
    • Just simply share this
  • Visit our Merch Site and buy some merch!
story_txt:
Mike Randall & The High Road
Mike Randall & The High Road have been making authentic country music around the state of Texas and surrounding states for the last 3 years and are proud to introduce their first full length album release entitled "Bakersfield, TX".
The record takes you from the deserts of the West to the swamps of the South, to the honky tonk sounds of Bakersfield, CA and the country and bluegrass sounds of Nashville, TN and Dallas, TX.

HERE'S A LITTLE BIT ABOUT WHO I AM: I was raised the son of Baptist preacher, although music was just as much a part of our family foundation as anything else. In my adult life I've come to realize how blessed I was to be raised in such a musically rich family. With roots connecting to Billy Graham Crusades, churches and gospel music connections all across the country - it was a natural shift from Gospel music to Country Music for me. I was ready to spend the rest of my musical career in the church as a worship pastor but fortunately, God had other plans. After a rough divorce, my reality naturally became Country Music. With a handful of songs and broken heart, I started playing my songs and sharing my story to anyone and everyone who would hear. Thousands of miles later and close to 500 Live shows later - "Mike Randall & The High Road" are picking up steam and poised to start making real waves in the Country Music arena. 
"Bakersfield, TX" is my story through song, and I'm awful proud of it.  We recorded the album at "Acoustic Kitchen" - produced by Milo Deering and co-produced by his daughter Scarlett Deering. Acoustic Kitchen was built and designed by country music legend Charlie Pride. It was a joy spending three days laying down the tracks that would become "Bakersfield, TX".  Here is everyone involved in the project:
Mike Randall - Guitars, Vocals, Songwriter
Nik Lee - Lead Guitar (Texas Gentlemen front man and songwriter)
Scott Jenkins - Pedal Steel (Cody Jinks, and too many to name)
Ben Bigby - Bass Guitar (Summer Dean, RRM, etc)
Andrew Pederson (SouthFM and production guru)
Jenna Clark - BGV’s (Singer, Songwriter, Musician)
Milo Deering - Fiddle, Dobro, Pedal Steel, Mandolin (The Eagles, too many to name)
Scarlett Deering - Fiddle, Engineering (Zane Williams, The Eagles, too many...)
Mixed by Taylor Tatsch 
Mastered by Justin Perkins
Art Work by Pecos McCool




What We Need & What You Get
Cutting to the chase: The record is made, artwork is being made, but....we still have work to do, and it ain't cheap. Here are the basic #'s of what we are looking at.

Mixing & Mastering = 2.5K
Physical Duplication (CD's & Vinyl) = 2.5K
Radio Promotion = 1K


The Impact
We have come a LONG way with this record. It's something we are all proud of and can't wait to share with you. It's a genuine tale of life, love an heartbreak - told in honky tonk style. 

Country Music needs this record, and so you do!We all know that the world needs more great, authentic country music.

At every show people come up and thank us for the real music and real lyrics.
If my story can help one person get through their struggles, then this is all worth it.
This record will open doors for us like never before, in a very real way.


Risks & Challenges
The good news is that we are so close to getting this baby brought to full term and brought into the world! The record is being mixed as we speak. The mastering guru is patiently waiting, and the Vinyl is warm and ready to be pressed - but this all takes money. As the Covid-19 pandemic took our main source of income away (live shows) our need for capital funds became very real, very quickly. But we have a plan, and this is where we need your help!

Once the record comes back from being Mixed, it goes straight to Mastering.
Once we have the record in hand, we can begin utilizing our connections and resources to start distributing this album properly to radio and retail outlets as well as agencies and potential labels.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

You can help to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!Just simply share this

Visit our Merch Site and buy some merch!

story:
***DIGITAL RELEASE: 20TH NOVEMBER 2020***

***PHYSICAL RELEASE: our first two campaigns combined have raised 10% of the 1000 pre-orders we need - THANK YOU***

----

Mastered at Abbey Road Studios, Tropical Forest Project: Ecuador (album/book) is a spellbinding journey featuring exclusive recordings and songs from Grammy Award winning artists, a 20-piece orchestra, and hypnotic soundscapes recorded in Ecuador's magical cloud forests.

Your purchase helps World Land Trust's conservation partners in Ecuador expand Nangaritza Reserve, establishing a protected forest corridor between the Andes mountains and Amazon lowlands, and protected areas for its indigenous Shuar community.

Summary

Ginkgo Music's mission is to promote music as a force in forest conservation through projects linking music and ecology. We believe that music can play a part in shaping a popular culture that addresses our relationship with the natural world. 

Tropical Forest Project: Ecuador is our first release. It's an album accompanied by a 100 page book featuring lyrics, articles and wildlife photography. Each copy sold will raise money to permanently protect a bit of Ecuador's fabulous, mysterious and wildlife rich cloud forests.  It will be released simultaneously in physical and digital formats just as soon as we have 920 pre-orders of the physical product (book/CD). That's where you come in!

 

What You Get

A coffee shop acoustic experience, with forest soundscapes positioned between groups of songs, featuring 16 artists, including two Grammy Award winners, a 20-piece orchestra, dawn choruses recorded in Ecuador's cloud forests. 

An accompanying 100-page bilingual (English/Spanish) book features wildlife photography, song lyrics, articles from biologists working in Ecuador, and poetry from Mexican environmentalist Homero Aridjis and Cambridge astrophysicist Rebecca Elson. 

Perfect for you, someone you love, and our planet. 

 

Tracklist

01. Río Canandé Reserve - Dawn Chorus | Coro del amanecer 1

02. Kate Walsh - You Are Home

03. The Nextmen featuring Zarif - Something Got You

04. Federico Aubele - Te Quiero a Ti

05. Cibelle - Instante de Dois

06. Nathan Ball feat. Adrianne Wininsky - Hideaway Snowflakes

07. Dobet Gnahoré - Kokpa

08. Cecilia Zabala - Canción Mojada

09. Valentin Gerlier - This is the Waltz

10. Río Canandé Reserve - Dawn Chorus | Coro del amanecer 2

11. Vânia Bastos - Os Fazedores de Chuva

12. Martha Tilston - Good World

13. Margarita Laso - Manungo

14. Alan Lacroix - August

15. Devon Sproule featuring BJ Cole - Plea for a Good Night’s Rest

16. Jorupe Reserve - Dusk (pauraque duet) | Anochecer

17. Jorge Drexler - Gracias

18. David McAlmont - Fog on the Mountain

19. Morgan Szymanski - Villa-Lobos: Prelude No.1 for Guitar

20. Jorupe Reserve - Dawn Chorus | Coro del amanecer 3 

 

The Impact

Ecuador's unique mosaic of habitats within, East and West of the Andes make it one of the most species rich regions on planet Earth. To give you some idea: approximately 20% of all the known 20,000 butterfly species can be found somewhere in Ecuador. And that's just the butterflies....

Each album sold includes a £5.00 donation to World Land Trust (WLT), who will use the money to help their conservation partners in Ecuador expand wildlife reserves in one of the most biodiversity rich regions on our planet, including Nangaritza Reserve in Southern Ecuador, where Nature and Culture International are establishing a protected forest corridor between the Andes mountains and Amazon lowlands, with protected areas for its indigenous Shuar communities. The more successful is this album, the larger the area of forest we safeguard for generations to come.

By the end of this initial phase of the project we will have raised a minimum of £5000. Once we've met our target the album will be more widely distributed, raising more funds for World Land Trust's forest conservation work in Ecuador.

 

What We Need

920 pre-orders of Tropical Forest Project: Ecuador in its physical format (album +  book) will enable us to make a simultaneous physical/digital release. That's how many pre-orders of the physical album will make it viable and affordable. This includes £2053 already pledged.

 

Risks & Challenges

Book design is complete and ready to go. All we need is your order. The book is printed at high quality, so a minimum of 920 pre-orders means we can manufacture at a sensible price. It's as simple as that. ***Please note: due to the varying impact of coronavirus on postal services around the world, although we will aim to despatch your copy of Tropical Forest Project: Ecuador on completion of the campaign, delivery times may vary considerably between regions***

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please follow us on Instagram, Facebook or Twitter
Share about the project with your friends
Donate £5 to the cause.

Thank you.
