story:
Hi! I’m so glad you’re here! 

Really quick Intro!

I’m an Americana artist, songwriter, singer, Asian food-lover, and mother of 3 humans  (+ 1 dog). 

In the middle of a pandemic, I’m making a new record in Nashville, TN.

 I’d LOVE LOVE LOVE for you to come along with me at every step. 

Why make a record right now?

Last summer, I had planned to take my music on tour in the USA to finance this record. Then the pandemic hit and everything was cancelled. This crowdsourcing campaign is a way for me to connect with you and share the progress of this creative project. So many times I've considered cancelling this album, but it keeps coming back to me. I'm opening my heart to you and to the music - it's for all of us.

What matters most right now, in the midst of a world turned upside down, are the relationships and people we cherish.

The songs on this new record are about real people. 

People have asked me for new music they can relate to - to help life feel a little lighter. You want peace and calm in a troubled world. 

I’ve heard your stories, and written songs with hit songwriters about the ups and downs, the confusion, the joy -  all of it.

The main purpose of this album is to gift something healing to a hurting world. 

In supporting this campaign, you’ll be bringing to life a new album from the heart of Nashville, TN with a Grammy-winning producer and some of the finest musicians in the industry. 

I’ve written and released 2 solo albums, judged competitions, and toured with incredible musicians. My last album won the nomination for Americana Album of the Year by the IMA, and my songs have been featured in films, on podcasts, playlists, etc. 

BUT, that doesn’t really matter much at the moment. 

What matters is you and me, making it through.

This will be a timeless album that cuts right to the heart of what you’re feeling, what I’m feeling, and that it’ll all be alright. More than ever, this album is about you, and so much less about me. I’d love to gift this to you and to the world. 

As an independent artist, I simply cannot afford to do this without your help. So thank you, in advance for sharing the vision of what this means. Please contribute if you’re able, and share generously. 

When it’s finished, I’ll sing.

You can close your eyes and just press play.

Thank you, with all my love!

Angela

Perks for Supporters:

Here’s what you’ll get! Choose from any of the options on the right-hand side bar to pick the reward you’d like. These also can be gifted to friends and family (Christmas, birthdays, etc) so let me know if you want to gift a reward level!

  • Digital album download
  • Advance signed copy of the album (CD)
  • Album credit for sponsorship 
  • 3-Pack Album Download of all CDs 
  • Northwest Beanie designed by Angela
  • 18x24 Album Artwork Poster
  • Premium Mahalo Ukulele signed by Angela
  • Instagram Account Takeover 
  • Song Lyrics & Sheet Music 
  • Private In-Person House Concert 
  • Co-write a song with me
  • Sponsor a Music Video 

*The album recording will begin in March 2021, releases will begin summer of 2021.

Campaign Cost Breakdown:

The making & release of this record will cost an estimated $37,000 inclusive of:

  • Studio time for approx. 7 full days of recording in Nashville, TN
  • Producer fee (pre-production/production)
  • Engineering (recording, mixing & mastering)
  • Studio musician fees
  • Travel costs, food, accommodations & incidentals (for the duration of recording and mixing)
  • Media Promotion & Publicity (US, UK & Europe)
  • Product Fulfillment & Distribution (mailing worldwide!)

TRUTH: I need to raise more than my stated goal of $20,000, but this amount will help get it started!

If I don’t reach my ultimate goal of $37,000 (pays for ALL the bells and whistles), the funds will be used to make an EP, which is a 4-5 song collection and costs $20,000 for just the recording process.

(*Just FYI, Indiegogo takes 5% of total contributions after the campaign closes, plus a 3% per transaction fee.)

Track Record

In 2018 you helped fund a successful Kickstarter campaign that created this album:

Second Wind won the Americana Album of the Year nomination in 2019, and the single, Rocks won the Great American Songwriting Contest! Without you, none of this would have been possible. 

This new album is about getting through the hard stuff - something we ALL need right now. With your help, it will reach a global audience that needs to hear it. I’m working with top-level songwriters, and amazing musicians and production staff.

We’ll be making an album about heartbreak, celebrating the little things, slowing down, changes, happy childhoods, and so much more. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for taking the time to support this project.

How it Works

When you select a campaign tier, you'll be taken to a checkout page. You can select to contribute more than your tier amount if you choose. Once you make the contribution before the campaign closes, you'll be added to the supporter club! I'll send you updates twice a month about how the album is going, updates, and anything you need to know prior to release. We're anticipating the release date starting in July 2021.

I chose to use Indiegogo as a platform because there is no "all or nothing" policy. Whatever funds we raise will be available to use toward the album. Which is great! 

Also side note! If you are planning to donate, it helps the algorithm if you do it within the first 48 hours of launch. This means my campaign is boosted to the front page of Indiegogo and given more web traffic attention. (Thank you!)

Risks & Challenges

In a normal year, artists make albums, and then tour with those songs to recoup the costs. Currently during the pandemic however, live show revenue is severely limited. The challenge of making a financially viable album is extreme right now.

That's why with your valued support, we hope to minimize those risks while also making a high-quality album that fully reflects our artistic goals. Unforeseen costs and challenges can arise during the course of making and releasing an album. (Like, the babysitter gets sick!) We'll keep you informed of those and try our best to stay within the budget.

*All funds will be used only for the creation and promotion of this album.

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand if you would like to support but are unable to make a financial contribution! There are several other ways to lend support if you'd like:

  • Spread the word and please SHARE! Share this campaign on your social media pages or tell a friend who might be interested in supporting. There's a link to share at the top of this page.
  • "Like" and "Follow" us on Facebook & Instagram @angelasoffemusic!
  • Join our "Soffology" mailing list to hear about the latest ventures and upcoming gigs (See email sign-up form at https://www.angelasoffe.com)
  • Follow the music on Spotify or other streaming platforms!

story:
Short Summary

For a recently recorded sample, rough mix:

https://m.soundcloud.com/richardmoody-1/path-of...

"The clouds in the sky frame the moon flying high, and the stars that shine so true,

Will illuminate down to the shapes on the ground that my footsteps drew,

The path of a heart that's true...."

My name is Richard Moody, and I am looking for support to complete the recording of a very special collection of songs.

The project is called "Tobacco & Rose', and is inspired by a journey that I have undertaken with different plant medicines. The songs have come to me in different ways, but usually they have involved working with a certain plant for physical or spiritual healing, resulting in the seed for a song. Add to this months of hard work, and the discernment gleaned from 30 years in music, and I have 11 songs that I am incredibly excited about.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I have done all of the writing and some of the pre-production for this project, but have now reached the point where I need your patronage: funding for musicians, sound engineering, and the production of the finished product. Even in this age of home studios and digital innovation, it is still expensive to make a proper sounding recording. It can be stressful for an artist, used to the freedom of his own living room, to know the meter is running in the recording studio. And the best sound engineers and musicians often cost the most, and deservedly so. I want the sound production of this record to match the quality of the songs.

So in addition some private sponsorship and funds I've already saved, I'm asking for $15,000 to make this happen. 

What do you get in return? Its up to you! You might choose a digital download, or you might want multiple CD or vinyl copies of the recording, or if you're wealthy, generous, or my mom, there are perks that allow for larger donations. Many different perk packages to suit your patronage needs ;)

Added bonus: you will receive video updates from myself and the band during the making of the record, an inside look at the creative process in the studio.

The Impact 

It is my desire to pass this music on to the world as art, entertainment and medicine for any who can benefit. Music is medicine, as important as ever in this age of environmental trauma, extractionism, and digital distraction, and I hope for the energy of these songs to reach out in unforeseen ways to help heal an increasingly distressed planet and the beings upon it.

And if that all sounds too woo woo for you, fair enough! At the core of it all, I'm a seasoned songwriter that aspires to make a classic record that will be remembered as one of the great albums to come out of Canada!

 I can't wait to share these tunes with you, some of which have been compared to the likes of Bob Dylan, Bruce Cockburn and Nick Drake, but that are all my own unique voice.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! Like my brand new "Tobacco and Rose" FB page, and visit my website to be added to my mailing list.

I have done all of the writing and some of the pre-production for this project, but have now reached the point where I need your patronage: funding for musicians, sound engineering, and the production of the finished product. Even in this age of home studios and digital innovation, it is still expensive to make a proper sounding recording. It can be stressful for an artist, used to the freedom of his own living room, to know the meter is running in the recording studio. And the best sound engineers and musicians often cost the most, and deservedly so. I want the sound production of this record to match the quality of the songs.
So in addition some private sponsorship and funds I've already saved, I'm asking for $15,000 to make this happen. 
What do you get in return? Its up to you! You might choose a digital download, or you might want multiple CD or vinyl copies of the recording, or if you're wealthy, generous, or my mom, there are perks that allow for larger donations. Many different perk packages to suit your patronage needs ;)
Added bonus: you will receive video updates from myself and the band during the making of the record, an inside look at the creative process in the studio.

The Impact 
It is my desire to pass this music on to the world as art, entertainment and medicine for any who can benefit. Music is medicine, as important as ever in this age of environmental trauma, extractionism, and digital distraction, and I hope for the energy of these songs to reach out in unforeseen ways to help heal an increasingly distressed planet and the beings upon it.
And if that all sounds too woo woo for you, fair enough! At the core of it all, I'm a seasoned songwriter that aspires to make a classic record that will be remembered as one of the great albums to come out of Canada!
 I can't wait to share these tunes with you, some of which have been compared to the likes of Bob Dylan, Bruce Cockburn and Nick Drake, but that are all my own unique voice.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word! Like my brand new "Tobacco and Rose" FB page, and visit my website to be added to my mailing list.

story:
Hello, patrons of the art!

We are a jazz trio based in Melbourne led by myself, pianist/composer ade ishs. This current line up has been playing together for over a year now in Melbourne and Bali—in 2018, we played at the internationally acclaimed Ubud Village Jazz Festival.

After a series of shows, it would be wonderful to document all the beautiful music we have played in the form of a new recording. Several years ago, I made a trio album that ABC Jazz picked as a favourite of 2013. Why not do it again?

You can be part of this, you know that? By giving us the financial help we need to make this a reality, you can get the benefit of becoming one among very few people that get early access to the recording! And the higher the level of your support, the more benefits you will also get.

What You Get and What We Need

If we meet our target, we’ll reward our backers (you!) according to the support level. Look at the unique perks we’re offering!

Now, what we need: I’ll make this brief. This project will go ahead as soon as we get at least $3,500.

If we can get more than the minimum amount we need, we will use the additional funding for more marketing and publicity. We hope that they will translate to more sales, which can also mean more recording in the future.

Extra $1,200 (total $4,700): A music video.

Extra $3,700 (total $7,200): A music video and a tour.

The Music

OK, I get it. You want to know what sort of thing you’ll get, right?

Watch this YouTube playlist of us playing at the 2018 Ubud Village Jazz Festival (all compositions by myself):

Indonesian magazine Jazzuality says about us: ‘Simply lovely feel-good show from ade ishs Trio, we hope to see him here again some other times.’

Dramatis Personae

We have the winning team on board already!

Joining me on drums is Alex Roper. Anyone who watches the Melbourne music scene will know that she is one of the finest drummers across various genres. Other bands Alex has played with include Quadrifid, Cool Explosions, Jazzlab Orcheztra, and Pigeon Presents. Recently, she joined Em Rusciano touring across Australia.

On bass, we have Rory Brown. Since moving from Sydney a couple of years ago, he has been highly in demand in Melbourne. Rory has played extensively throughout Australia as well as touring within Europe, Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. Other musicians Rory has played with include jazz vocalist Jill Barber (Canada), Charles Gayle (USA), Henry Grimes (USA), and Dereb the Ambassador (Ethiopia).

And myself, ade ishs, have recorded eight albums as a bandleader and pianist. Some musicians I have played with are Dung Nguyen (Australia), Geoff Kluke (Australia), Daigo Nakai (Germany), Benny Likumahuwa (Indonesia), Candra Malik (Indonesia), Reyharp (Britain), and Zamil Idris (Malaysia). I feel blessed to have gone to various places in Australia playing my original compositions in addition to making good friends.

Collectively, Alex, Rory, and I have performed at such respected venues as the Paris Cat Jazz Club (Melbourne) and Uptown Jazz Cafe (Melbourne), and prestigious festivals including Melbourne International Jazz Festivals; Ubud Village Jazz Festival (Indonesia); Wangaratta Festival of Jazz & Blues; Eltham Jazz, Food & Wine Festival; and St Kilda Festival.

In the engineering department, Allan Neuendorf is second to none when producing acoustic recordings. He first worked with me making the trio album mentioned above and since then, he’s been making great use of his expertise producing my other albums. I’m looking forward to collaborating with him again in this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If somehow you can’t contribute financially, that doesn’t mean you can’t help.

Please get the word out about this campaign and encourage your friends to contribute!

Last but not least, I would be very grateful for any support! We’ve been working very hard on this, and we look forward to sharing our music with you!

❤️❤️❤️

Cheers!

story:
The Harbingers 

To whom do the dead belong?

After the loss of both parents, composer Rosśa Crean dissected their grief through creation - and so came "The Harbingers."

Crean (and librettist Kendra Leonard) draws together mythical figures of various cultures to parse the nature of good and evil, their subjectivity in practice, and the gray area where humans reside and death has dominion.

Through this campaign, we hope to fund our basic production needs to bring this new work to life on Halloween night, when the veil is thinnest, in the heart of Rosehill Cemetery.

Follow the lights...

Our Goal and Your Perks

  • Our goal is to raise $2,100.00 total.  This will cover our venue(s), props, set pieces, and costuming.

 

Perks! Our Donor Rewards System: 

​**These are stacked rewards - Each tier above $10 includes the perks of the previous tiers.**

  • ​Donate $10 - Personalized "thank you" in our program;
  • Donate $25 - One ticket and a personalized "thank you" in our program;
  • Donate $50 - A program or poster signed by the entire cast.
  • Donate $100 - Personalized thank-you video from the cast or receive personalized "Sale of Soul" contract, personalized by the Harbinger to whom you are now bound!
  • Donate $200 - VIP immersive seating during the show (20 total);
  • Donate $400 - Your name added to the official libretto, and VIP invite to behind-the-scenes rehearsal;
  • Donate $500 - Thank-you party with the cast!
  • Donate $1,000 - Receive a copy of the live recording of the show (4 total);
  • Donate $2,000 - Private concert by the cast (2 total)!

Any amount will make an enormous impact; if our total goal is not met, whatever amount we receive will be used to mitigate our basic production costs in bringing this work to Chicago audiences.

Broader Impact

We hope to spur public support for new composition and found-space opera in Chicago.  New movements in the arts need community support to gain a foothold and flourish, and Chicago is ripe with opportunity for small, novel productions to take root in the cracks between larger opera houses.

Why We Need Your Help

Small-scale, independently produced operas are a challenge.  Absent large-house funding and attention, costs are often covered by the cast and crew as a labor of love.   Your help will directly alleviate our financial burden and allow us to focus solely on our craftsmanship.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate but still want to help, you're welcome to share this campaign with your friends!

Come see us on Halloween Night!

story:
In un periodo storico in cui il tema dell’immigrazione riecheggia un po’ ovunque, “Ceneri” vorrebbe rappresentare il racconto della vita di una persona che si allontana dalla sua terra di origine in cerca di una vita migliore, ma che si ritrova invece vittima di una società che al posto di integrarlo lo esclude e lo costringe ad una vita criminale. 

Dieci brani che raccontano i giochi d'infanzia e i viaggi di un adolescente, l'amore, i progetti, i momenti di smarrimento ed infine il giudizio finale. 

Una vita maledetta da emozioni e dolori ed un prezioso lascito...

 

Il trio musicale accompagnato da ballerine e attori  :

 

-Gianluca Vergalito: Chitarra acustica, elettrica e Sitar

-Antonio Armanetti: Percussioni e Batteria

-Mattia Strazzullo: Tastiere

-Laura Esposito: Danza

-Sara Ferrigno: Danza

-Giuseppe Bianchi: Attore

story:
Metamorphosis 

A Celebration of  Humanity

This event is an opportunity for people to gather from across the Middle East, North Africa (MENA) and around the globe in celebration of humanity through music, dance and art. This international festival will be held in the magnificent Wadi Rum desert of Jordan. Metamorphosis is the manifestation of a dream to gather international and local communities together to celebrate music, dance and art as universal languages of our shared humanity.

We will celebrate the portals of music, dance and art for two nights and three days with various workshops offered during the day. The first night will offer a lineup of electronic music. Electronic music uses modern technology to take people into trance through rhythm. The daytime will consist of workshops; think yoga, chanting, whirling, spoken word, and intentional movement. The second night will be more relaxed with the ambiance set with traditional, regional music. 

Food is an essential part of connection and so food will be sold from the lodge as well as from vendors on site at designated times to encourage attendants to break bread together. 

This is not a for-profit endeavor. Metamorphosis is an opportunity to gather community. Participation will not be dependent on the ability to purchase a ticket. Tickets will be distributed in 4 ways: for sale, donation-based, free to those who send in a 3 minute video about how they can contribute before, during or after the event and spots reserved for partners. 

This ticket distribution plan is designed to curate an audience that is invested in participating, not only financially but consciously. Metamorphosis will require each attendee to bring their best and have their best fed by the rest of the gathering. Together we can build something better than the sum of its parts. 

This event is called Metamorphosis based on the concept that we are the imagining cells of the great butterfly, and those of us that can see the future can lead the way into it. 

Creativity + Community  = Collective Coexistence

The surrender of dance can be medicine for the heart and mind. A way to connect to other, outside of speech and language. A culture’s dance and music hold a lot of that culture’s identity and through these portals we can understand each other from the inside out. When we dance to the same music we synchronize heartbeats and when our hearts beat to the same rhythm we can find unity. The continual and repetitive beat of a drum has been used across time and region to gather people into unified trance. It has historically been used as a way to gather people into a shared experience.   

Metamorphosis is the outcome of deep inspiration that landed as I traveled through Jordan in 2017 and 2018. The heart of the idea is to gather regional and international communities to come together inside the universal languages of music, dance and art transcending division into evolutionary transition. 

During the two and a half years that the idea has been in development I have been in conversation with as many people as I can about how to create a relevant event that supports new paradigm consciousness in the region. I have spoken to people from Jordan, Palestine, Israel, Saudi Arabia, Iran, Syria, Turkey, Tunisia, Egypt, and Kuwait about this and have found great enthusiasm for it among various groups of people. In fact, I have been told that this is something that is missing and that a place to express and explore new ideas freely is needed and would be welcomed. The trend towards music festivals in MENA is growing rapidly. 

Partners and Participants

The Metamorphosis team is collaborating with individuals and communities across the region and the world. Metamorphosis will feature DJs from throughout MENA, Europe, the US and Canada. The intention is to bring various populations together to trance into a unified space as well as musicians sharing identity through music. As the saying goes, you can understand someone better if you walk in their shoes. What would happen if we danced to each other’s music? 

The origin of the artists, musicians and other creative contributors will not be advertised. Metamorphosis is a platform where nationality is not emphasized as to not exaggerate differences but celebrate shared humanity. English will be the connective language. 

The majority of participants will be regional as the goal of this event is to bring people of the region together in celebration. Although, international partners are encouraged to advertise in their communities and bring their fan bases. 

Wadi Rum, Jordan

This will be a private event at Beit Ali, a beautiful, humbly luxurious contemporary, Bedouin camp. The arena on premises can easily hold 1,500 people and the camp can accommodate 2,000 total. The walled-off encampment can accommodate 300 people sleeping on site. The rest of the guests will need to stay in other camps around Wadi Rum (a UNESCO World Heritage Site) or neighboring communities or Aqaba (a large city on the Red Sea about 50 minutes away via a three lane highway.) 

Jordan is an amazingly beautiful and an easy place to travel due to the many historical and geographic sites. Jordanians are welcoming, friendly and hospitable, the country is politically stable, clean and equipped with modern infrastructure. The Hashemite Kingdom is respected and appreciated by the Jordanian people and is considered legitimate and competent by regional and international leaders. The festival will be developed in a way that adapts to the cultural norms of the region.

Bio

This project is a result of my ongoing work on various humanitarian initiatives in the Middle East since 2001. My undergraduate degree is in Journalism and Ethnic Studies and my graduate work investigates Cross Cultural Communication and Human Rights in MENA. 

I have danced throughout my life and around the world. And have learned most from those who have shared their cultures and traditions with me through the sounds of their music and the steps they use to synchronize heartbeats. I recognize the power that sound has to trance audiences into a collective of unified heartbeats. 

As a participant in the inaugural Nablus Arts and Culture Festival in 2016, I recognized the ingenuity of abandoning politics and replacing it with art, music and dance as a mechanisms to bridge cultural divides. 

Throughout my travels and inside of festival culture, I have been inspired by the power and potency of internationals coming together from around the globe to play in environments that celebrate diversity through creative collaboration. 

 

Spring 2021

If you are called here you are WELCOME! Come join us as we dance ourselves awake with the evocative soundscapes of local and global musicians in the majestic landscape of Wadi Rum. Together we will gather from the deserts and valleys of the region and from the four corners of the globe to play in the sand, the sun and vibrancy of each other. Let us sink into unity through music, dance, art, workshops, food, being and togetherness.

 

Be a part of Metamorphosis

With your help we can build this vision into creation!

Together we can create a space for shared humanity.

story:
Josh Lane & the Heartfelt

My name is Joshua Lane and I have been writing songs since I was a kid. I wrote my fist song when I was 10 years old and it is probably the cheesiest piece of music that you will never hear. It's one of my moms favorites! I recorded my first solo Ep in 2012 and it was entitled Beautiful Beginnings. The title was important to me because it signified a "beautiful beginning" to a career in music. A year later I met the band while attending William Jessup University for a degree in Music. Writing music alone is a great experience, but writing music with some of your best friends is priceless! I came up with the band name recently and feel that it accurately describes what we are trying to do here. We are writing Heartfelt music folks! and we hope these songs become the soundtrack to new found love and life.

 

What We Need 

  • We need 7500 to make this record happen!
  • 3500 of our goal will cover the cost of booking the studio and the engineer for six days of recording.
  • the rest of the budget will cover the cost of mastering, distribution, securing merchandise, traveling cost, photography and video.
  • We set this campaign up in such a way that you can help whether you are a college student or a business owner! EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS!

 

 

Don't have a lot o money? neither do we! YOU CAN STILL HELP!

Money is not the only valid source of help in this campaign! Your voice and your social presence are very useful! We understand that some of you may not be able to give in the capacity that you really would like and we want you to know that that's OK! SHARE SHARE SHARE! Share with your friends and family or anyone you believe would enjoy our music. Become our ground team and help get the word out about us and our music! we appreciate so much any support we receive. The more buzz we create the easier it will be to rise above all of the noise and advertisements on the Web.

My name is Joshua Lane and I have been writing songs since I was a kid. I wrote my fist song when I was 10 years old and it is probably the cheesiest piece of music that you will never hear. It's one of my moms favorites! I recorded my first solo Ep in 2012 and it was entitled Beautiful Beginnings. The title was important to me because it signified a "beautiful beginning" to a career in music. A year later I met the band while attending William Jessup University for a degree in Music. Writing music alone is a great experience, but writing music with some of your best friends is priceless! I came up with the band name recently and feel that it accurately describes what we are trying to do here. We are writing Heartfelt music folks! and we hope these songs become the soundtrack to new found love and life.
 

What We Need 

We need 7500 to make this record happen!
3500 of our goal will cover the cost of booking the studio and the engineer for six days of recording.
the rest of the budget will cover the cost of mastering, distribution, securing merchandise, traveling cost, photography and video.
We set this campaign up in such a way that you can help whether you are a college student or a business owner! EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS!

 
 
Don't have a lot o money? neither do we! YOU CAN STILL HELP!
Money is not the only valid source of help in this campaign! Your voice and your social presence are very useful! We understand that some of you may not be able to give in the capacity that you really would like and we want you to know that that's OK! SHARE SHARE SHARE! Share with your friends and family or anyone you believe would enjoy our music. Become our ground team and help get the word out about us and our music! we appreciate so much any support we receive. The more buzz we create the easier it will be to rise above all of the noise and advertisements on the Web.

story:
Why vinyl?

Besides how amazing it would be to have our own music on vinyl, this album was written with the vinyl format in mind: it has been composed and arranged with the physical constraints of the medium in mind. To come all this way and not press it would be doing it halfway.

The Cost of Pressing

Recording and pressing an album is not an inexpensive undertaking. The costs add up. Here's what we'll need to make this happen.

  • $450 for a specialized vinyl master of the record.
  • $1,700 to print 100 black and white marbled records with full color jackets.
  • $300 to print lyric sheets, studio booklets, stickers, etc.
  • After the pressing amount is raise, we want to give some money back to the engineers and artists who gave generously of their time because they believed in the project. After all that, we'll pay ourselves.

What if I don't have a record player?

Vinyl has made a huge comeback, but we know not everyone is on the train. There will be digital options too, and even a few non-music perks priced real low so you can still help out even if your pocketbook could use a few pounds.

story:
SKRAECKOEDLAN NEEDS YOU.

While being on tour september 2016 someone smashed the window of our rental van and stole alot of gear from us. 

Now we are reaching out for some help to be able to rebuild our sound as soon as possible. All of the donations will go towards:

  • Our gear is really important for our sound, so we want to rebuild what was stolen from us.
  • Cover the costs for the broken tour van.

Please help out!

What You Get

  • Signed poster: A poster with artwork from our album "Sagor" signed by all members in the band. Really high quality poster.
  • Exclusive photo: A real collectable photo (all of wich is original) of someone in the band, doing something awsome, signed by all band members,
  • Exclusive drawing: You get a coloured drawing from the members in the band. Designs might vary batween their favorite animal/animals, monsters or something strange. 
  • Exclusive rifftone: A rifftone (ringtone) composed just for you. You will recieve it as a 15 second mp3 file.

story:
Smooth Stones

Earlier this year, someone spoke to us about five smooth stones. In the Bible, David used simple stones and his sling to defeat a great enemy and bring about the deliverance of a nation. For us, our stones are songs, and to think that God might want to use them to bring freedom to people amazes us continually.

So, for the first time ever, we are recording an EP...

We are currently in the process of recording around 7 songs, and will choose 5 to be on this EP!

 

What We Need & What You Get

AMAZING news is that we already have a portion of the finances we need to get this off the ground - praise God! 

However, we still need some help to see it completed.

We hope to raise £3000 to help cover the costs of recording, mixing, mastering, manufacturing and all the other extras that projects like this need. Feel free to contact us if you'd like to see an exact breakdown of these costs.

A FEW THANK-YOUS IF YOU DONATE:

  • Pledge £10 - Exclusive Digital Pre-Release of the EP
  • Pledge £15 - Physical Copy of the EP + Exclusive Digital Pre-Release
  • Pledge £40 - 'Freedom' Tote Bag + EP
  • Pledge £60 - Set of 5 original postcards + EP
  • Pledge £100 - Stories behind the Songs
  • Pledge £200 - 'Freedom' Package
  • Pledge £300 - LIVE Worship Night!
  • Pledge £600 or more - Original artwork by Paul (www.paulverheul.com - details to be discussed with Paul)

Find more details on the right ------->

*We can travel to most places in England, but contact us because we'd love to see what we can make happen together! We will cover our own travel expenses for anything close to the Sussex area.

 

The Impact

Our heart's desire is to take songs which have been written by us and see them released into the nations. We love to see God move as His children worship Him - to see Jesus liberate people and set captives free. God is so worthy of our worship, and it our joy to give our lives for the glory of His name.

Compelled by a desire to see a wave of freedom sweep across the earth, we will also be donating 10% of all CD sales to help charities who are fighting to end human trafficking, forced prostitution and injustice. Such charities will include:

  • International Justice Mission (IJM)
  • The A21 Campaign
  • Exodus Cry
  • Wellspring Association (Cyprus)

 

Prayer Points
 

  • Recording is a completely new thing for us. Taking a fairly organic song that spontaneously happens in a prayer room and crafting it into great music is not a simple task! But we are already learning so much on this journey and revel in the new challenges that come up as we learn more every day about arrangements, microphones and metronomes. Thank you for praying for us - we need encouragement :)

 

  • We are blessed to have a number of friends across the globe who are giving priceless input into this process, including drummer Martin Neil, who is working closely with us as we get to grips with a whole new world of recording! Please pray that connections are made with the right musicians to also join us on the EP - there are still pieces that need to fall into place.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to give financially, but it doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Share this campaign with friends or contacts you think might be interested in journeying with us! The more the merrier.
  • Follow us on Facebook - 'PAUL AND RACHEL VERHEUL' - we'll be posting updates about the journey so share share share !
  • If you are interested to follow what we get up to 'normally,' feel free to subscribe to our regular newsletter here: http://eepurl.com/4msAv
  • Please pray for us!

Having physical recordings of our songs is an amazing opportunity for us, and we believe there is much more to come! This is a first step. Thank you!

story:
Crowdfunding leicht gemacht  ...das Abenteuer beginnt:

(viele Hände -schnelles Ende ;-)

Hallo, 

ich bin Edgar Wiefel, 47 Jahre, verheiratet und habe eine 5 jährige Tochter. Vor ca. einem Jahr hatte ich die Kernidee zu "Rebirth ...der Tod ist erst der Anfang!", meinem Kriminalroman aus einer völlig neuen Perspektive -schließlich kommt es ziemlich selten vor, dass das Mordopfer selber seinen Mörder ermittelt.

Um diese Kernidee zu schützen, hab ich dann daraus eine Kurzgeschichte veröffentlicht,  Im Laufe des letzten Jahres habe ich dazu so viel positives Feedback bekommen, das ich Lust verspürt habe ein ganzes Buch daraus zu machen. Dies ist mir mit Hilfe von Mark Gosdek, einem erfahrenem Co-Autor im März dieses Jahres (sehr gut) gelungen, wenn man den vielen  5-Sterne Bewertungen bei Amazon glauben schenken kann :-) ( Stand 20. Oktober 2016)

Da ich Schritt für Schritt vom Skript bis zur E-Book und Taschenbuch Veröffentlichung auf Amazon.de alles selbstgemacht habe, hatte ich nie den Drang verspürt bei einem Verlag unterzukommen. Jetzt merke ich, dass mir und dem Projekt diese Verlags-FREIHEIT sehr gut getan hat, So konnte ich das Buch ganz nach meinen Vorstellungen zum ersten  MULTI-(SOCIAL)-MEDIA BUCH weiterentwickeln, mit:

* Soundtrack zur Story  (Rock der 80er, 90er und 00er)

* Bildern der Schauplätze in New York  (siehe auch 50 SekundenTrailer)

* Kontakt zu einem Charakter aus dem Buch

* und vieles mehr...  auf www.fb.com/rebirth.buch

 

Das alles ist bereits geschehen, JETZT möchte ich noch MEHR Personen die Möglichkeit geben die packende Geschichte von Rebirth zu lesen oder besser gesagt zu HÖREN.

Bitte schaut euch auf Amazon und Facebook diese außergewöhnliche Geschichte an, ihr werdet von der Leseprobe und den Features begeistert sein, und sie SCHREIT nach der Vertonung, so das man mit "Rebirth ...der Tod ist erst der Anfang!" auch eine langweilige Auto, Bahn, Bus -Fahrt... (mit  Kopfhörer) zum  Erlebnis machen kann. 

DAS IST HOLLYWOOD-KINO IM KOPF !!!

Die spannende 5 Minuten HÖRPROBE solltest du dir unbedingt gleich mal anhören. Du findest sie im vierten kleinen Foto oben.

Eine professionelle, stimmige Hörbuch Produktion mit 6 CDs (ca. 6 Stunden Spannung)  kostet ca. € 2900.-    Um das zu realisieren benötige ich viiiele kleine Unterstützungsbeträge,   wie z.B. € 10,- für die Vorbestellung des fertigen fantastischen Hörbuchs.  Darum würde es mich sehr freuen, wenn gerade DU einer der Ersten bist, die mich bei meinem größten Abenteuer "Crowdfunding" begleiten.

Was du davon hast, wenn du mein Projekt unterstützt, siehst du auf der rechten Seite, wie du mein Projekt unterstützen kannst siehst du hier unten:

Natürlich ist auch jedes Like und Teilen auf der 

Facebookseite von Rebirth  www.fb.com/rebirth.buch 

und jeder Kauf des E-Book auf Amazon 

http://www.amazon.de/dp/B01CCRU69S

eine Unterstützung, die in die Hörbuchproduktion einfließt.

Für finanzielle Unterstützer meines Projekts gibt es tolle persönliche Goddies/Perks, schau gleich mal rein. (hier gleich auf der rechten Seite)

************** !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!************

Wem die Indiegogo Anmeldung zum Bezahlen zu Umständlich ist, 

kann das Hörbuch auch per Überweisung an mich unterstützen:

Edgar Wiefel

 Iban: AT68 2032 0321 0264 9676

Verwendundszweck:    Perk 1 / 2 / 3 oder 4

Oder auch per Paypal:  www.paypal.Me/wunschbox

Diese Beträge werden dann vor Beendigung dieser Kampage zugeführt.

******************************************

Danke für deine Begleitung bei meinem größten Abenteuer "Crowdfunding"

...sei ein Crowdfunder!

Beste Wünsche und spannendes Hören wünscht Edgar Wiefel -Danke

story:
Opie Hendrix: New Album 2017!!!!

 

Hey there! Opie Hendrix here reaching out to fans, new fans, and comrades to help be a part of an exciting, stupid fresh new album. I have been building on inspirations and new material. The time has come to produce my 5th studio album. And what's more exciting, prolific producer/artist John Evans will be in the chair on this endeavor!!!!

The goal is to reach $2500 in 30 days. I would like to invite you to be a part of this project to get it completed as soon as possible.  But wait-you get sweet OFH GEAR for certain donations!!!! You can donate any amount you feel in your heart and pocket to give. And if you can't donate, please share our campaign on the Facebook, Twitter, and/or by any means necessary. Thank you for your consideration.

Love, 

Opie F. Hendrix

http://www.opiehendrixmusic.com

http://www.reverbnation.com/opiehendrix

http://www.facebook.com/opiehendrixworldwide

story:
Social Justice Disco by Phat Man Dee and Liz Berlin!

WHAT’S GOING ON?

Liz Berlin (of Rusted Root) and Phat Man Dee (voted Best Jazz/ Blues Performer in Pittsburgh City paper 2016 Readers’ Poll) are thrilled to announce their first collaborative recording project, “Social Justice Disco: Songs to Fight Fascists By”. Though this new album may have begun as an April Fools joke, “Social Justice Disco: Songs to Fight Fascists By” is fast becoming a reality with recording already underway at Mr Smalls Recording and Mastering Studio. Members of the band currently include, Mark F. Strickland (guitar), Carlos Peña (guitar), Mike Speranzo (bass), Miguel Sague III (congas / güiro / back up vox), Megan Williams (violin), and Jeremy Papay (drums).  Other musicians we will be working with include Howard Alexander (piano), Pastor Deryck Tines (choral director and vocalist) and a horn section.

Phat Man Dee has self produced 5 recording projects, toured internationally throughout Europe creating a music video series entitled "Take it to the Bridge with Phat Man Dee" and teaches music to youth at both the Afro-American Music Institute and the Creative.Life.Support We Rock Workshop. She sings both with her jazz band "The Cultural District" and "The Lemington Gospel Chorale" led by Pastor Deryck Tines.

Liz Berlin is a founding and current member of Pittsburgh's multi-platinum band Rusted Root, and performs as a solo artist and with her other band Drowning Clowns. She and her husband Mike Speranzo own and operate Mr Smalls Theatre in Millville, PA. She is the creative director of Creative.Life.Support, the non profit educational arm of Mr Small's Funhouse. Their mission is to provide positive recreational activities & opportunities in media arts for the youth culture of the Pittsburgh. She is a much loved musician and vocalist.

The Social Justice Disco album is currently in production at Mr. Smalls Recording and Mastering Studio and the songs featured are both originals and reimagined classics. New compositions included are "Fourth Reich Arising",  "Jim Crow is Alive and Well", "I Dream of Robots Dreaming", "#BigBrotherIsTrending" and "Black Lives Matter (sung to the tune of "Staying  Alive"). Covers include "For What it's Worth" (Buffalo Springfield), "Your Racist Friend" (They Might Be Giants), "All You Fascists" (Woody Guthrie/ Billy Bragg), "Have You Been to Jail for Justice" (Anne Feeney), “I Will Survive”,  and "Ball of Confusion" (The Temptations).

PERSONAL NOTES FROM THE ARTISTS

FROM PHAT MAN DEE:

Hello friends!!! Thank for reading this far about our project!!! I just want to give you a little background about how this even came to be…. Liz and I have been friends for over 20 years. 

I recorded my very first first cd "Life Just Goes On" in 2001 at Mr. Smalls Recording Studio’s first location in Millvale, before Liz and her husband Mike bought the church and turned it into Mr. Smalls Theatre, a state of the art venue that is a destination for many top tier touring musicians. I have also recorded my most recent full length CD and part of my EP at the new Mr. Smalls Recording and Mastering Studio, located in the Northside. I completed my video internship with Creative.Life.Support at Mr Smalls Theater in 2014. Since then I have worked with Liz at "We Rock Workshop", a program she designed with Allegheny County Department of Human Services, to help young aspiring artists in foster care compose their own songs, record a cd and perform them live in front of an audience, both at Mr. Smalls Theater and at some conferences around the state.

The first time I ever heard "protest music" live and in person, was when local peace activist Vincent Eirene was protesting the development of "autonomous flying vehicles" outside of Wean Hall at Carnegie Mellon university. We know these devices today as drones, and they do, as he feared, drop bombs on people. The protest music was provided by Liz Berlin and her band Rusted Root. Their message of love, peace and tolerance was one which really struck home for me. It was amazing to me that you could sing out against the war, against intolerance, against destruction of the environment. That you could actually sing for peace, understanding and have a deeper message was just so inspiring for me.

I feel like both of us are extremely committed to justice work through art and activism. Liz’s work with youth through the We Rock Workshop and the Real Life Music Camp has given me the confidence and empowerment to reach out to and share my knowledge with the next generation. This album is a culmination of 25 years of friendship, professional collaboration, mentorship and shared belief in a world where we can fight for justice, promote love and peace, and help defeat fascism through dance tunes.

One love, for we are one people, Phat Man Dee

FROM LIZ BERLIN:

My first memory of Phat Man Dee was wayyyy back in the early days when Rusted Root used to rent out warehouses and throw renegade concert pot-lucks that generated an under the radar cult following. When the frenzy of the night was over, when most people had left and we were cleaning up the space and tearing down equipment I heard a deep and compelling voice bust out an a cappella rendition of "Wade In The Water". This little girl had a voice that was grounded in the earth and the soul pouring out of her mouth just filled the room. Since then I have witnessed her become the powerhouse musician I knew she was destined to be, having made a name and quite a reputation for herself not just in Pittsburgh but internationally as a circus jazz chanteuse on a mission. I am extremely honored to be working with Phat Man Dee on this project.  I have greatly admired her passion, caring, and humanity in speaking up for and taking action for causes that resonate deeply with me, and I feel there is no better partner for me in this endeavor.

Taking a stand on these issues is not always easy, there are a multitude of perspectives and details surrounding every issue, and it is impossible to address every aspect of every situation. But we each have to look into ourselves and address inherent biases and whatever privileges we enjoy as Americans in whatever life situations we are blessed with. There are certain things that we know are just wrong, that cross lines humanity should never cross. We know there will be lovers, haters, devils-advocates and mountain-top-shouters. Our biggest hope is that our music will lead everyone to look deeply into their hearts to be the best person they can be, and treat others, regardless of personal, racial, gender, religious, sexual or political differences, with all of the respect each human on the planet deserves. Grounded in this intent, we dedicate our art to the betterment of society and the raising of the consciousness of humanity into the beautiful, happy, healthy beings we are meant to be. 

In service, Liz Berlin

What We Need

It would be wonderful to include you as a partner in our creative process. And when you do become involved in this project with us, we can’t wait to fulfill the special perks that we've lined up for our supporters to get in return for joining us in this endeavor.  

Here is a break down of the reality of recording a studio album:

Studio time (even when you own the studio) costs money, like $60 an hour.... someone has to keep the heat on and the pay the water bill and engineers have kids and stuff.....We also want to pay the band... Musicians like to pay bills too, they like to eat and so do their children..... we are trying to compensate everyone fairly.

  • Musicians pay - 14 musicians for an estimated total of 280 hours (approximately 20 hours per musician, actual times may vary, for example the guitars, bass, drums, piano will spend more time in the studio than say the horns or violin) at $15 an hour - $4200
  • Donation to Pastor Deryck Tines and Lemington Gospel Chorale - $250
  • Studio time - recording, mixing, mastering - 70 hours at $60 an hour (includes studio and engineer) - $4200
  • Feeding musicians during recording sessions - $500
  • CD Artwork by Danielle Robinson- $250
  • Band Photoshoot by Erica Dilcer- $250
  • CD Duplication by Discmakers -  $1500
  • Royalties for licensing cover songs - $800
  • Fractured Atlas and Indiegogo Fees - $1635
  • Perk fulfillment costs (shipping) - $500
  • Marketing the finished work so it gains a larger audience - $2000
  • Advertising posters and flyers - $400
  • Total budget requested - $16485

Wonderful perks!

We have some awesome thank you perks that include include VIP invitations to the cd release party to be held at the Funhouse at Mr Smalls, digital downloads, signed copies of the disc, online video chats with the Liz, Mandee and members of the band and private live streaming video from recording sessions, and if you want us badly enough, we will come perform the set of music at a private event of your choosing!

All donations above the fair market value of any perks received are TAX DEDUCTIBLE, due to the fiscally sponsored non-profit partnership of Phat Man Dee Productions, Fractured Atlas and Indiegogo! So anything above the value of gifts received that you contribute to this cause (the normal cost of buying a cd, or tickets to the cd release party) will absolutely be something you can claim on your taxes!

The Impact

We as musical artists, are making the statement that it's not ok to hate, that systemic and institutionalized racism is not ok, misogyny and homophobia is not ok, religious intolerance and open hatred of Muslims or Jews or Indigenous people or ANYONE’s RELIGION (or lack thereof) is not ok, war for profits is not ok, destroying the environment because of our fossil fuel addiction is not ok, making flying robots that kill people is also not ok!!! We are promoting a message of love, tolerance, and we are not going to be silent on matters of importance any more. Well, we have not ever really ever been silent, but we are REALLY not silent if we make a CD you can dance to!!!

This is a CD that not only showcases the talents of the musicians involved, but also has a message. Our message is that we are NOT OK with the way things have been,  and we are not afraid to say so. We are capable people who can make the world a better place while we are here on earth. Our songs will be heard first by you, our friends, family and fans, and then they will spread, and the sonic vibrations of change will act on the world. We are not the only ones adding to the global choir of change, but we want our part to be heard and for others to know who we are and what we stand for. Disco dancing to songs which DEMAND justice, we will get bodies moving and encourage other voices singing along,  like prayer. We are singing and chanting for change. Please sing and dance with us! There are a lot of people in the world who need to know that we don't like the way things are being done and your support will show that you care to also make a stand.

Risks & Challenges

If we don't make the money we are hoping for..... we will produce this work anyways. Everyone involved wants it to happen and is passionate about bringing this album to life. We are committed to this project for what the message and music means. We are not asking for anything exorbitant, studio musicians typically get $40 - $60 an hour.  We can’t do much about reducing the cost of studio time or cd duplication, we can pay the studio off over time, a nice perk when one of the collaborators is an owner of the recording studio (but we still got to pay for it though....) Also, it is possible to reduce the cost of cd duplication by doing short run orders, but the quality of the final product is higher if we bulk order the cds from Discmakers. We would love to actually release vinyl, but that would only happen if the fundraiser did EXTREMELY well. So, while we do have ways to reduce cost, the biggest way is by just not paying any of the musicians in nothing more than love and pizza, and not to disparage love and pizza, both are sacred things, but really, who wants to work for free?!?? We've all spent decades learning how to do what we do, and we're good at it. It's ok for us to want to consider that musicians deserve compensation. 

Every single contribution is so important. Whether you can only give $5, or if you can give $5000, the coming together of so many beautiful people to help us create a body of musical work means so much!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!!

  • Share this project! By tweeting! Use hashtags #SocialJusticeDisco and tag @LizBerlin, @PhatManDee or @CreativeLifeSup for retweets and follow backs!
  • Share it on Facebook! Tag us so we can "like" it!  
  • Call a friend and tell them about it!
  • Check out the early release single "Fourth Reich Arising" on youtube and CD Baby, buy it, share it, make it go viral before the election! As of this posting you've got a week!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Check back, we may add perks along the way to encourage donations!

If you have read this far.....THANK YOU! Thank you for caring enough to hear what we want to do, and please help us get there. Love and blessings upon you and your family, we are one people, on one earth, and we must learn to get along!

"Social Justice Disco: Songs to Fight Fascists By, by Phat Man Dee and Liz Berlin" is presented by Phat Man Dee Productions a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Phat Man Dee Productions must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.
story_txt:
Social Justice Disco by Phat Man Dee and Liz Berlin!WHAT’S GOING ON?Liz Berlin (of Rusted Root) and Phat Man Dee (voted Best Jazz/ Blues Performer in Pittsburgh City paper 2016 Readers’ Poll) are thrilled to announce their first collaborative recording project, “Social Justice Disco: Songs to Fight Fascists By”. Though this new album may have begun as an April Fools joke, “Social Justice Disco: Songs to Fight Fascists By” is fast becoming a reality with recording already underway at Mr Smalls Recording and Mastering Studio. Members of the band currently include, Mark F. Strickland (guitar), Carlos Peña (guitar), Mike Speranzo (bass), Miguel Sague III (congas / güiro / back up vox), Megan Williams (violin), and Jeremy Papay (drums).  Other musicians we will be working with include Howard Alexander (piano), Pastor Deryck Tines (choral director and vocalist) and a horn section.Phat Man Dee has self produced 5 recording projects, toured internationally throughout Europe creating a music video series entitled "Take it to the Bridge with Phat Man Dee" and teaches music to youth at both the Afro-American Music Institute and the Creative.Life.Support We Rock Workshop. She sings both with her jazz band "The Cultural District" and "The Lemington Gospel Chorale" led by Pastor Deryck Tines.Liz Berlin is a founding and current member of Pittsburgh's multi-platinum band Rusted Root, and performs as a solo artist and with her other band Drowning Clowns. She and her husband Mike Speranzo own and operate Mr Smalls Theatre in Millville, PA. She is the creative director of Creative.Life.Support, the non profit educational arm of Mr Small's Funhouse. Their mission is to provide positive recreational activities & opportunities in media arts for the youth culture of the Pittsburgh. She is a much loved musician and vocalist.The Social Justice Disco album is currently in production at Mr. Smalls Recording and Mastering Studio and the songs featured are both originals and reimagined classics. New compositions included are "Fourth Reich Arising",  "Jim Crow is Alive and Well", "I Dream of Robots Dreaming", "#BigBrotherIsTrending" and "Black Lives Matter (sung to the tune of "Staying  Alive"). Covers include "For What it's Worth" (Buffalo Springfield), "Your Racist Friend" (They Might Be Giants), "All You Fascists" (Woody Guthrie/ Billy Bragg), "Have You Been to Jail for Justice" (Anne Feeney), “I Will Survive”,  and "Ball of Confusion" (The Temptations).PERSONAL NOTES FROM THE ARTISTSFROM PHAT MAN DEE:Hello friends!!! Thank for reading this far about our project!!! I just want to give you a little background about how this even came to be…. Liz and I have been friends for over 20 years. I recorded my very first first cd "Life Just Goes On" in 2001 at Mr. Smalls Recording Studio’s first location in Millvale, before Liz and her husband Mike bought the church and turned it into Mr. Smalls Theatre, a state of the art venue that is a destination for many top tier touring musicians. I have also recorded my most recent full length CD and part of my EP at the new Mr. Smalls Recording and Mastering Studio, located in the Northside. I completed my video internship with Creative.Life.Support at Mr Smalls Theater in 2014. Since then I have worked with Liz at "We Rock Workshop", a program she designed with Allegheny County Department of Human Services, to help young aspiring artists in foster care compose their own songs, record a cd and perform them live in front of an audience, both at Mr. Smalls Theater and at some conferences around the state.The first time I ever heard "protest music" live and in person, was when local peace activist Vincent Eirene was protesting the development of "autonomous flying vehicles" outside of Wean Hall at Carnegie Mellon university. We know these devices today as drones, and they do, as he feared, drop bombs on people. The protest music was provided by Liz Berlin and her band Rusted Root. Their message of love, peace and tolerance was one which really struck home for me. It was amazing to me that you could sing out against the war, against intolerance, against destruction of the environment. That you could actually sing for peace, understanding and have a deeper message was just so inspiring for me.I feel like both of us are extremely committed to justice work through art and activism. Liz’s work with youth through the We Rock Workshop and the Real Life Music Camp has given me the confidence and empowerment to reach out to and share my knowledge with the next generation. This album is a culmination of 25 years of friendship, professional collaboration, mentorship and shared belief in a world where we can fight for justice, promote love and peace, and help defeat fascism through dance tunes.One love, for we are one people, Phat Man DeeFROM LIZ BERLIN:My first memory of Phat Man Dee was wayyyy back in the early days when Rusted Root used to rent out warehouses and throw renegade concert pot-lucks that generated an under the radar cult following. When the frenzy of the night was over, when most people had left and we were cleaning up the space and tearing down equipment I heard a deep and compelling voice bust out an a cappella rendition of "Wade In The Water". This little girl had a voice that was grounded in the earth and the soul pouring out of her mouth just filled the room. Since then I have witnessed her become the powerhouse musician I knew she was destined to be, having made a name and quite a reputation for herself not just in Pittsburgh but internationally as a circus jazz chanteuse on a mission. I am extremely honored to be working with Phat Man Dee on this project.  I have greatly admired her passion, caring, and humanity in speaking up for and taking action for causes that resonate deeply with me, and I feel there is no better partner for me in this endeavor.Taking a stand on these issues is not always easy, there are a multitude of perspectives and details surrounding every issue, and it is impossible to address every aspect of every situation. But we each have to look into ourselves and address inherent biases and whatever privileges we enjoy as Americans in whatever life situations we are blessed with. There are certain things that we know are just wrong, that cross lines humanity should never cross. We know there will be lovers, haters, devils-advocates and mountain-top-shouters. Our biggest hope is that our music will lead everyone to look deeply into their hearts to be the best person they can be, and treat others, regardless of personal, racial, gender, religious, sexual or political differences, with all of the respect each human on the planet deserves. Grounded in this intent, we dedicate our art to the betterment of society and the raising of the consciousness of humanity into the beautiful, happy, healthy beings we are meant to be. In service, Liz BerlinWhat We NeedIt would be wonderful to include you as a partner in our creative process. Musicians like to pay bills too, they like to eat and so do their children..... we are trying to compensate everyone fairly.

Donation to Pastor Deryck Tines and Lemington Gospel Chorale - $250

Feeding musicians during recording sessions - $500

CD Artwork by Danielle Robinson- $250

story:
The Chance of a Lifetime

When I was two years old, my mom and I would visit our next door neighbor and he would offer me a piece of chocolate candy if I would sing "Oklahoma" for him.  I've been singing ever since.  Around the age of 9, I started writing my own songs.  When I started learning guitar at age 11, my songwriting really took off.  It's just a passion inside me that I have to release.  I'm now 15 and it's my dream to be a professional singer/songwriter. Recording an album is the first step in realizing that dream.

Unfortunately, money is my biggest obstacle in achieving my goal.  I have the dream, the talent, and amazing support from my friends and family, but recording an album takes money.  This is where you can help.  I'm trying to raise $8000 to cover the costs of my studio recording sessions, plus CD packaging and merchandise.  I plan on playing more live events to promote my music and my campaign.

You can help by making a donation to my album fundraiser and/or by promoting my fundraiser to your friends and family.  Music is something that can bring people together, and I hope that's what my music does for you.

Thank you.

Caitlyn Grace

story:
A piece of my story...

I'm Aprina Johnson, I grew up beatboxing, and creating new melodies almost every year of my child hood life. Like many, music was an escape for me from my daily frantic and terrifying life. As a teenager I realized how much power music had over me, I began to follow the lyrics in the songs and following the musician’s lifestyles. I ran into great disaster as a result. After a failed suicide attempt I started tapping into my creativity more than ever. I started asking God what was my reason for existing, and he answered. Once my ability to sing began to unfold I knew I had some strange power that was contagious. I started thinking of how I wanted to stand on a stage in front of thousands and sing the song of justice, freedom, and truth. I knew I had to help drag people from the dark pits of their anger, bitterness and doubt, so that's what I set out to do. 

      My campaign is raising money to:

  1. Empower people with music that heals.
  2. Make very high quality recordings with multiple different musicians.
  3. Make a musical compilation ready for radio, TV, performances, and your hands.
  4. Make my dream become a reality :-)

 I realized that I can make good music alone, I've done it for a long time. When I began to partner with people I realized I was missing a huge piece of the sound I was trying to create. A long time and famous guitarist Ric Hordinski, challenged me to do that and here we are today, doing this campaign! When you decide to contribute you will help musician's be paid to do what they love, plus fuel a project that is going to make a radical change to anyone who gets a hold of it!

 

What we need to fly & your piece of the pie!

 

Break down of funds:

Studio time (two weeks of recording) $4000

Musician’s fees: $2000 +

Pre-production/studio: $1500

Mixing: $2500

Miscellaneous expenses (gear, catering, promotion etc.) $1500

TOTAL: $11,500

PERKS: T-shirts, Specialized Art Piece, Recording of project, Studio Visits, Executive Credit, and more!

The Impact

Once you've made your donation think about this. When you hear songs you often feel some strong emotion, and we immediately absorb the message, but what does it provoke you to do? These songs will be campaigns, activating all who hear to participate in the theme or call to action. You will be challenged to take up responsibility over your own life, while using that same power to be involved in your community. The goal is to show others the power that follows when we release our love to the underserved, rebellious, and overlooked. We will tackle injustice head on in our community! Check out a few powerful projects I've initiated or been a part of for an example:

Stop the Violence

http://www.zone15produkkionz.com/

Eternal Love

https://youtu.be/IigP-cq6M5I

FreeHuggin

https://youtu.be/LSwOjsqNViU

Each one of these projects led me to people who wanted the chance to be a loving force in their communities but didn't have the proper opportunity. By the grace of god I was easily able to inspire them to stand and believe. From this activism I have seen businesses produced, healed relationships, friendships, hope and freedom evolve afterward. This is powerful yal...

This is a big risk for me...

 In the past, I've always been able to fund my own projects but this project is my first attempt at doing something really large-scale, from the writing to the recording and onward. I'd really love your support, not just financially, but also in coming to concerts, and especially spreading the word about this recording project and our campaign!

I work with people hoping to help make their dreams come true, hopefully you can help me ;-) This will be a challenge but I'm up for it, so stand with me and let’s make this change TOGETHER!

 

If you are strapped for cash and cannot donate dollars:

  • SHARE this campaign in your emails, and your social media outlets ;-)
  • Message me and see how you can be a part of my upcoming community activism!

And that's all there is to it!

story:
My name is Martin Rowe, and I'm the librettist for And the Hummingbird Says . . . , a five-part song cycle composed by Mihoko Suzuki (whose music you can listen to here). Our inspiration is Wangari Maathai, the late Kenyan environmentalist and Nobel Peace Prize Laureate, who with her organization, the Green Belt Movement, planted millions of trees throughout Kenya and campaigned for democratic space and the public's access to land, and was jailed, beaten, and threatened with death because of her actions. You can hear excerpts from the five songs here.

Our cycle, which was recorded in the Great Hall at Cooper Union on August 9th, uses the five Japanese Buddhist elements (earth, water, fire, wind, and void) to explore Maathai's life as a child of colonialism, a passionate advocate for freedom, an advocate for women's rights, and lover of the Earth. Our title comes from a fable about a hummingbird who attempts to stop a forest fire and is met with derision by the other animals. You can read all about the cycle and learn about the singers at our site at NewMusicUSA.

Finally, Wangari Maathai was passionate about education, instilling values of service and love of the Earth in young people, and in developing Africa's capacity. The Juba Diocesan Model Secondary School is a beacon of hope in South Sudan, and we're using this fundraiser to pay for a student or students to attend it.

And the Hummingbird Says . . . consists of five songs. Here is a synopsis.

1: Earth—Kirinyaga 
Mixing English, Kiswahili (Kenya’s national language), and Kikuyu (Maathai’s native tongue), “Kirinyaga” explores the cultural, spiritual, and social fragmentation that followed when Christianity and colonization’s arrival in British East Africa. Voices plead for rain from Mt. Kenya (known to Kikuyus as “Kirinyaga” or “Place of Brightness”) and from God. A Kiswahili hymn is interwoven with a British propaganda film, Maathai’s own rendition of the hymn, and thoughts on how a people strayed from the earth that gave them life, and the subsequent loss of culture and animals. 

2: Water—A Tree of God 
“A Tree of God” uses two stories from Maathai’s life: how as a child she played in a stream that dried up when a sacred fig tree was cut down; and her sadness at the felling of a 200-year-old sapele in front of her. She recalls the water and growth cycles of the natural world and her own place within the stream of time. 

3: Fire—And the Hummingbird Says
One of Maathai’s favorite stories is of a hummingbird who tries to put out a forest fire using only the water she can carry in her beak, while the larger animals mock her. This song sets Maathai’s retelling of the fable amid voices of opposition, fear, or indifference to climate change. 

4: Wind—Three Sorrows 
“Three Sorrows” focuses on the burdens women carry and their struggles to confront men in power. It draws its inspiration from the sit-ins by mothers of political prisoners in Kenya that Maathai joined, as well as the misogyny she and other women undergo every day. 

5: Void—Dark Matter
Maathai chose to be cremated in a coffin of hyacinth (an invasive species), papyrus, and bamboo (both renewable resources), rather than wood. “Dark Matter” explores the life-giving properties of womb-like soil and the cosmic material that is most of the known universe. Reflecting on how we as individuals, as a species, or conscious life can make a difference, “Dark Matter” rests in the ambiguities of sunyata, or “emptiness”—life from nothingness; nothingness from life.
story_txt: My name is Martin Rowe, and I'm the librettist for And the Hummingbird Says . . . , a five-part song cycle composed by Mihoko Suzuki (whose music you can listen to here). Our inspiration is Wangari Maathai, the late Kenyan environmentalist and Nobel Peace Prize Laureate, who with her organization, the Green Belt Movement, planted millions of trees throughout Kenya and campaigned for democratic space and the public's access to land, and was jailed, beaten, and threatened with death because of her actions. You can hear excerpts from the five songs here.Our cycle, which was recorded in the Great Hall at Cooper Union on August 9th, uses the five Japanese Buddhist elements (earth, water, fire, wind, and void) to explore Maathai's life as a child of colonialism, a passionate advocate for freedom, an advocate for women's rights, and lover of the Earth. Our title comes from a fable about a hummingbird who attempts to stop a forest fire and is met with derision by the other animals. You can read all about the cycle and learn about the singers at our site at NewMusicUSA.Finally, Wangari Maathai was passionate about education, instilling values of service and love of the Earth in young people, and in developing Africa's capacity. The Juba Diocesan Model Secondary School is a beacon of hope in South Sudan, and we're using this fundraiser to pay for a student or students to attend it.And the Hummingbird Says . . . consists of five songs. Reflecting on how we as individuals, as a species, or conscious life can make a difference, “Dark Matter” rests in the ambiguities of sunyata, or “emptiness”—life from nothingness; nothingness from life.

story:
Salt Wizard is an alt-rock/dream pop band out of West Sacramento.  SW formed in 2012, following a fortuitous New Year’s Eve party where pianist Rachel Warren’s lyrical harmonies collided with guitarist Eric Warren’s inventive songwriting.  The band quickly expanded to include eclectic drummer Anthony Ordonez.  Brett Hart upped the band’s rock energy, joining on bass in 2016.    

Salt Wizard is fresh from recording at Riverbank Studio and anticipating the release of our sophomore album “Creature Sounds” in Fall 2017.  Long-time listeners can look forward to a high-energy album that retains the band’s signature melodic beauty and lyrical introspection. 

With your help, we can finish mixing, mastering, and producing our new album!  Music is a passion, and we’ve worked through full time jobs, second jobs, school, pregnancy, and the birth of our biggest fan to bring this passion to life.  Be a part of the process and product!    

 

What We Need & What You Get

Creature Sounds needs $3000 to come to fruition.  While we’ve already recorded most of it, we need to reimburse our engineer for his recording and mixing time, then need to get it mastered and produced, and it’ll be ready for you!  We are budgeting $1500 for our engineer’s studio time and mixing, $650 for mastering, $600 for initial production, and anything past $2750 will go towards filling more pre-orders!      

To help us meet our goal, you can pre-order the new album and get all sorts of Salt Wizard gear!  We have stickers, t-shirts, a limited edition Creature Sounds poster, and our 1st album (if you missed it).  As a special perk, we’ll bring our music live to you!  Four wonderful donors can schedule us to play a private concert at their house, party, or event.    

Salt Wizard’s 1st self-titled album was released in 2014, and named #20 in SubMerge’s Top 30 Albums of 2014.  In 2015, we were awarded a Sammie for Outstanding Folk Rock, and nominated for 2016 Outstanding Folk Rock and 2017 Outstanding Indie.  SW was featured in articles in Sacramento News & Review and Sacramento Magazine.  The band performed on live radio for 90.3 KDVS Davis’ “Live in Studio A” and 90.9 Capitol Public Radio’s “Insight”.  During 2016-17, Salt Wizard played our biggest shows at the opening of The Barn in West Sacramento, Sacramento’s Concert in the Park series, and the R Street Block Party. 

Listeners count on Salt Wizard’s intriguing and catchy harmonies, thought-provoking lyrics, and musical honesty; whether joining local festivals, rocking a house show with sharpie tattoos and wizard trivia, or creating a chill vibe at one of Northern California’s microbreweries.  Whatever the venue, audiences anticipate the band’s self-described sound: magic from the depths of the river. 

You can check out our 1st album at:

www.saltwizardmusic.com

www.saltwizard.bandcamp.com

Spotify & iTunes

 

Help us continue creating the magic!  We love our fans and we love you!

 

(If money isn’t possible, or after you place your order,

please consider sharing our campaign with others

using the social media links on this site.)
