story:
Hi! My name is Lexie Lowell ... 

ever since I was little I have always loved singing in the shower and pretending to be a mermaid. I grew up on Long Island and moved to Los Angeles where I received my degree in Theatre Arts from the University of Southern California. In 2015 I was Greta in the cast of Deaf West Theatre's Revival of Spring Awakening on Broadway in which I played the harp. When the show closed I got busy writing my own songs. I started to notice a theme in my music. I was clearly processing a lot. I decided to let my music show me the way forward. I've written a show that explains my personal struggle with depression and bulimia and how I managed to extricate myself from the binds that were holding me back. I was literally a “Girl, Bound.”

My greatest wish is to reach other girls, young women, men, anyone out there that thinks they are alone in their struggle.

  • Depression affects more than 15 million American adults, or about 6.7 percent of the U.S. population age 18 and older in a given year.
  • 44 percent of American college students report having symptoms of depression.

The good news is that depression is becoming much more a part of society's conversation. However, bulimia? Well, this is still very much a taboo topic. The frustrating irony of this is that bulimia thrives on "shame" and “secrecy.” By not acknowledging how many people actually struggle with it we are perpetuating the condition.

We need to talk about it. 

The Impact

We need to empower each other and young women in particular to reach out when they have this condition. We need to open a dialogue in society to let them know it is safe to do so. 

I can't imagine it is easy to read this.  But many of you know social media is the tobacco of our time.  It’s addictive, and is at the center of what we now face - an epidemic. 

Your contribution to my campaign is bigger than my struggle. It's about saying, you don't have to hide this. We can talk about it and we can make a difference. Change is possible.

What I hope for …

My goal is to raise $10,000 for a workshop, phase one of my three phase plan:

  1. Workshop Girl, Bound. in the 2017 Hollywood Fringe Festival (June 13-17)
  2. Produce the EP and present Girl, Bound. again alongside a showcase of photography by Caitlin Mitchell at an art gallery in Los Angeles.
  3. Take Girl, Bound. to New York City and hopefully beyond.

Phase 1 EP and Workshop ($9,450)

  • $2,950 Hollywood Fringe Festival Production Costs
    • $250 registration
    • $500 venue
    • $200 insurance
    • $1,500 production cost (staffing, props, set, costume)
    • $500 Videographer
  • $2,500 for demo tracks
  • $4,000 for marketing (photo shoot, graphic design, print flyers, ads, impressions, website)
    • $3,000 Photoshoot 
    • $1,000 Graphic Design/Ads/Impressions/Website

Anything raised over $9,450 will go towards Phase 2 (EP Release at performance in Art Gallery featuring Caitlin Mitchell Photography).

Risks & Challenges

This is my first crowdfunding campaign and I fully expect to work harder than I ever have before. I will also come up against many challenges on the road to mounting the workshop.  A huge part of overcoming depression and bulimia for me is in this process - expressing myself and asking for your help. It’s vulnerable and honestly it's scary! But this project has already been the most empowering experience in my life yet. I’m excited for the future of the show and I believe in it and the message and will tell this story no matter what we raise.  So, please, vote with your dollars, and know that every dollar counts. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I am not only accepting financial contributions. If you do not have the means to contribute I totally understand and please do not feel bad for one second, for I too, am a struggling artist! What would mean just as much to me would be a kind note of support and encouragement. Or find me on social media and start a conversation. I’m here. 

Thank you for your time, love and support. Please share this with friends and family who you think would be interested and joining the conversation. 

All of my love and gratitude, Lexie xx.

girlboundshow@gmail.com

ig: @the_lexxfiles

www.facebook.com/lexlowell

story:
ALLOW ME TO INTRODUCE MYSELF...

My name is Susannah Adams.

I am a jazz vocalist and have been working professionally here in Victoria, BC for the past 8 years. Over the course of that time I have collaborated with some of the best jazz musicians in the region. I have explored my own musicality greatly and have worked consistently to develop my true voice.

Jazz is the perfect niche for me.

Each time we gather together to play, the tunes take on their own journey and unfold differently. There is so much room for improvisation! I adore playing around with the melody or rhythm of the song, feeling the flow of inspiration from the musicians I'm playing with, and working off it to create something unique and exciting.

There's a special alchemy that resides in music.

That is exactly what I wish to portray in my album - the magic that lies in the moment.

 

A LITTLE TASTE OF WHAT'S TO COME....

"The Shortest Distance"

 

*BY SUPPORTING THIS PROJECT

YOU CAN HELP TO BRING ON THE MAGIC! *

 

THE LOGISTICS

I shall be heading into the studio this coming March 2018. I shall be hiring 5 world-class players and award winning producer, Joby Baker, to make my debut album.

I have an unbelievably hot line up!

Miles Black (piano), Oliver Gannon (guitar), Miguelito Valdes (trumpet), Joey Smith (double bass) and Kelby MacNayr (drums).

We shall be spending just 3 days recording live off-the-floor to create something beautiful, exciting and vibrant.

I shall then work alongside the producer for the following 7 days to mix and master the tracks.

I wish to bring the indescribable vital energy of live jazz to your listening ears!

 

THE NITTY GRITTY

It's gonna cost a fair bit, though it's going to be worth it!

With producer fees, musician fees and manufacturing costs, I'm looking at....

TOTAL COST: $15,000

 

* THIS IS WHERE I COULD REALLY USE YOUR HELP! *

 

HERE'S THE BREAKDOWN:

 

  • $8,000 Producer fees

(including studio time, hiring gear, mixing and mastering of tracks)

  • $6,000 Musicians fees

(including rehearsals, chart writing, travel costs and accommodation)

  • $1,000 Manufacturing fees

(including the graphic design, print costs and production of physical cds)

 

*TO HAVE YOUR SUPPORT WOULD MEAN THE WORLD TO ME*

 
 

SO, HERE'S HOW YOU CAN HELP....

Consider making a donation to this project.

Find the 'perk' that suits you!

 

  • PRE-ORDER YOUR CDs

Be the first to receive my stunning debut album, posted anywhere in the world!

  • DONATION FOR A DEDICATION

Let me personally thank you in the cd liner notes.

  • LET'S CHAT

How about a 20 minute phonecall? I'd love to share my stories with you.

  • CONCERT TICKETS

Save your seat at the cd release concert. It's going to be an utterly amazing sell-out show!

  • SHARE THE LOVE

Tell your friends, your family and the mailman about my project and make me smile : )

 

BY CONTRIBUTING TO THIS PROJECT

YOU ARE HELPING TO KEEP

THE MAGIC OF MUSIC ALIVE.

"My One And Only Love"

 

* THANK YOU *

X O X

story:
Live from the Crypt:
Songs from The Dead, Sung for the Dead!
Monday June 5, 7:30 pm
Church of the Intercession Crypt, NYC


David Bryan
and
The Terrapin Chamber Ensemble
featuring:
Kenny Brooks on sax
Zach Nugent on acoustic guitar
Waynard Scheller on grand piano
Joe Gallant on upright bass
Noah Lehrman on percussion
Clare Maloney and Bex Odorisio on vocals
The Sugar Mag String Quartet


Performing unique acoustic arrangements
of The Dead in a subterranean Gothic crypt!
http://noahlehrman.com/songs-from-the-dead

Greetings, Heads! My name is David Bryan.

Some of you have heard of me, but most of you probably haven't. In 2014 I performed what was arguably a groundbreaking concert of dead tunes in a highly recognized Romanesque style church on Park Avenue. The evening was magical, the hippies were well behaved, and a great time was had by all.

As a result of this concert, doors have opened up! I recently approached another NYC church in Harlem, that has an active underground vaulted stone Gothic crypt where they host musical events on a regular basis - mostly classical and jazz. I told them about the concert at the Park Avenue church and pitched the idea of doing a similar concert in their space. They agreed!

So, on Monday June 5th we will present: "Live from the Crypt! Songs from the Dead, Sung for the Dead!"

The downside: we have to rent this unique space, which comes at a high cost for the evening. Add to that the cost of the musicians (check out the all-star lineup of classic interpreters of The Dead's Canon) and you can see why this isn't cheap! I'm also planning to have it professionally filmed for free streaming online. Add to this all incidental and unknown expenses and this concert is going to cost over $10K.

Due to fire department regulations, this crypt can hold only 49 bodies at any given time, making this a super exclusive event! I have 8 musicians total, and 4 on my film crew, which leaves a mere 37 tickets. The upshot is that this will be an incredibly intimate, VIP experience for those who are able to get tickets.

The purpose of this fundraiser is to "level the playing field," so that it isn't ONLY people with DEEP pockets who get a chance to be there! Basically, I'm looking to raise enough money in donations that we can charge a reasonable price for tickets.

HOWEVER: keep in mind that your donations are supporting a professional grade quality video/audio recording of the evening which will be posted online for absolutely free. I just want to share the experience with all of my fellow music fans!

MY WISH: I'm fairly certain this has never been done before. My hope is that enough of you will say "Wow, what a cool idea! I can get behind the concept and support that!" At least just enough of you that I don't have to pay out of pocket to put this amazing concert on! I have raised 25% of the total cost, so all we need is $7500 for me to break even. (I'm in this for the music, not the money!) Can 75 people give $100? DONE. 750 give $10? 75,000 give $1? SEE HOW THIS WORKS???

MY DREAMS COME TRUE: It is my dream that a large number of you will contribute a small amount such that we can do more than one performance in the crypt, thus opening the doors for many more of you to come share the experience in person. ANYONE UP FOR A WEEKLY CONCERT SERIES??

More than anything though, I have this one concert to pay for. Please help me to not go in the poor house, and also help those who can't afford a $200+ ticket to have a shot at being there. Maybe you will be that person!!!

If you are considering donating, just know that EVERY DOLLAR RAISED THROUGH THIS CAMPAIGN WILL GO TO SUPPORT THIS GROUP OF MUSICIANS PERFORMING AS MANY TIMES AS THE MONEY WILL ALLOW.

Thanks so much for your time and consideration. You all have been my extended family for 27+ years. (1990 was my first show; I started listening in 1986.) I hope you will give, and give generously.

NOTE: TICKETS ARE NOT ON SALE YET, BUT A LIMITED NUMBER ARE AVAILABLE IN THE "PERKS" SECTION!!

David Bryan

P.S. Even if you can't contribute, if you like the idea, PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN ON SOCIAL MEDIA.

WE ARE EVERYWHERE.

David BryanandThe Terrapin Chamber Ensemblefeaturing:Kenny Brooks on saxZach Nugent on acoustic guitarWaynard Scheller on grand pianoJoe Gallant on upright bassNoah Lehrman on percussionClare Maloney and Bex Odorisio on vocalsThe Sugar Mag String Quartet
Performing unique acoustic arrangementsof The Dead in a subterranean Gothic crypt!http://noahlehrman.com/songs-from-the-dead
Greetings, Heads! My name is David Bryan.Some of you have heard of me, but most of you probably haven't. In 2014 I performed what was arguably a groundbreaking concert of dead tunes in a highly recognized Romanesque style church on Park Avenue. The evening was magical, the hippies were well behaved, and a great time was had by all.As a result of this concert, doors have opened up! I recently approached another NYC church in Harlem, that has an active underground vaulted stone Gothic crypt where they host musical events on a regular basis - mostly classical and jazz. I told them about the concert at the Park Avenue church and pitched the idea of doing a similar concert in their space. They agreed!So, on Monday June 5th we will present: "Live from the Crypt! Songs from the Dead, Sung for the Dead!"The downside: we have to rent this unique space, which comes at a high cost for the evening. Add to that the cost of the musicians (check out the all-star lineup of classic interpreters of The Dead's Canon) and you can see why this isn't cheap! I'm also planning to have it professionally filmed for free streaming online. Add to this all incidental and unknown expenses and this concert is going to cost over $10K.Due to fire department regulations, this crypt can hold only 49 bodies at any given time, making this a super exclusive event! I have 8 musicians total, and 4 on my film crew, which leaves a mere 37 tickets. The upshot is that this will be an incredibly intimate, VIP experience for those who are able to get tickets.The purpose of this fundraiser is to "level the playing field," so that it isn't ONLY people with DEEP pockets who get a chance to be there! Basically, I'm looking to raise enough money in donations that we can charge a reasonable price for tickets.HOWEVER: keep in mind that your donations are supporting a professional grade quality video/audio recording of the evening which will be posted online for absolutely free. I just want to share the experience with all of my fellow music fans!MY WISH: I'm fairly certain this has never been done before. My hope is that enough of you will say "Wow, what a cool idea! I can get behind the concept and support that!" At least just enough of you that I don't have to pay out of pocket to put this amazing concert on! I have raised 25% of the total cost, so all we need is $7500 for me to break even. (I'm in this for the music, not the money!) Can 75 people give $100? DONE. 750 give $10? 75,000 give $1? SEE HOW THIS WORKS???MY DREAMS COME TRUE: It is my dream that a large number of you will contribute a small amount such that we can do more than one performance in the crypt, thus opening the doors for many more of you to come share the experience in person. ANYONE UP FOR A WEEKLY CONCERT SERIES??More than anything though, I have this one concert to pay for. Please help me to not go in the poor house, and also help those who can't afford a $200+ ticket to have a shot at being there. Maybe you will be that person!!!If you are considering donating, just know that EVERY DOLLAR RAISED THROUGH THIS CAMPAIGN WILL GO TO SUPPORT THIS GROUP OF MUSICIANS PERFORMING AS MANY TIMES AS THE MONEY WILL ALLOW.Thanks so much for your time and consideration. You all have been my extended family for 27+ years. (1990 was my first show; I started listening in 1986.) I hope you will give, and give generously.NOTE: TICKETS ARE NOT ON SALE YET, BUT A LIMITED NUMBER ARE AVAILABLE IN THE "PERKS" SECTION!!David BryanP.S. Even if you can't contribute, if you like the idea, PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN ON SOCIAL MEDIA.WE ARE EVERYWHERE.

story: There are enough of us fans to do this!!!
story_txt: There are enough of us fans to do this!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! 

   My name is Drea and I'm a singer/songwriter currently residing in Los Angeles CA from Salinas CA. I started singing at the age 5 and playing guitar at 9 years old. After my uncle taught me "Soak Up The Sun" by Sheryl Crow,  my dad decided to get me into classical guitar lessons to get my mind off of my parent's divorce. I took classical guitar lessons for 7 years and used songwriting as a therapeutic outlet during that time. Throughout those years back home, I don't remember a time I wasn't in a band or where I didn't take music seriously.

Vulnerability is the most important element in being an artist. Though I've done music for so long, I've struggled with the ability to open myself up in the music I write. I've experienced so much as a person and artist the last three years in LA. This time in my life, I've never felt more than ready to share this side of me. 

This Indie Gogo campaign is to help fund my debut EP "Sharp Tongue". I've never had the confidence to release a project that was fully written, recorded and produced myself. As much as I LOVE collaborating with other artists/producers/songwriters, I've always wanted to fully express myself sonically in the songs I write. I've never had the chance to release a record of my own that fully conveys my honesty and what I've experienced. As I've been evolving as an artist and a person in one of the world's biggest music cities, I fight for the person/artist  I want to be. 

Although I'm producing this project on my own, I still need funds to deliver a quality project that includes: mixing, mastering, music visuals and most importantly marketing. Without this fundraiser, I would not be able to share this project with the world! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Producing this to be a quality project/product, I need $8,000 to make it happen! Those who donate a certain amount will receive either a cool dad hat, personal post card, handwritten lyrics, a limited edition physical copy of the EP, a digital download before anyone else hears it or a house show! Travel and lodging not included and would need to be accommodated. 

 

Risks & Challenges

There are many possible risks that can interfere with the production of a record. Fees to fix or redo a song, studio booking delays, musician availabilities, etc. 

I'll keep you updated as much as I can when unforeseen challenges occur!

 Other Ways You Can Help

Please SHARE this campaign with friends, family and people who support independent music! Lets get the word out to as many people as possible!

 

Thank you THANK YOU for your support!!!! <3

 

Facebook: /dreadelacruz

Twitter: @dreadelacruz

Instagram: @dreadelacruz

YouTube / dreadelacruz

Email: family@dreadelacruz.com

story:
Strangers, friends, and family,

A little wiser than I used to be, I've come to understand the nuanced and overt obstacles facing independent artists in the modern age. The hustle, the aesthetic, the networking, the online presence, the shameless self-promotion--all of which took going through years of trials and tribulation and confronting my own ego at every bend in the road. 

Most apparent out of all of this strife and hardship, I've learned that, as much as I'd not like to admit it, I can't do it all by myself. Songwriting for me isn't just a full-time job, it's my craft and passion in this life. It's what gives me energy to face the world and the ability to love it. But as any serious independent musician knows, it takes more than a good song to get what you want in this industry. 

That's why I've turned to crowdfunding. It's a direct engagement between myself and the people I make art for. It offers the potential to create art without compromising with the bureaucracies of "the industry". If my goal is met, I would be able to give you a pure depiction of my artistic vision for this album with unadulterated freedom. Which, for me, is very important and something I hope to maintain throughout my entire career. 

For my goal, I chose a figure both modest (comparatively) and able to cover the cost of creating what will be my best sounding record  to date. The expenses include studio time, engineer cost, mixing cost, mastering cost and distribution costs. The ultimate goal is to be able to create a subjective masterpiece for $8,000. Or at least, the closest I get to that. 

Please take a peep at the video above and a look at the list of perks you will get for your dollar donation. Thank you for taking the time to read and listen and for your donation. There's no greater satisfaction than being able to say, "we did it together". 

A crooked grin,

Tre burt

story:
“Let’s create this album together and let the world know we stand against bullying.” –Mia Rocks

While most artists launch with eyes on making millions, Mia Rocks is looking to spark a movement. Others sing to be heard, while Mia is squarely focused on giving others a voice.

Impossible to peg, Mia is singer, songwriter and soldier, taking a stance against bullying with her lyrics, rhythms and commitment to reaching teens and tweens struggling to find their place in the world.

Mia has launched the movement.

She is reaching tens of thousands a month.

And now she is primed to break out on the biggest of stages.

Mia simply needs a lift from fans like you to bring her music – and more importantly her message – to the masses.

Born and raised in Virginia, Mia is more than a typical teenager. As comfortable writing and performing her music as she is hanging with her friends, her experience in grade school has impacted her view of the world.

Regularly teased and bullied to the point that she begged to skip school, Mia made the conscious decision at a young age to embrace her individuality. With her trademark purple hair (and a closet featuring a wardrobe drenched in purple hues!), she has bravely taken to social media to connect with others facing similar circumstances in life.

Her down-to-earth advice - and message imploring everyone to be comfortable with who they are - has sparked a movement on social media. Her "10 Tips to Deal with Bullies" resource has been downloaded by teens across the country, offering them the motivation to move beyond the bullies and find joy in who they are, what they love and how they live.

Mia performs nearly two dozen dates a year in and around the Washington, D.C. metroplex.

Her music is an eclectic mix of rock soul blues and pop. In addition to playing guitar and singing, Mia is renowned for writing songs that strike a chord with teens and tweens. One thing for sure, her music has a message: Her unique message to the world!

Focused on her own journey of self-discovery, Mia aims to inspire others to embrace individuality and treat others with grace and respect.

After gaining funding from fans like you, Mia’s debut album will include as many of 10 cuts from her catalog of dozens of songs. Among those sure to land on the debut are:

  • Checkmate
  • Break It
  • Parade
  • See The Light
  • Rooftop
  • Unlocked at Stretch Goal of $30,000!
  • Unlocked at Stretch Goal of $35,000!
  • Unlocked at Stretch Goal of $45,000!
  • Unlocked at Stretch Goal of $60,000!
  • Unlocked at Stretch Goal of $75,000!

“You’re stupid.”

“We don’t like you.”

“Get away.”

“Gross.”

“There’s not room at our table.”

“You’re dumb.”

“Ugly.”

“Fat.”

Mia has heard it all before. Instead of retreating and surrendering to the drumbeat of bullying, Mia turned to singing and songwriting. Today she sings so those being bullied can be heard.

She is, in every respect, a socially responsible star-in-the-making.

In recent months, Mia has been active on social media doing all she can to reach those who feel disenfranchised. Her debut album is a logical next step in launching a movement aimed at helping others find their voice. In addition to sending a positive message, a portion of the proceeds will be directed to supporting causes aimed at ending bullying.

100% of what is raised (minus Indiegogo fees and fulfillment expenses) will go towards the production and marketing of Mia's album.  Mia is fully invested in this and wants to create the best album possible to spread her important message.  

Check out the variety of perks that you can receive, from first access to Mia's music to sponsoring a song.  You can receive merchandise or can have a song written for you.  There is a little something for everyone so browse which options are best for you!  Your support is very much appreciated! 

If you are unable to contribute or to pre-order at this time, there any many other ways you can participate:

  • Email friends and family with a personal note about why you are interested in this IndieGoGo campaign. Share the link to the page. Let’s get Mia’s message to spread around the world!
  • Share Mia’s campaign video on your Facebook page or other social media channels. Our hope is that Mia’s message of personal empowerment will go viral … this will help make that happen!
  • Tell your friends or anyone in the music industry you can think of (other singers, producers, bloggers, journalists, etc.) about Mia’s vision. The more that hear about it, the more impact we can have!

We cannot wait to hit our goal and push our message to millions! Thank you in advance for your support … Let’s Rock!

story:
World first and only music art magazine presents: 

Avant-Garde

Heavy Music Artwork launches world’s first and only metal and rock art magazine - Issue 5 pre-sell: Avant-Garde

Featuring: Ulver, Sunn O))), Skinny Puppy, Wolves In The Throne Room, Tombs, Ghost Bath, Candlemass, Pallbearer, Ihsahn, King Dude, John Garcia, Paul Gregory, Mattias Frisk, Simon Fowler, Samantha Muljat, Trine + Kim Design Studio, Dehn Sora, London Desertfest and more to be announced.

All Heavy Music Artwork print editions specifications

  • Printed on high-quality uncoated stock, which gives texture and earthy feel
  • Ethically sourced and FSC approved and using vegetable based inks
  • Limited edition of 666 units hand numbered and stamp embossed
  • Perfect PUR binding on 250gsm (cover) Offset Paper
  • 100 pages
  • 3000 Copies standard edition printed to fulfill distribution commitments
  • 666 Copies for this campaign which include the 666 limited editions

Heavy Music Artwork Portraits Book details and specifications

This year we are celebrating 5 years in operation and we decided to release a book on heavy metal portrait photography. All photos have been taken by our photographers over the last five years. To accompany the book we have also included critiques and insights by The National Portrait Gallery of Canada and The Scottish National Portrait Gallery exclusively to accompany the book. Plus high profile guest photographers.

  • Finished size 260mm deep x 210mm wide portrait
  • Printed on 200 full color and black & white silk pages
  • Beautifully designed and curated
  • Soft velvet feel hard back cover

Some of the artists included in the book are Ghost, Anthrax, Deez Nuts, Opeth, Wardruna, Neurosis, Steel Panther, Devilment (Dani Filth), Belphegor, Possessed, Orange Goblin, Alter Bridge, Napalm Death, Obituary, Carcass, Prong, Lordi, Corrosion of Conformity, Doyle, Epica, Powerwolf, Fleshgod Apocalypse, Insomnium, Kreator, Nashville Pussy, Abbath, Primordial, Soulfly, King Parrot, Behemoth, Abbath, Baroness, Overkill, Butcher Babies, King Diamond, Testament and more. Full list coming soon.

Arte Divina T-Shirt

The Mighty Horns

Ever wandered where metal mighty horns might come from? Ronnie James Dio popularized them profusely but in reality, they are part of Italy's rich folklore traditions. The "Malocchio" or evil eye to ward off bad luck. In high red gloss and about 5cm in length, now thy can be yours.

What We Need

Your contribution will help Heavy Music Artwork launch the 3rd magazine and secure future releases, and is also a way to pre-sell before it hits the stores around the word. As with the first two campaigns, we are looking to raise a base of £5,000. This will get the project off the ground and will give some breathing room to get issue 4 going.

This is an estimate of our costs and where the funds will go towards

  • 30% Production costs
  • 20% Marketing
  • 18% Overheads
  • 25% Printing costs
  • 7% Campaign fees

Our awesome perks

Our perks are simple and include something for everyone, please see side panel. Perks images are also displayed in the gallery.

Vision & Mission

Provide the heavy metal community and industry with outstanding resources, material, information, news, and updates

Promote graphic artists, music artists, record labels and agencies through interviews, biographies, artworks and in-depth profiles

Entice people to explore and experience life within the arts

Examine through music, art, and literature all aspects of the human condition

The Impact

  • Your impact will not only benefit us as a publisher but the artists and the metal community as whole

  • We are dedicated to placing the magazine in places where you wouldn't normally see a metal magazine like art galleries and museums

  • Our work has helped young artists getting the attention they deserve as well as getting paid jobs from bands

  • Heavy metal is one of the most relevant and influential art forms and it must be celebrated as such, Heavy Music Artwork is the first to make this statement

Since our launch www.heavymusicartwork.com great popularity, reaching nearly 1 million page views, and 25,000+ monthly visitors. Promoted via all HMA social networks 80K+ Followers. Newsletter to 5K HMA email subscribers.

Labels and PRs that helped us along the way

Agonia Records, Century Media, Debemur Morti Productions, Earache, Indie Recordings, Lifeforce Records, Lion Music, Mascot Group, Massacre Records, Metal Blade, Napalm Records, Nuclear Blast, Peaceville, Pitch Black Records, Relapse, Season of Mist, Snapper Music, Southern Lord, SPV, Universal, Spinefarm, Warner Music, Svart Records.

Adrenaline PR, Asher Media, Audacious PR, Clawhammer PR, Cosa Nostra, Devil PR, Dewar PR, Domino Media, Duff Press, Earsplit, Factory Music, Fly PR, Future PR, I Like Press, Noble PR, Noise Cartel, Old Empire, Perfect Storm PR, Pioneer Music Press, Publicity PR, Rarely Unable, Red Sand PR, Savage Gringo, Scream Promotion, Silverblack, Stampede Press, Speakeasy PR, Stereo Sanctity, Team All About The Music, Visible Noise, Wilful Publicity and Work Hard PR.

What are the risks?

As with any project, there are risks involved in releasing a publication. We might not be able to deliver the end product on time, or we might run into problems with the printing and shipping. Our team has over 15 years in delivering creative projects of all sizes and shapes. The 1st issue is ready to go to print, so any problems are very unlikely.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask your fellow metal head to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Please share and make the world know that metal is art in all its forms.

We are dedicated to placing the magazine in places where you wouldn't normally see a metal magazine like art galleries and museums
Our work has helped young artists getting the attention they deserve as well as getting paid jobs from bands
Heavy metal is one of the most relevant and influential art forms and it must be celebrated as such, Heavy Music Artwork is the first to make this statement
Since our launch www.heavymusicartwork.com great popularity, reaching nearly 1 million page views, and 25,000+ monthly visitors. Promoted via all HMA social networks 80K+ Followers. Newsletter to 5K HMA email subscribers.Labels and PRs that helped us along the wayAgonia Records, Century Media, Debemur Morti Productions, Earache, Indie Recordings, Lifeforce Records, Lion Music, Mascot Group, Massacre Records, Metal Blade, Napalm Records, Nuclear Blast, Peaceville, Pitch Black Records, Relapse, Season of Mist, Snapper Music, Southern Lord, SPV, Universal, Spinefarm, Warner Music, Svart Records.Adrenaline PR, Asher Media, Audacious PR, Clawhammer PR, Cosa Nostra, Devil PR, Dewar PR, Domino Media, Duff Press, Earsplit, Factory Music, Fly PR, Future PR, I Like Press, Noble PR, Noise Cartel, Old Empire, Perfect Storm PR, Pioneer Music Press, Publicity PR, Rarely Unable, Red Sand PR, Savage Gringo, Scream Promotion, Silverblack, Stampede Press, Speakeasy PR, Stereo Sanctity, Team All About The Music, Visible Noise, Wilful Publicity and Work Hard PR.What are the risks?As with any project, there are risks involved in releasing a publication. We might not be able to deliver the end product on time, or we might run into problems with the printing and shipping. Our team has over 15 years in delivering creative projects of all sizes and shapes. The 1st issue is ready to go to print, so any problems are very unlikely.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask your fellow metal head to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Please share and make the world know that metal is art in all its forms.

story:
Hi everyone! My name is Kristin Trotta and I am a singer/songwriter from Boston who has lived in NYC for half her life. Music has been my life line for as long as I can remember. I have always dreamed of recording an album that represented me and being able to share it with the world. With your help, I can make that dream a reality.

So here are the nuts and bolts. In order to record the complete album and give my musicians the support they deserve I am looking to put a majority of the funds towards completing the album, mastering the tracks, and putting on a concert for a lucky group of you all.

Any donations are completely appreciated because it gets me one step closer to my goal.

Some of the awesome perks include:

1. $25 gets you a 32 into 33 t-shirt

2. $50 gets you a digital download of the full album

3. $150 gets you a spot at my backyard concert, as well as a meet and greet with free snacks and a chance to choose songs for my set list.

4. For $50 more ($200) I will have you listed as a contributor on my album and give you an awesome shout out.

I want to show fellow musicians that you can make a difference and that you can get your music out there. The music industry has changed drastically, and I think for the better. Musicians are creating their own music on their own terms. They are making lasting connections and working together. What better way to create your vision then to do it with the support of your family and friends?

There are always going to be risks and challenges. It has been such a learning experience getting to this point. What if people don't like my music? What if I can't meet my goal?

What if I fail?

But what if I don't?

Even if you can't contribute at this time, the fact that you took the time to read my story means a lot and has such an impact. Please pass the word along if you can to anyone who may be interested in supporting.

story:
Black Diamonds.  

Paten Locke and Jay Myztroh are  S t o n o   E c h o, a Soul Hip-Hop Duo based out of Jacksonville, Florida.

Paten Locke is responsible for the masterfully crafted musical landscapes. His experience and resume authenticate and qualify the caliber of Hip-Hop represented in the project.

Myztroh’s musical lens infuses his skills as multi-instrumentalist and composer to wield vocal melodies with a rich understanding of harmony and counterpoint.

Despite who’s lead vocalist, a unified voice and philosophy is expressed through the music of   S t o n o  E c h o. Their name alludes to the 1739 Stono Rebellion. The music serves as a vehicle of emancipation for both the musicians and the listeners. The themes of their songs echo the human experience as a Black Man in America. The artists seek to unite people under their rhythms and move them with frequencies of harmony, love and justice.

As music lovers first their sound invokes the spirits of the greats like James Brown and Jay Dilla while exuding an energy of freshness.

With current trends as they are, Paten Locke and Jay Myztroh’s individual musical tastes and experiences combine to form a group that is uniquely rebellious; S T O N O   E C H O.

This is a pre-order offer.  This product has already been manufactured and will be available to you just in time for Christmas.

story:
At A Glance:

Hey! My name is Samantha Selci. I've been performing as Selci for the last five years and have explored many different developments (including noise and ambient explorations) before settling on alternative pop as my medium. I have studied classical music in school, performed as a folk artist (and a burlesque clown!) and am currently a producer, comtemporary singer, and audio tech at Canada's storied National Music Centre.

This campaign supports the final steps towards completing Effervescence. It's incredibly important to me as this EP is my most meaningful creation yet, and makes use of the variety of skills I've cultivated over decades of practice. I have also been given the opportunity to collaborate with two of my idols on the mixing and mastering of this album:

  • Sylvia Massy, mixing engineer extraordinaire, has worked with Johnny Cash, System of a Down, and the Red Hot Chili Peppers, to name a few. She is one of my greatest inspirations as a woman in music.
  • Matt Colton, who has mastered the works of some of my favorite artists, including Blood Orange, James Blake, Coldplay, MUSE and a whole slew of others.

Working with these two would bring the album to its best possible execution.

As it stands, this EP has been entirely self-funded, and, speaking candidly, I could not afford to have this album professionally mixed and mastered without your help.
 

Funding Required + Perks of Contributing:

In order to complete this project, the final costs are:

  • Approximately $1,000 to have Matt Colton master the album
  • Approximately $5,500 to have Sylvia Massy mix the album
  • $1,000 to $3,500 to have the album cut to vinyl. We anticipate doing a run of 100 records, with room to do up to 500 in a picture sleeve (!) when we reach our funding goal.

In total, we're looking for up to $10,000 to finish the album in the best possible way.

How can you support us?

  • We're using this campaign as a place to pre-order the EP. Whether you want it digitally, on vinyl, or even on cassette, you can pay now and receive the album as soon as it's done.
  • You can buy advance tickets for any of my upcoming shows this spring and summer!
  • We're also using this campaign as a place for you to shop everything Selci. We have t-shirts, stickers, posters, and patches available, with a bigger run of merch coming post-release.
  • There's some fun little custom-made stuff too, brought to you by yours truly – including an early screening of the music video I produced with TELUS Storyhive titled 'Truth in the Sea' and personalized love letters!

If we don't reach 100% of our goal, we will compromise on what's most important to producing the album. We will keep our vinyl run to 100 copies to start, and minimize all other expenses in order to prioritize mixing and mastering. No matter how much we raise, the album will be coming out at the end of May.

 

Why does Effervescence matter?

Effervescence is important as it has the potential to launch my career as a full-time musician, and to contribute to the Canadian music scene by exposing it to the world. This represents an opportunity to present my music in its purest and best form.

Since I first started performing as Selci, I have created impactful works with very little support. The last two music videos I've produced have very high production value despite their minimal budget, and have culminated in receiving $10,000 from TELUS Storyhive to produce my latest video for 'Truth in the Sea,' which will be releasing in early May.

Thus far, I have only ever worked alone and released a number of singles and albums. Working with a team has been immensely beneficial to my work. Effervescence will be a testament to that.

 

What are the risks?

Because this project is on the cusp of being finished, there are very few risks to consider. The primary costs are mixing and mastering, which will make a noticeable difference in the sound quality of the finished product. However, we still have the budget to bring everything else to completion.

The greatest risk is the potential for us to miss release day by having to source other mixing and mastering engineers who will fit our final budget. As it stands, our timelines established with Matt and Sylvia line up with release day, representing our best chance to release the best version of the album on time.

 

How else can I help?

Every little bit helps, no matter how small.

  • Spread the word on social media! Share this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.
  • Come to a show! I'll keep you posted as to when I'm performing. I have dates booked throughout the spring and summer.
  • Listen to Selci on Spotify.
  • Send good vibes. <333

Thank you so, so much for your help.

 

Album photography by Thomas Wang

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kyle and I'm a guitarist based in Memphis, TN. I basically learned guitar by playing in church, and a big part of guitar playing in church music is ambient. This style combined with my love of writing music lead me to start writing ambient background music. Up to this point, I haven't released any of it, but I decided I wanted to finally stop sitting on the music and get it out there. With this, I thought it best to put it under a different name than my own to separate the branding and leave my own name open for other projects later on. This project is going to be called Away From The Earth. To me, that encapsulates the goal of it: to take away from what is going on around you and allow you to focus, or just get away from it all. 

What I Need & What You Get

With the launch of a new project and a new album comes cost. This is broken down into a few main parts. A good amount of this funding will go to the production so that the album sounds as good as it can. The next section is the distribution, which in this case will be CDs, getting the album into online stores, and a small batch of 7" records (these will be in the rewards section as well). Branding for the new project will also be a decent part of this, the above image is a rough idea for the project logo. Finally, the last part of the cost will go towards a release event for the album (aiming for mid august). I'll share more details about that as it gets closer, but I'm extremely excited about it! 

For rewards, this project will be slightly different than most releases for bands. I didn't want to do merchandise just because of the nature of this, but I did want to offer some physical and digital music options. The options will be: early digital release, CDs, 7", and a combo CD + 7" pack. The 7" will be in a small batch, so if that's your thing you gotta jump on that! Also, any remaining physical copies will be sold at the release event. Finally, I'm going to share some behind the scenes videos with backers leading up the release of the record. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is that I'm not quite finished writing the album. As of writing this, I am over halfway finished with it, but obviously that isn't finished. I do have all of the songs mapped out and started, all that is currently left is to finish them! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign everywhere! It will help me out so much with reaching this goal. You can also follow Away From The Earth on Facebook and Instagram at @awayfromtheearth. The page is quite bare right now, but it will start to look much better as I move forward with this project.

story:
Hello everyone, first of all, thank you so much for stopping by in my very first campaign for my absolute Debut Album!

My name is Giancarlo Monsalve and I am an open-minded worldwide performing Opera singer.

I was born in a little and humble house, full of cousins, aunts, and uncles in Valparaiso, Chile. Humble house but with the most amazing view! Today I live in Hamburg, Germany and. I am so thankful and honored for the path that life has already given to me as an Artist. Starting from being a kid with big dreams but no way out, onto a big twist in life that, with hard work and perseverance, transformed me into a worldwide Opera Singer.

Now in my 14th years of international career, I finally feel ready to put out my very first Album, with the freedom of independent production to make it exactly how I dream and feel it.

 

 

  • WHY AN INDIE ALBUM?

NOW, THIS IS REALLY IMPORTANT TO ME: I think that as an Artist giving and transmitting emotions is fundamental. If I do not feel chills of what I am performing or creating, how in the world would I be able to transmit that to you? Right? That's why I want this album to come out from here!! With no more attachments or compromises than with my feelings and my audience! You! In the end, this Album is for you and me, not just a business trendy machine of fast food like music, right?

 

 

  • AND WHO IS THIS GIANCARLO MONSALVE? What has he done before?

I will try to make it as short as possible: With both feet on the ground, hard work,  love, and passion for the music, my career has developed all over the World in some of the most important Opera houses, always as principal guest Artist, Covent Garden in London, The Hong Kong Opera, Royal Opera House in Muscat, Arena di Verona, Washington National Opera, Zurich, Nice, Mumbai, Athens, Montreal, Munich, Seoul, etc. You name it. I was broadcasted in World cinemas, radios and TV with full shows and interviews! CNN, RAI TV, etc. I also had so many Interviews and notes in huge magazines as ELLE, newspapers as The Times, etc. Featured in:

And so on, working and growing with first-class level musicians, colleagues, Regisseurs and conductors. I was also really lucky to work with the Top voice-coaches (Masters) in the world, so many of them! I will mention just one here, Montserrat Caballé. I learned her superb legendary breathing technique in her Zaragoza Masterclasses. She was and will forever stay as one of the World Top Best sopranos. If you are not an Opera person for sure you will recognize her with the song Barcelona that she recorded with Freddie Mercury.

I am so thankful and honored.

I feel inspired by the Pioneer vision of so many great Artists as Montserrat Caballé and Freddie Mercury. That's why, with your help, I want to arrive to more people bringing this soul connected new sound with the Music of E-ARIAS, my Debut Album!

 

 

  • THE ALBUM

10 iconic famous Opera Arias in a whole new concept. As I say it before in the Campaign Overview: E-Arias will be my absolute Debut Album.
It is an extraordinary project that I have had in my heart for so many years now. As an Artist this project makes me feel like pure freedom because it will bring a fresh powerful new sound and vibes around. Mixing the best of two worlds Opera and Electronic music,
E-Arias is pure music evolution!

This Album is not about someone who is trying to be an Opera Singer doing crossover music with basic technique and no experience. I am a real Opera singer, with a real career, using my years of experience to do this project for the huge love that I have for music.

 

  • Inspiration:

E-ARIAS is a concept that I had in mind since 2015. It was not really clear yet because I was looking for that new sound that will touch my inner FIBRAS. Suddenly I had a call from a manager in New York to do the craziest project in my career: Stage, learn and perform the very first 2 hours and a half full-length Electronic Opera. It was as if the universe knew what I was looking for, and I did it! It was the E-Carmen concept and idea of a fantastic Lithuanian  Regisseur, Dalia Ibelhauptaitė and the mind-blowing music of Marijus Adomaitis (Ten Walls) production of the Vilnius City Opera, It was a blast!

From that moment on I finally found compatibility with my concept, not a full-length Opera, but a full album with the most famous Opera Arias with this crazy wonderful blend of music evolution E-Arias. Pure power.

 

  • Confirmation

Dalia Ibelhauptaitė, the Regisseur of the E-Carmen that I mentioned before, and her Husband are the ones that, without really knowing, confirmed to me that this was the way. After a performance having dinner with Dalia, she told me "this is the future of music!" It is ringing in my head till today. Before that, her husband (you will know who he is) came to me after our premier and told me: "Your performance moved me to tears, thank you!"

I was so deeply honored that such an Artist was touched by my performance! What an Artist! Dexter Fletcher, the director that saved Bohemian Rhapsody and put it to the top movies ever, the same director that did now Rocket Man the life of Elton John. Trust me, he knows about performances!

 

  • Lucky again!

Yes, I am! Just one month ago from now I signed with my new Opera Manager, Mr. Virginio Fedeli, who is also Andrea Bocelli's Manager! So in our meeting in Bologna, I introduced him 2 projects to have his opinion and he just loves both of them! And one of them is the E-ARIAS! He told me "It doesn't go against your Opera career, and I love it, so, GO FOR IT!”

Now I really feel ready for this adventure! Are you in?
Let's produce this album together!

ABOUT BOCELLI:

(I do this mention especially for my colleagues and Opera purists) Everyone can say whatever they want about an Artist, but for me, Andrea Bocelli is an important culture contributor in the Opera world, why? Because he has brought more people to the Opera world than any of my colleagues today, and I simply love his work. Respect! Giancarlo Monsalve.

 

 

  • WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

All that you'll get here are unique and exclusive Perks for YOU our IndieGoGo Campaign supporters! We are so excited because we are building this Album together! And you will stay part of it forever! So THANK YOU!!!

HOW MUCH? We are so lucky! Just have a look

Producing a real professional Album is really expensive, and 20.000€ is a very tight budget for all what we need to get done! BUT! Thank God I am lucky enough to have amazing Artists friends that are working into this project with so much passion and philanthropy, so the production price is already reduced to less than a quarter of what it will really take. That is amazing!

Have a look, part of all that we need to put out this Album:

  • TAXES
  • Pre-Production
  • Music Prep/Copyist/Arrangers
  • Studio recording for the voice
  • Studio recording for the organic instruments
  • Rights
  • Musicians
  • Mixing and Mastering
  • Photography
  • Art and Design
  • Manufacturing
  • Distribution
  • Promotion
  • IndieGoGo basic fees
  • IndieGoGo International Fees
  • Fulfillment
  • World Shipping

 

 

  • THE IMPACT

Well, we will be part of the music evolution! Your help will bring to the World a fresh powerful new sound and vibes around, mixing the best of two worlds, Opera and Electronic music.

We will bring new audiences to be interested in Opera!

We will also bring conservative people from the Opera world to discover the power and wonder on Electronic Music.

 

 

  • RISKS, CHALLENGES & GOALS

Let's be open and transparent:

  • RISKS
  1. For my career, it is a risky and unpredictable big step, forward or backward.. a big challenge. I love it!
  2. The money Goal! If we do not reach the small goal here, the production will take longer, we will look for a more conventional way of producing this Album, not with the freedom that we have here, but we will produce it anyway and you will get your Perks!

 

  • CHALLENGES & GOALS
  1. To bring a new audience to Opera
  2. To bring Opera audience to Electronic music
  3. If we make + 5000 € we will produce and add 1 video clip
  4. If we make + 10000 € we will produce and add 2 more arias for the Album +2 video clips
  5. If we make + 15000 € we will produce and add 2 more arias for the Album +4 video clips
  6. If we make +20000 € I will go to Venice take a Gondola to get myself a T-Shirt with the Indiegogo logo and make a video singing with a Mandolin improvising a THANK YOU SONG in Tenor voice for you all! + all the things mentioned before. ;)


 

  • NO MONEY? NO PROBLEM! There are other important ways you Can Help

  1. Spread the word!! With friends and family!
  2. Do you have some followers? Give them the chance to be part of this Album creation!
  3. Use the Indie GoGo sharing tools!
  4. Send the campaign link to your contacts by Email or WhatsApp! Surprise them! LINK HERE

Hello everyone, first of all, thank you so much for stopping by in my very first campaign for my absolute Debut Album!
My name is Giancarlo Monsalve and I am an open-minded worldwide performing Opera singer.

I was born in a little and humble house, full of cousins, aunts, and uncles in Valparaiso, Chile. Humble house but with the most amazing view! Today I live in Hamburg, Germany and. I am so thankful and honored for the path that life has already given to me as an Artist. Starting from being a kid with big dreams but no way out, onto a big twist in life that, with hard work and perseverance, transformed me into a worldwide Opera Singer.
Now in my 14th years of international career, I finally feel ready to put out my very first Album, with the freedom of independent production to make it exactly how I dream and feel it.
 
 
WHY AN INDIE ALBUM?
NOW, THIS IS REALLY IMPORTANT TO ME: I think that as an Artist giving and transmitting emotions is fundamental. If I do not feel chills of what I am performing or creating, how in the world would I be able to transmit that to you? Right? That's why I want this album to come out from here!! With no more attachments or compromises than with my feelings and my audience! You! In the end, this Album is for you and me, not just a business trendy machine of fast food like music, right?
 
 
AND WHO IS THIS GIANCARLO MONSALVE? What has he done before?
I will try to make it as short as possible: With both feet on the ground, hard work,  love, and passion for the music, my career has developed all over the World in some of the most important Opera houses, always as principal guest Artist, Covent Garden in London, The Hong Kong Opera, Royal Opera House in Muscat, Arena di Verona, Washington National Opera, Zurich, Nice, Mumbai, Athens, Montreal, Munich, Seoul, etc. You name it. I was broadcasted in World cinemas, radios and TV with full shows and interviews! CNN, RAI TV, etc. I also had so many Interviews and notes in huge magazines as ELLE, newspapers as The Times, etc. Featured in:

And so on, working and growing with first-class level musicians, colleagues, Regisseurs and conductors. I was also really lucky to work with the Top voice-coaches (Masters) in the world, so many of them! I will mention just one here, Montserrat Caballé. I learned her superb legendary breathing technique in her Zaragoza Masterclasses. She was and will forever stay as one of the World Top Best sopranos. If you are not an Opera person for sure you will recognize her with the song Barcelona that she recorded with Freddie Mercury.

I am so thankful and honored.
I feel inspired by the Pioneer vision of so many great Artists as Montserrat Caballé and Freddie Mercury. That's why, with your help, I want to arrive to more people bringing this soul connected new sound with the Music of E-ARIAS, my Debut Album!
 
 
THE ALBUM
10 iconic famous Opera Arias in a whole new concept. As I say it before in the Campaign Overview: E-Arias will be my absolute Debut Album.It is an extraordinary project that I have had in my heart for so many years now. As an Artist this project makes me feel like pure freedom because it will bring a fresh powerful new sound and vibes around. Mixing the best of two worlds Opera and Electronic music,E-Arias is pure music evolution!

This Album is not about someone who is trying to be an Opera Singer doing crossover music with basic technique and no experience. I am a real Opera singer, with a real career, using my years of experience to do this project for the huge love that I have for music.
 
Inspiration:
E-ARIAS is a concept that I had in mind since 2015. It was not really clear yet because I was looking for that new sound that will touch my inner FIBRAS. Suddenly I had a call from a manager in New York to do the craziest project in my career: Stage, learn and perform the very first 2 hours and a half full-length Electronic Opera. It was as if the universe knew what I was looking for, and I did it! It was the E-Carmen concept and idea of a fantastic Lithuanian  Regisseur, Dalia Ibelhauptaitė and the mind-blowing music of Marijus Adomaitis (Ten Walls) production of the Vilnius City Opera, It was a blast!
From that moment on I finally found compatibility with my concept, not a full-length Opera, but a full album with the most famous Opera Arias with this crazy wonderful blend of music evolution E-Arias. Pure power.
 
Confirmation
Dalia Ibelhauptaitė, the Regisseur of the E-Carmen that I mentioned before, and her Husband are the ones that, without really knowing, confirmed to me that this was the way. After a performance having dinner with Dalia, she told me "this is the future of music!" It is ringing in my head till today. Before that, her husband (you will know who he is) came to me after our premier and told me: "Your performance moved me to tears, thank you!"
I was so deeply honored that such an Artist was touched by my performance! What an Artist! Dexter Fletcher, the director that saved Bohemian Rhapsody and put it to the top movies ever, the same director that did now Rocket Man the life of Elton John. Trust me, he knows about performances!
 
Lucky again!
Yes, I am! Just one month ago from now I signed with my new Opera Manager, Mr. Virginio Fedeli, who is also Andrea Bocelli's Manager! So in our meeting in Bologna, I introduced him 2 projects to have his opinion and he just loves both of them! And one of them is the E-ARIAS! He told me "It doesn't go against your Opera career, and I love it, so, GO FOR IT!”

Now I really feel ready for this adventure! Are you in?Let's produce this album together!
ABOUT BOCELLI:
(I do this mention especially for my colleagues and Opera purists) Everyone can say whatever they want about an Artist, but for me, Andrea Bocelli is an important culture contributor in the Opera world, why? Because he has brought more people to the Opera world than any of my colleagues today, and I simply love his work. Respect! Giancarlo Monsalve.
 
 
WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET
All that you'll get here are unique and exclusive Perks for YOU our IndieGoGo Campaign supporters! We are so excited because we are building this Album together! And you will stay part of it forever! So THANK YOU!!!
HOW MUCH? We are so lucky! Just have a look
Producing a real professional Album is really expensive, and 20.000€ is a very tight budget for all what we need to get done! BUT! Thank God I am lucky enough to have amazing Artists friends that are working into this project with so much passion and philanthropy, so the production price is already reduced to less than a quarter of what it will really take. That is amazing!
Have a look, part of all that we need to put out this Album:

TAXES
Pre-Production
Music Prep/Copyist/Arrangers
Studio recording for the voice
Studio recording for the organic instruments
Rights
Musicians
Mixing and Mastering
Photography
Art and Design
Manufacturing
Distribution
Promotion
IndieGoGo basic fees
IndieGoGo International Fees
Fulfillment
World Shipping

 
 
THE IMPACT
Well, we will be part of the music evolution! Your help will bring to the World a fresh powerful new sound and vibes around, mixing the best of two worlds, Opera and Electronic music.
We will bring new audiences to be interested in Opera!
We will also bring conservative people from the Opera world to discover the power and wonder on Electronic Music.
 
 
RISKS, CHALLENGES & GOALS
Let's be open and transparent:
RISKS


For my career, it is a risky and unpredictable big step, forward or backward.. a big challenge. I love it!


The money Goal! If we do not reach the small goal here, the production will take longer, we will look for a more conventional way of producing this Album, not with the freedom that we have here, but we will produce it anyway and you will get your Perks!

 
CHALLENGES & GOALS

To bring a new audience to Opera
To bring Opera audience to Electronic music
If we make + 5000 € we will produce and add 1 video clip
If we make + 10000 € we will produce and add 2 more arias for the Album +2 video clips
If we make + 15000 € we will produce and add 2 more arias for the Album +4 video clips
If we make +20000 € I will go to Venice take a Gondola to get myself a T-Shirt with the Indiegogo logo and make a video singing with a Mandolin improvising a THANK YOU SONG in Tenor voice for you all! + all the things mentioned before. ;)

 
NO MONEY? NO PROBLEM! There are other important ways you Can Help

Spread the word!! With friends and family!
Do you have some followers? Give them the chance to be part of this Album creation!
Use the Indie GoGo sharing tools!
Send the campaign link to your contacts by Email or WhatsApp! Surprise them! LINK HERE

story:
The Story

Hi, I'm Melissa! I grew up in New York and have come, mysteriously, to live in the heart of Austin, TX.  I began embarking on my singer songwriter journey when I was 21, when I discovered I could sing and had a talent for weaving lyrics and melodies together and performing them powerfully.  Before that I was known primarily for my gymnastics career of 18 years, and it surprised me as much as anyone when my life took a left turn in this direction.  A handful of years later and here I am at the foot of the mountain of a dream: to record my music excellently and masterfully, with some of the finest musicians out there, and give life to songs that have a real impact on people.  For the past nine years I've been writing and performing music, most recently with a five piece band here in Austin.  In 2012 I recorded my first EP The Wind, It Grew Legs, and later followed it up with a music video that has received awards internationally. I've been creating and refining this batch of songs for years and I am floored at the opportunity to finally bring them into recorded form.  When the producer approached me about working together, I knew it was my opportunity to really go for it!
 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $10,000 to cover the cost of the studio, the producer, the musicians, mixing and mastering, album artwork, and the printing of CDs.  We are recording for four whole days the last weekend of August and the first weekend of September at a studio called Cacophony.  Musicians include members of my 5-piece live band Jon Clayton and Jacqueline May on guitar, cello, and vocals.  We will also have violin, viola, keyboard, pedal steel, bass, drums, percussion, horns, and additional vocalists.  Some of the finest musicians in Austin will be playing, some of whom have played on my favorite records, for reals! I am awed by how this is coming together.  The producer Grant Johnson has produced records of local Austin favorites the Deer, Ley Line, Dana Falconberry, and Raina Rose. I feel honored and blessed to be among such wonderful company!

In backing this project you are essentially ordering the album on commission, so if you've heard of us, heard us play or perform and have been touched by our music, please consider helping us fund this upcoming album!  You can receive perks such as CD's, T-shirts, tanks, tote bags and other cool handmade merch, original artwork, customized songs, and private live performances in your home! Righteous!

The Impact

In a time of much global upheaval, divisiveness, and terror, music continues to be an unfailing source of comfort and inspiration for us all.  The title track of the album, Crystalline Charm is taken from a song that I sing at the end of live shows and therapy sessions that I host weekly at a local Texas jail where I volunteer with an organization called Truth Be Told.  Here is a sample of the lyrics:

I will pick myself up off the ground

Shake off the chatter and drowns out the sound of

Music ringing clear as a bell

Holds out its hands to lift us from hell and

Holds me up like a crystalline charm in the

Hand of a child so sweet and so warm

Makes me remember why I was born

Every time I forget

 

It's been my anthem lately and I hope, in its fully expressed musical form, it can be yours too

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, please consider sharing the campaign on your social media, or email and text your friends and family.  Every good intention and dollar counts! Thank you!

story:
What’s up guys!

Thanks for taking a moment to click the link. If You are seeing this, chances are You support MrcyU. That’s awesome and I appreciate You.

My vision is to inspire millions around the world to be their best self while also aiding in the Afrobeat movement that is currently underway. I truly believe Africa is on the rise and one of the main contributors to that is music. Afrobeat has opened the gateway for the world to embrace Africa as a whole. Our music, fashion, traditions, and foods are now being recognized and appreciated by many all over the globe. I believe the essential key in this advent is music. I am contributing to this continual movement and will continue and also use My platform to inspire people. In the long run I will open a Musical performing arts school in Nigeria to help capture and cultivate all the great talent in Nigeria and lessen the underappreciation for the Arts as a career and also loosen the stigma of Doctor, Lawyer, or Engineer as the only credible carreer paths. 

I personality have met many Africans that have a heart for art, but their dreams got crushed by their parent, community, or lack of support because it didn’t fit into the "ideal". I am grateful to have slipped through the cracks and continue to follow My heart and I want to help others especially in Africa to nourish their gifts and fuel their passion through the schools. ‘Musicvation’

I have been pursuing My passion as a musical Artist for about 7 years with many accomplishments under My belt from winning college talent shows, performing at venues such as The Viper Room, House of Blues Hollywood, Catch One nightclub, Exchange LA, Hard Rock Cafe Lagos and many others. All while perfecting My craft by studying the art and business side, numerous studio sessions, and several dance classes and hours of personal practice. There are many challenges being in this industry, but I will never give up. I am very much dedicated to My Artistry and believe this is what I am here for. 

I intend to contribute to the #Afrobeat  movement by sharing My art with as many people as I can. But no man is an island! I need You all behind Me! As an independent Artist there are many obstacles I face and finance is a big one. We as independent artists need extra funds to pay for things such as promotions, studio time, production fees, travel, content creation, marketing and promo, to name a few. I have been so blessed to have connected with people who genuinely believe in MRCYU and the vision that help out with acts of service and favors like photo shoots, promo, beats, and even monetary donations and I appreciate it sooo much! For those of You who want to help to continue to support MRCYU I’m asking that 

1. You make a donation and/or buy merchandise from Me

2. Help spread awareness (like,comment,share with personal thoughts of Me)

My team and I are working very hard to spread awareness about MRCYU  through marketing and promotions but Your shares mean so much more. 

Have You recently discovered a new awesome Artist or restaurant? 9/10 it was a friend or family member that introduced You to it. If You could introduce MrcyU to someone or share my music or this campaign it would mean so much to Me! 

Every dollar counts, and every share counts.

Thanks again, MrcyU

story:
BIO

NIGHT is a new-school folk band that focuses on using traditional and endangered Nepali instruments to create new sounds.

Night’s songs are representative of the various music traditions existing in the country.The band derives much inspiration from their travels and discovery of the place and its people. Their lyrics speak of rural life in Nepal, the struggles of the workingman, and the resilience of the people’s spirit to deal with the harshness of every day life.

Night's debut album ‘Ani Ukali Sangai Orali’ released in 2014. It was well received critically and commercially and carved a niche for the band, with an audience spanning from metal heads, music connoisseurs and the common man.

Night represented Nepal at Shambhala Music Festival (UK) in August 2015. Night has also collaborated with A.R. Rahman (winner of two Grammy Awards) on the occasion of International Peace Day to produce a musical tribute Ot.

About the campaign

We are in the process of recording our second album ‘Jhalka Raya Buka’, which along with our studio session recordings, also features live field recordings from our travels. The songs in this album are reminiscent of the various musical practices across the country. Nepal has over one hundred different ethnicities and languages and the landscape changes drastically from the south to the north. This subsequently stimulated us to write and compose in diverse languages and dialects of Nepal. We have researched considerably in putting together each and every song of the album. Most of these songs were composed ‘in the field’ along with the people in the villages. After living with the initial melody and rhythm, we slowly discovered its deeper meaning through its compositional narrative. It is with this intention we express and share this music.

There are nine songs in the album that address various subjects but are thematically linked. The title track ‘Jhalka raya buka’ meaning ‘remnants of memoirs’ is based on ‘thadi' and ‘deuda’ singing practices and performances from the western parts of Nepal. Another song, ‘Putali ko bhesha barilai’ is based on traditional wedding ceremonies practiced in the remote villages of Nepal. ‘Tharu song’ is based on the musical repertoire of the Tharu community where the verses of the Ramayana, an epic Hindu poem are sung. ‘Daanda kaada’ is inspired by mountain folktales that resonate on different levels, from faith to mythology to daily plight. Whereas ‘Gaine geet’, Kalo dhunga’ and ‘Basai bagayo part 2’ speaks about the struggles of the workingman, and the resilience of the people’s spirit to deal with the harshness of every day life.

We have also worked with and revived some endangered traditional Nepalese instruments like ‘pilhru’, ‘kastaar’, ‘chatkauli ‘and ‘piwancha’ for our upcoming album. Research has been an integral part of our evolution and creative process. But this involves an enormous cost associated with travelling and staying in remote villages for a long duration. We have been fortunate to meet and collaborate with regional artists along our musical journey, and a few of them feature in our upcoming album.

Some of previous work:

Live at Kripa Unplugged, ‘Putali ko bhesha barilai’: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lNs0OBnhn70

Live at Chowrasta, Darjeeling, India- ‘Daada Kaada’: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iNjIB8iejWE

Official Music Video “Kathor” from their debut album” Ani Ukali Sangai Orali”

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQ2uxtD9Fbc

Official Music Video “Tuina ko chha hai bhara” from their debut album” Ani Ukali Sangai Orali” https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sr_TLT_E7lg

Know your instrument series

Leaf (Paluwa) - Know your instruments

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_9xDJFcFhoI

The Forgotten Tharu Instruments - Know your instruments https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fn3ZZGvNajw

We need your help

As of now, we have been able to record only about fifty percent of our upcoming album. In order to complete the process, we will need your support. Your donation, no matter how small, will go a long way. And we will be grateful for your kindness. Also, there are some perks that come with every donation made. Your contributions are invaluable to us, so we want to give back as much as we can!  Please take a look at all the perks we have put together for you!  Digital downloads, T-shirts, Handwritten lyric booklets with English Translation, Physical cd's, and not to mention our sincerest appreciation. 

The Budget

Here is a list of everything our $4,000 goal goes towards:

-Studio time

-Paying the Engineers

-Mixing & Mastering

-Artwork

-CD Duplication

-Professional Music Video shot by our very talented friends

- T-shirts & other Merchandise

And, so…

Please contribute and share, if you can. Even if you can’t donate hope you will help us get the word out.

Thanks, everyone!

Even if you can’t donate hope you will help us get the word out.Thanks, everyone!

story:
OVERVIEW:

We are raising funds to support ‘Out of Place', a project that explores how contemporary poetry on the theme of displacement and new beginnings can be used as an inspiration for musical composition. This has been a 6 month process which will, with your help, be culminating in a gala performance of new musical works on Monday 3rd July 2017 at 8pm at the Actors’ Church (St Paul’s Covent Garden).  'Out of Place' also supports independent journalism through raising funds for the Rory Peck Trust.

 

The ‘Out of Place’ project will explore how contemporary poetry on the themes of displacement and new beginnings may be used as an inspiration for musical composition. It will culminate in a gala performance on Monday 3 July 2017 at 8pm at the Actors’ Church (St Paul’s Covent Garden).

Through the sale of booklets containing copies of the poems that inspired the music, the project hopes to raise funds for the Rory Peck Trust, a charity supporting freelance journalists and their families in crisis. It will include information about the Trust’s work with journalists around the world, and will also feature original illustrations commissioned from the artist Andy Hitchen. All profits from sale of the booklet will go to the Rory Peck Trust.

Yet in order to do this, we need your help to raise £3,000. This will help pay for the illustrations for the cover of the booklet, posters and leaflets, graphic design and printing costs, the cost of recording the event for the website, and the expenses and payments paid to all the professional freelancers involved. In tribute to my parents, May and Brian Smith, I am covering the cost of the venue. As music lovers, travellers and emigrants to Canada in the 60’s, they would have been delighted to support a project like this.

So please contribute what you can. All donors will be listed in the booklet (unless you choose to be anonymous) and those who donate £15 or more will be sent a limited edition, signed print of the original illustration for ‘Out of Place’ by artist Andy Hitchen. 

And there are other ways to help too. You can buy tickets to attend the gala performance on Monday 3rd July http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2933432 and/or buy the booklet of poems (£5) that will be available at the event.

The History of the Project

My name is Nicola Burnett Smith and I have been working in theatre arts and the voluntary sector for 30 years. 

In late 2016 I invited submissions from poets on the theme of ‘Out of Place’. Simultaneously I invited  a team of female composer-musicians to join me in creating a quintet: Gemma Storr, Sarah Woolfenden, Kate Stilitz and Marianne Johnson. Between us we play over 16 different instruments as well as compose music and sing. 

We chose 9 poems from a total of 78 that were submitted by 33 poets from all over the UK and the world. The poems were made anonymous during the selection process and the identities of the poets were revealed in early December 2016. This was a hugely successful event where the poems were read by professional actors and discussed with the poets and the composers.

The momentum continued to build and we have now embarked upon a series of musical workshops, forming each other’s little orchestra as part of a supportive process of composition, which will be culminating in a mostly acoustic performance of the unique pieces.

 

Please follow our progress on Facebook:  Out of Place 2017 @ Nicola Burnett Smith
