story:
About The American Dream Tour
The American Dream Tour is the fulfillment of a promise that this country is truly the land of opportunity. The tour is for progressive music lovers and it is being organized by independent artists, activists and volunteers. Our goal for this tour is to deliver a message of Peace, human rights and solidarity for those in our human family most at risk economically, environmentally and psychologically. By aligning with like minds and grass roots systems of change we intend to shift the paradigm in conversations about what is possible in mainstream music.

  • One live concert performance in 15 cities in 30 calendar days
  • Recruitment Awareness Workshop in a high school or university whenever possible: students considering enlisting in the armed forces will be given a chance to meet with a veteran and hear honest personal accounts of military experience
  • Local radio station live interview to discuss the movement, the music and the tour

About Megaciph
Megaciph, an acronym for Mental Energies Gather And Circulate In Positive Harmony, is a progressive American rapper with a captivating voice, powerful delivery, and world class production. Megaciph’s body of work includes four self-published albums containing a host of artists and producer collaborations; live performances in Atlanta, London, and Nairobi, among others; videos filmed in New York and Okinawa; and currently working on multiple creative projects. A veteran of the US Marine Corps, Megaciph is a member of Veterans For Peace, working to educate people on the true costs of war through his music. Megaciph also works with World Can't Wait on their We Are Not Your Soldiers project to offer students an honest account of what military service actually means in a global context. This self-identifying yogi and practitioner of Tai Chi embodies the qualities of Peace and Harmony in both his music and daily life. He is a home chef, regular volunteer at local nonprofits, married to his wife for 16 years and is the primary caregiver to their two young children, ages 6 and 3.

Tour Dates:
Beginning in Washington D.C. and winding our way through the U.S. to Seattle Washington. Performing in 15 cities in 36 days.

  • Washington, D.C. Sun Mar 31st & Wed Apr 3rd - No to NATO -- Yes to Peace FESTIVAL
  • Newark, NJ Wed Apr 10th - Larouge Lounge
  • New York, NY Thu Apr 11th - The Well 
  • Chicago, IL Mon Apr 15th - Live Music Mondays 
  • Kansas City, MO Wed Apr 17th - The Roxy   
  • Wichita, KS Thu Apr 18th - R Coffee House
  • Wichita, KS Sat Apr 20th - Wave
  • Albuquerque, NM Tue Apr 23rd - The Jam Spot
  • Phoenix, AZ Thu Apr 25th
  • Las Vegas, NV Fri Apr 26th
  • Los Angeles, CA Sat Apr 27th - Tribal Cafe
  • Oakland, CA Sun Apr 28th
  • Portland, OR Thu May 2nd - Peace House
  • Olympia, WA Fri May 3rd
  • Tacoma, WA Sat May 4th - Airport Tavern

Tour Needs and Your Perks 
Leaving my family for a little over one month requires the love and support of my family, friends and new friends I will make along the way. More substantially, someone has to physically fill my shoes and take care of all the day to day needs of a household with two young children and a spouse who works full time. We take the care of our children very seriously as most people do. We have an incredible person to take care of our babies and manage all of the mundane tasks. To make this tour a success I also need a rental car (my 2006 Nissan Altima is fine but if it breaks down the tour ends; if a rental breaks down I get it replaced and keep it moving). Additionally, there is a need for a reliable GPS, food and gas money while on the road, a small fund for lodging in case I need to rest and have no friend's place to crash. Finally I will need a plane ticket home. Here you will find details on the tour budget with quotes and pictures: 

  • Rental Car $2,687.27
  • Baby Care $2,000
  • Gas $457.60 (30mi/gallon x avg. $3.00/Gallon)
  • Food $1,080 ($30/day food x 36 days)
  • Lodging $500 (in case I have to sleep in a city where I don't have a place to crash)
  • GPS $72.99
  • Plane fare home $238
  • Grand Total $7,035.86

Supporters of this campaign will receive Social Media Shout Outs, Stickers, CD's, T-Shirts, Personalized Songs for a selected cause, Potential Song Collaborations, and even House Party Concerts. Contributors will also make new lasting friendships and allow space for more love and support in their own lives. When we do those things which scare us but also make our world a better place we grow our tribe by aligning with like minds and build strong vibrant communities.     

Risks & Challenges

Total Driving Miles - 4576mi (75+hr of driving time) This is a physical and mental challenge but nothing comes to those who wait and I refuse to allow my voice to be silenced simply because I'm an undiscovered gem. I will no longer be the seed that waited for something to happen. I have let go of my fear. I am breaking down the walls that divide us and coming to your city, I am truly bringing my music To The People!!

I announced this tour having no cities booked and we now have 7 booked with the goal of 15. My sister Victoria Beeson has been working to make this manifest along with her team of incredible talents. At the launch of this campaign we are negotiating with several others and working to make the vision a reality. The great news is that we are not being turned away. One of the biggest challenges we are facing is the time frame; venues are very interested and requesting us for dates that fall outside our date range or the driving distance is too far. This is a great problem because it means there will be more tours in the future. This is also a challenge because some of the venues along the path are already booked full. This gives a chance for those people in certain cities to invite The American Dream Tour to your city. Check out the dates below and link us with a promoter and venue in your city!  

Social Consciousness*
Over the past two years under the current White House the true progressive nature of this country has been forced out of the shadows into the public conversation. In the wake of social movements such as #metoo #marchforourlives and #NoNato, major shifts have impacted Hollywood and the business world, leading to a blue wave taking over Congress and shifting the seats of power in Washington. Yet, much of mainstream music has continued to cater to an audience that identifies as less politically active. In a world where so much injustice exists those with a voice and a platform must use every means possible to help create a better world for future generations. The American Dream Tour is a wake up call for America. We can allow this country to crumble under the weight of our bloated military budget or decide to do our part in helping to eliminate greenhouse gases and thermonuclear weapons. On timeless tracks, Megaciph’s songs address looming global issues such as climate change, and pervasive social issues such as cycles of violence in communities and the prison industrial complex. Come to a show in a city near you and experience how your Mental Energies Gather And Circulate In Positive Harmony.        

*Megaciph lyrics do not promote materialism, misogyny or violence of any kind.

Support this movement
Become a patron of The American Dream Tour 
Bring The American Dream Tour to your city                                      
Share this with your circles                                                                            
Leave comments

story:
Short Summary

Hi,  this is jazz flutist Kim Scott.  I'm a music teacher at a fine arts school for 7th-12th graders who want to pursue the arts as a career. I've taught for 18 years and I absolutely love giving back to the next generation of musicians.  I'm also a professional flutist; a member of the Tuscaloosa Symphony Orchestra, the Kimoni Duo (a flute and harp duo) and I'm a billboard charting flutist on the Innervision Records label.  I love music and the flute.  I've wanted to be a professional flutist since I first started playing in 5th grade.  I can't think of not ever creating music and putting it out into the universe. 

I have created this campaign because I've planned and budgeted for the creation and release of my 4th album, "Free to Be".  Because of some wonderful opportunities presented to me, the costs of my project exceeded the budget I created.  I chance not being able to release this project on time and need your help to make it happen.  This music has to reach the world.  The past year I experienced some real life experiences that were detrimental and heartbreaking.  I overcame them and this music has breathed new life into my existence.  I want to share it with the world in hopes that it will inspire and bring healing. 

Your contribution will help me create and promote this project.  I want to submit it to the Grammy Foundation for consideration.  It's JUST THAT GOOD!  I believe in this project and I believe in you.  Will you join my team and help me?

 What You Get For Helping:

The project will cost roughly $12,000.  I am trying to raise $5,000 for recording at Woodaworx Studio, production, duplication and radio promotion.  I plan to use my savings for the bulk of it.  Here are the perks for your generous donation:

$50  and up - a personalized, autographed CD

$200  and up - a personalized, autographed CD and a Kim Scott's "Block Party Radio" t-shirt

$300 and up -  a personalized, autographed CD, a Kim Scott's "Block Party Radio" t-shirt, and a pair of tickets Kim's CD Release Concert in Birmingham or Huntsville, AL.

$400 and up - a personalized, autographed CD, a Kim Scott's "Block Party Radio" s-shirt, a pair of tickets to Kim's CD Release concert in Birmingham or Huntsville, AL. and a meet and greet there.

$500 and up-  a personalized, autographed CD, a Kim Scott's "Block Party Radio" t-shirt, a pair of tickets to Kim's CD Release concert in Birmingham or Huntsville, AL., a meet and greet there, and acknowledgement in the CD liner notes.

Even if I don't reach my goal, your full donation will be appreciated and will go towards this project.  My track record shows that you can trust me and my intent.  Just listen to any of my previous three records on iTunes, Amazon, CD Baby or Pandora.

If you can't donate and know someone who can, please share this campaign with them.  Help me get the word out and make some noise by using the Indiegogo share tools.

THANK YOU!

Kim

story:
We're so close to being able to finish the album, create the
tour show, launch "The Preface" and take this
clean music movement to the world. 

But we need one final push to get over the edge. 

Thank you so much for being willing to help. We REALLY appreciate it.

Read on to learn more about what we're trying to do...or just watch the video above. :)

Much love to you and make a great day!

__________________________________________________________________________________________

The Prince Ivan Concept

Once upon a time, two guys wanted to make music and change the world.

We’re those two guys. :)

Hi, we’re Prince Ivan and our vision is to
become one of the most commercially successful duos of all time,
writing and producing hit music for ourselves and other artists for many years to come.



The Prince Ivan concept is to create 
mainstream, profanity-free music
in a genre we call SpectraPop™️. 

Our mission is to create what we call SpectraCulture™️ by 
uniting people of all ages, races and backgrounds, 
especially targeting young people ages 13-30.


The Problem We See

There’s just too much hate and division in the world. We don’t like it.

This division and hate usually starts with one person,
but then it gets into families, communities and nations
until it is eventually deeply engrained in our culture.

Division and hate stinks.

But, if we can change individual hearts, 
then we have a chance at changing the culture,
which would decrease the hate and increase the love and unity.


Music Has Power

Music bypasses the intellect and goes straight to the heart.

As musicians, we have a powerful medium to influence human hearts and shape culture.

The problem is that a lot of musicians and artists use the power of music to influence
 the minds and hearts of our young people negatively, planting ideas that lead to
more hate, more division and more societal problems…


The Solution We See

But, imagine if we can create clean music that young people actually like!

Mainstream, radio-worthy pop music that isn’t hoaky, cheesy or low-quality.

Then, maybe we can gain these young peoples’ trust and our music could help plant better ideas in their hearts, which would impact culture in a very positive way and help create our
vision of a world filled with love, joy and unity—A SpectraCulture™️ world.

Make sense?

Enter, Prince Ivan and “The Preface” album…


The Music

Our musical approach is a bit different, so we had to come up with a new genre we call SpectraPop™️. 

SpectraPop™️ music…

…Is contemporary.
…Contains appropriate content. 
…Blurs genre-lines.
…Leads to SpectraCulture™️.

In short, SpectraPop™️ is music for everyone.
You can turn Prince Ivan’s music on and know you’re going
to get catchy, high quality and guilt-free music without the filth. Every time.



Our first full length album, “The Preface,” is going to feature SpectraPop™️ songs that are
more taste relevant and targeted at young people than any of our previous music.



You can check out some of the singles we’ve already released from “The Preface” by clicking here.

Also, check out some of the YouTube videos in the gallery above.


The Tour

We'll be touring “The Preface” to high schools, colleges
and cities all throughout the country in 2019-2020. 

We LOVE interacting with students, young people and fans. 



On stage and on tour is where our music, our mission and our message combine in the most powerful way and we really see hearts changed and lives touched.


The Movement

We are not the only artists who are trying to impact culture
through good clean music and entertainment. 

There are many others. 

Our goal is to step up and be a voice for this movement, model the way, and
ultimately mobilize thousands of other artists to take the same approach,
proving that you don’t have to "sell out" to sell out.

We’re just one artist, but if we can mobilize others, then we can really shift culture.


The Money

We’re not in this just to make money, but it takes money to do what we’re trying to do.

So, we are seeking a contribution of $10,000 to help us finish the album,
launch the tour and get this clean music movement off the ground. 



This album has already cost much more than $10,000
but we just need a final financial push to finish the music, create
the show and build the tour, so we can take “The Preface” to the world.


What You’ll Get

A lot of people do crowdfunding campaigns, but you can rest assured that your contribution is going toward something that will make a positive difference in the world
—a cause we are 100% committed to.

We promise that we will do everything we possibly can to
put your contribution to good use in building the vision we’ve described.

There are also some great perks.
Check ‘em out!


The Time is Now

If we’re going to reclaim our culture and take back the arts and
entertainment mountain, then we are going to need to take action.

Now is the time. We feel like we’re at a pivotal moment in our history.

We want to inspire the next generation to join us in creating 
a better world and we know we need to move fast.



We’re just two guys, but if you help us launch this, then we stand
a legitimate chance at shifting culture and doing, not just some, but
A LOT of good in the world.
 

Thank You

Thank you for believing in Prince Ivan. Thank you for your love and support. Please let us know if you have any questions at all and we’ll catch you on the other side of “The Preface.”

Love, 
Brydon and Aaron


P.S. Check out the FAQs for…err…frequently asked questions. ;)

 

Other Ways You Can Help
We appreciate your financial support of our project so much. We could also use some help in spreading the word about our Indiegogo campaign and about our musical vision. Feel free to use the Indiegogo sharing tools, your social media accounts, email or any other means you’d like to spread the Prince Ivan love and help us get the word out. Thanks again!

Those social links…
www.princeivan.com
www.facebook.com/PrinceIvanMusic
www.youtube.com/PrinceIvanOfficial
www.instagram.com/PrinceIvanOfficial
story_txt:
We're so close to being able to finish the album, create thetour show, launch "The Preface" and take thisclean music movement to the world. 
But we need one final push to get over the edge. 
Thank you so much for being willing to help. We REALLY appreciate it.
Read on to learn more about what we're trying to do...or just watch the video above. :)
Much love to you and make a great day!
__________________________________________________________________________________________
The Prince Ivan Concept
Once upon a time, two guys wanted to make music and change the world.We’re those two guys. :)Hi, we’re Prince Ivan and our vision is tobecome one of the most commercially successful duos of all time,writing and producing hit music for ourselves and other artists for many years to come.
The Prince Ivan concept is to create mainstream, profanity-free musicin a genre we call SpectraPop™️. Our mission is to create what we call SpectraCulture™️ by uniting people of all ages, races and backgrounds, especially targeting young people ages 13-30.

The Problem We See

There’s just too much hate and division in the world. We don’t like it.
This division and hate usually starts with one person,but then it gets into families, communities and nationsuntil it is eventually deeply engrained in our culture.Division and hate stinks.But, if we can change individual hearts, then we have a chance at changing the culture,which would decrease the hate and increase the love and unity.

Music Has Power

Music bypasses the intellect and goes straight to the heart.As musicians, we have a powerful medium to influence human hearts and shape culture.The problem is that a lot of musicians and artists use the power of music to influence the minds and hearts of our young people negatively, planting ideas that lead tomore hate, more division and more societal problems…

The Solution We See

But, imagine if we can create clean music that young people actually like!Mainstream, radio-worthy pop music that isn’t hoaky, cheesy or low-quality.Then, maybe we can gain these young peoples’ trust and our music could help plant better ideas in their hearts, which would impact culture in a very positive way and help create ourvision of a world filled with love, joy and unity—A SpectraCulture™️ world.Make sense?Enter, Prince Ivan and “The Preface” album…

The Music

Our musical approach is a bit different, so we had to come up with a new genre we call SpectraPop™️. SpectraPop™️ music…
…Is contemporary.…Contains appropriate content. …Blurs genre-lines.…Leads to SpectraCulture™️.In short, SpectraPop™️ is music for everyone.You can turn Prince Ivan’s music on and know you’re goingto get catchy, high quality and guilt-free music without the filth. Every time.
Our first full length album, “The Preface,” is going to feature SpectraPop™️ songs that aremore taste relevant and targeted at young people than any of our previous music.
You can check out some of the singles we’ve already released from “The Preface” by clicking here.Also, check out some of the YouTube videos in the gallery above.

The Tour

We'll be touring “The Preface” to high schools, collegesand cities all throughout the country in 2019-2020. We LOVE interacting with students, young people and fans. 
On stage and on tour is where our music, our mission and our message combine in the most powerful way and we really see hearts changed and lives touched.

The Movement

We are not the only artists who are trying to impact culturethrough good clean music and entertainment. There are many others. Our goal is to step up and be a voice for this movement, model the way, andultimately mobilize thousands of other artists to take the same approach,proving that you don’t have to "sell out" to sell out.We’re just one artist, but if we can mobilize others, then we can really shift culture.

The Money

We’re not in this just to make money, but it takes money to do what we’re trying to do.So, we are seeking a contribution of $10,000 to help us finish the album,launch the tour and get this clean music movement off the ground. 
This album has already cost much more than $10,000but we just need a final financial push to finish the music, createthe show and build the tour, so we can take “The Preface” to the world.

What You’ll Get

A lot of people do crowdfunding campaigns, but you can rest assured that your contribution is going toward something that will make a positive difference in the world—a cause we are 100% committed to.We promise that we will do everything we possibly can toput your contribution to good use in building the vision we’ve described.There are also some great perks.Check ‘em out!

The Time is Now

If we’re going to reclaim our culture and take back the arts andentertainment mountain, then we are going to need to take action.Now is the time. We feel like we’re at a pivotal moment in our history.We want to inspire the next generation to join us in creating a better world and we know we need to move fast.
We’re just two guys, but if you help us launch this, then we standa legitimate chance at shifting culture and doing, not just some, butA LOT of good in the world. 
Thank You
Thank you for believing in Prince Ivan. Thank you for your love and support. Please let us know if you have any questions at all and we’ll catch you on the other side of “The Preface.”
Love, Brydon and Aaron
P.S. Check out the FAQs for…err…frequently asked questions. ;)
 
Other Ways You Can HelpWe appreciate your financial support of our project so much. We could also use some help in spreading the word about our Indiegogo campaign and about our musical vision. Feel free to use the Indiegogo sharing tools, your social media accounts, email or any other means you’d like to spread the Prince Ivan love and help us get the word out. Thanks again!
Those social links…www.princeivan.comwww.facebook.com/PrinceIvanMusicwww.youtube.com/PrinceIvanOfficialwww.instagram.com/PrinceIvanOfficial

story:
Hello. I'm setting out here to raise funds to off-set the manufacturing & promotional costs of my 2nd CD, Mighty Lopez-"Tales From the Wood". I'm hoping you'll support me in this project by ordering a signed copy of the CD prior to its official release in May, 2017. I've chosen to go with an Indiegogo campaign as the best way to reach out to my fans, friends & family, home & away.

About Me

My musical journey has been down a long & twisted road. From my early days in Halifax (Nobody's Heroes, The Cooter Family), to incursions into Vancouver (Hard Rock Miners) & Toronto (Living Proof, The Wammee, Jughead) music scenes, to settling & raising a family in Muskoka, music has been my constant companion. With my kids full grown, I've re-focused my attention back to doing what I love... making music!

About This Project

This project is the fruit of my friendship with George Axon. I met George four years ago following a chance meeting in Bracebridge, Ontario.  From part time seasonal side man, to sharing demos, to co-writing and ultimately producer extraordinaire, George is an integral part of this labour of love called “Tales from the Wood”.  Differing from my bare bones first CD "Mighty Lopez" released in 2013, each song on this collection has been allowed to suggest its own instrumentation and arrangement, allowing an independent, organic growth. The result is an eclectic assortment of songs and instruments that will keep you engaged until the last chord fades.

Among the prominent musicians who contributed to this work, I am especially proud to have had the opportunity to work with my big brother, Brigham Phillips, one of Canada's top musical directors, for the first time.  Other contributors include Aidan Mason, Ed Roth, Brad Smith and Jamie Sherman.  Sean Cotton also adds his musical as well as songwriting talents to this project.

How You Can Help

With no funding but an abundance of passion, the collaboration between George and I has consumed many months of blood, sweat and tears (and laughs), “Tales From the Wood” has finally come to fruition, with manufacturing underway.

With the CD scheduled for release in  May 2017, this campaign is intended to raise funds to off-set manufacturing & promotional costs.  I am offering pre-release autographed copies of the CD for sale at $25 (shipping included). If you are able to contribute more, there are many other exciting offerings for you to choose from.  However much you are able to contribute, my gratitude for your faith and support for this project is boundless.

Even if you cannot afford a monetary pledge, your help is still needed, and very much appreciated.  Please talk about, and share the link to this page where ever you can – Twitter, Facebook, personal emails….getting the word out is so important. 

To everyone who has taken the time to look at this, make a pledge, or spread the word – THANK YOU.

story:
Neamen releases a daring project that pushes the boundaries of pop saxophone music. 

It’s been a while since the debut of my first CD, “So Free” and I decided that if I was ever going to release a new project for my fans, I had to bring them something that was genuinely worth the wait. As a performer, I go all in with everything that I do and so I knew that the only way I could do this project justice was to push the limit both inside myself and my art. The Moment of Truth is my breakout statement as a saxophonist, composer, rapper and lyricist that crushes the boundaries of a typical saxophone CD. I placed all my cards on the table to bring you something exciting, sincere, slightly dangerous and definitely NEAMEN. Get ready, because you are going to love this.

I made this CD for everyone who loves real artistry and longs for the days when music use to mean something, when songs were about the sincerity of heart rather than corporate analytics. A time when musicians followed their inner spirit before the concern of their wallet size. I have assembled an extraordinary cast of inspirational singers and instrumentalists who will leave your soul touched. If I've said it once I might as well say it again, you are just gonna love this CD.

Like so many independent musicians, I am the sole financier of my artistic career and I need your support to keep it going. If you enjoy the music that I create, please partner with me so that I can complete this project and undertake others like it. The funds from this campaign will be used to manufacture compact disks, launch a national radio campaign and purchase high quality video equipment so that I can bring you live performances directly from the internet.

 

Thank you all so much for your kindness, encouragement and support, I literally cannot do this without you. As a part of my campaign, I have included several perks to show my appreciation and express my sincere gratitude. If you are unable to participate as a financial backer but still want to support the project, please share this page on your social media. Lastly, please pray for my family and me as we walk forward in what we believe we were called to do.

story:
Hey guys! It's been almost thirteen years since we recorded an album. We've been talking about reuniting ever since we played the Kiss or Kill reunion show several years ago. Well, the time is finally right. Songs have been written, plane tickets have been purchased, and studio time has been reserved at Clutch Studios in Madison, WI. This thing is happening no matter what, and we want to invite you to be a part of making this record with us! 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to record eight songs with one cover chosen by you. To do this we need to raise around $10K. If we raise more money, we'll do more. If we raise less, we'll do less. How much BSB do you want in your life? It's up to you!
  • With this we’ll be able to produce a full-length album, along with T-shirts, album art, and vinyl. If we raise more than our goal, the funds will be used to record more songs, for PR, marketing,  and all of the other business stuff that goes into getting an album out for the world to hear.
  • For your support, we have some cool perks cooked up for you, including: clandestine post cards, signed vinyl...Cooper will even tattoo your name on her arm! You check out all the perks on this campaign page.

The Impact

We've wanted to get back together and make another album for a long time. We made some awesome albums together and always felt like we had another record in us.  You guys are the reason we feel like we can do this again. For you to place your faith in us to deliver another great album means everything to us.

The Leap 

This is a huge leap of faith for us. We don't know if you guys still want to hear new BSB music, but we have a feeling you might. We know we do.  And we're finally in a position to make it happen.

The idea of a crowdfunding campaign scared us at first. We've never done one of these. We thought, "What will people think if we ask them for help?" "Is it going to look like we're begging?" And especially, "What if we don't reach our goal?" 

Yet, when we expressed these doubts to people we love and respect, we received nothing but encouragement. So, here we are facing your fears and chasing our dream of making another record together, despite how difficult or uncomfortable it may be.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing to the campaign is something not everyone can do, and we totally understand that. If you can't make a financial investment and still want to help, share the campaign on social media and spread the word! Indiegogo has a built-in share tool that makes it super easy to share. The more people that see the campaign, the better chance we have to reach our goal!

Much love, everyone… Thank you so much for all your support. It’s been more than we could’ve ever imagined!

story:
[ESPAÑOL] (scroll down for English)

Resumen

Somos Apneuma, una banda establecida hace 12 años en Montevideo, Uruguay. Formada por un grupo de gente con la constante motivación de hacer una diferencia con su música en cada uno de los oyentes, así como marcar una diferencia en nuestra misma música.

Siempre comprometidos con ser parte de la escena, Apneuma ha demostrado su calibre en el escenario compartiendo escenario con bandas como Dark Tranquility, Hatebreed, In Element y Vital Remains, asī como también llegando a ser finalistas en todas las ediciones del concurso “Metal Battle Wacken Open Air Uruguay”.

“The electric Hive” es un álbum en el cual invertimos el alma, un álbum en el que nos aferramos a la chance de explorar nuevas direcciones probando nuevos instrumentos, adentrándonos en una nueva manera de pensar la composición y técnicas de producción, este disco es nuestra plataforma para llevar a cabo un nuevo paso hacia la dirección de lograr nuestro propio sonido masivo.

Nada menor, vamos a ser la primer banda de Metal del Uruguay en ser distribuida y representada por un Sello Discográfico Europeo. “Patroden Records”, nuestro representante, una atrevida plataforma que crece junto a nosotros de la mano de nuestro productor en Berlin, Alemania.

Esta es una enorme chance a la que todos nos estamos aferrando de los cuernos, no solamente como banda, sino como individuos, un colectivo de artistas que quiere conocer el mundo y hacer que el mundo conozca a Apneuma.

Lo Que Necesitamos & Lo Que Recibís

La grabación, mezcla, mastering y diseño gráfico ya está pronto, todo por nuestra propia cuenta, tomándonos todo el tiempo posible todos los días luego de trabajar y cumplir con nuestras obligaciones además de ser muy afortunados de tener muy seguidas fechas en vivo desde Agosto 2017. Así, tu contribución va a ser el combustible que va a poner en órbita este cohete, vas a hacer posible la producción inicial de 500 copias de “The Electric Hive” en un formato de Digipac. No solamente estaremos cubriendo los gastos de fabricación, sino también el envío de 250 copias a Uruguay desde Alemania, Impresión, Promoción, registro legal, packaging y distribución. Todo esto será posible si alcanzamos la meta de 1200 Euros.

Tenemos preparadas unos premios exclusivos para nuestros contribuyentes, laburos únicos que desarrollamos con mucha dedicación para decir GRACIAS desde lo más profundo de nuestro corazón.

En el caso de que no lleguemos a nuestra meta, vamos a seguir adelante fabricando una cantidad menor de copias, dependiendo en el resultado final de este primer partido.

Otras maneras de ayudar: Vas a estar contribuyendo a la causa también compartiendo y poniendo el grito en el cielo acerca de esta aventura, usando también las herramientas sociales de INDIEGOGO.

[ENGLISH]

Short Summary

  • We are Apneuma, a 12 year old band born in Montevideo, Uruguay. Formed by a group of people with the constant inner push of making a difference with our music in the minds of our listeners as also inside of our own music. Always committed on taking part of the scene, Apneuma proved their caliber on stage supporting live acts like Dark Tranquility, In Element, Vital Remains and Hatebreed, as also being finalists in two editions of Metal Battle Wacken Open Air  Uruguay.
  •  "The Electric Hive" is a record in wich we put all of our souls in, a record in wich we took the chance to explore new directions by trying out new instruments, getting into new mindset and production techniques, "The Electric Hive" is our platform to take a new step into the direction of our own massive sound.
  •  Nonetheless, we will be the first Metal act from Uruguay to be distributed and represented by an European Record Label.  "Patroden Records" is our representation, a pioneering platform being grown by our producer in Berlin, Germany. This is a big chance we are all grabbing by the horns not just as a band but as individuals, as a collective of artists who want to know the world and let the world know Apneuma.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The recording, mixing, mastering and art is already done, all by ourselves, by taking the time everyday after work since August 2017 at the same time we were lucky to have plenty of shows every month. So, your contribution will be the fuel for the rocket, you will make possible the production of 500 copies of The Electric Hive in a Digipac format. Not only the manufacture cost is involved when making Cds, but also shipments, printing, legal affairs, packaging, distribution and so on. All of this will be possible with reaching the goal of EUR1200
  • We have been preparing exclusive perks for our contributors, elements wich won't be produced again in any other context but to say a gigantic Thank You from the deepest of our hearts
  • In case we don't reach our goal, we will focus on the manufacture of less copies, depending on what we get at the end of this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You will be contributing to our cause by also getting the word out and making some noise with the Indiegogo share tools.

Not only the manufacture cost is involved when making Cds, but also shipments, printing, legal affairs, packaging, distribution and so on. All of this will be possible with reaching the goal of EUR1200
We have been preparing exclusive perks for our contributors, elements wich won't be produced again in any other context but to say a gigantic Thank You from the deepest of our hearts
In case we don't reach our goal, we will focus on the manufacture of less copies, depending on what we get at the end of this campaign.


Other Ways You Can Help
You will be contributing to our cause by also getting the word out and making some noise with the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
We are almost ready with the music to our debut album - Limbo. We need your help to finish the product (record, print and release) escaping the labels. 
It is a concept album following the story of a man trapped into his mind, trying to prevail over his alter ego.
All funds will go for:
 - recording
 - mastering
 - artwork
 - producing

Thank you in advance!

story: Teardrop City is a band from Oxford Mississippi including Laurie Stirratt, George Sheldon, Tyler Keith, and Wallace Lester. We've got about 200 years of musical experience between us, and about 25 records from bands such as Blue Mountain, the Neckbones, Tyler Keith and the Preacher's Kids, Kenny Brown, Rev John Wilkins, and others. We're not a young band that labels are lining up to "sign". We just want to put out this record on our own. But, being involved in the music business, and being in bands for years, we forgot to learn how to make money. We need your help with the manufacturing of the vinyl product. You can help simply by pre-ordering and giving a little more and getting some cool stuff for your money. This is not us begging for money. You will get something of equal or greater value in return! Everybody wins! The money will be used specifically for the following: mastering, artwork, and the manufacturing of LP vinyl and CDs. We've already used our own money  to record and mix the record with a little spent on refreshments.             Thanks For Your Help!

story:
About This Project

A Little Fire Scarecrow is a recording project by Coraline Ada Ehmke, a transgender artist working from her home studio in Chicago.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm looking for funding to cover production costs for this album:

  • Hiring a professional violinist to add magic to the track "Astronomy Domine"
  • Fees associated with securing rights to all of the songs on the album
  • Pay for the cost of releasing the album on iTunes, Apple Music, Amazon, and Spotify

All supporters at the $10 or higher level will get access to a digital download of the entire album.

The Impact

Transgender people have made great strides in recent years but we still face incredible obstacles to being fully integrated into society. All too often our voices are not heard, and people who don't understand our unique challenges and unique gifts misrepresent us in the media. It's important to empower transgender people to find their own voices and represent themselves in all spheres of life. This  includes supporting transgender artists who are creating important works that reveal our inner lives and inner struggles as we continue our journeys of self-discovery.

For myself, returning to making music was very difficult. Before I decided to transition my music was an outlet for the rage and sorrow that overwhelmed me, feelings that I had no other way of expressing. Once I began my transition, that creative center moved away. I really thought that without the existential burden of living a false life, I had no inspiration anymore. Over time I came to see that there was a new world of feelings to explore, new perspectives that I was gaining, and new stories to tell. Slowly and with difficulty I returned to expressing myself creatively through music.

Finding myself and finding the courage to live authentically continues to be the hardest thing that I have ever done, and in fact it is never done. I struggle daily with questions of identity, authenticity, and acceptance. Making music is one of the ways that I have found to center myself and find my voice.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate to help me release this album, please recognize the importance of supporting and amplifying the voices of marginalized people. Use your social media presence to promote the projects of people who are working to make the world a more diverse and inclusive place. Now more than ever, we need allies to support us in all that we do.

story:
BREVE BIOGRAFÍA:

A mediados de 2015 se juntan cinco chavales y forman ATLANTIC con la única intención dar conciertos por su zona, enseñando un repertorio de versiones donde predominaba la presencia de grupos como Oasis, Artic Monkeys, Vetusta Morla o Coldplay.

Con el tiempo, el grupo se va afianzando y llegan las primeras composiciones: tras estrenar su primer single-videoclip Invierno con una genial acogida por el público de los alrededores, llega su primer EP El Viajero de Sueños, de tres canciones.

Tiempo después, tras una gira nacional por ciudades como Salamanca, Madrid, Valencia o Barcelona y numerosos conciertos y festivales dentro de Galicia llega su segundo single-videoclip Fronteras en el verano de 2017.

Ahora, después de unos meses de composición y evolución, llega algo nuevo...

 

QUIÉNES SOMOS:

Roi Grandío Arbiol - Guitarra y Voz.

Jose Vilas Villamarín - Batería.

Adrián Collazo Cuña - Teclado y Coros.

Rafael ‘El Yayo’ Davila Freitas - Bajo y Coros.

Andrés Vilas Villamarín - Saxo, Percusiones y Coros.

 

EL PROYECTO:

Sabemos que estamos listos para empezar a hacer algo grande. Para daros nuestra mejor versión. Para ser valientes y ¿por qué no? Creer en la magia. Porque los sueños pueden hacerse realidad, y el nuestro tiene forma de disco. Bienvenidos al Proyecto 1º Disco de Atlantic: lo más grande que hemos hecho nunca.

A partir del viernes 15 de diciembre, y hasta el 15 de febrero, Atlantic (Galicia) comenzará a grabar lo que será su primer álbum de estudio. Un LP de 12 canciones totalmente propias cuyo lanzamiento está previsto para marzo de 2018.

Y por si esto os sabe a poco, se va a realizar un documental-making off de todo el proceso: de cómo un grupo que parte prácticamente de la nada, consigue lanzar su primer disco, ganar y afianzar una comunidad de seguidores (nada más y nada menos que vosotros mismos) y presentarlo en una sala grande consiguiendo agotar las entradas. La fecha señalada para esto es el viernes día 20 de abril de 2018 en la Sala Rouge de Vigo.

Para hacer todo esto necesitamos vuestra ayuda, ahora más que nunca: además de lo que hemos podido conseguir en estos dos añitos que llevamos en activo, necesitamos ese pequeño empujón para poder llevar a cabo este gran proyecto. El presupuesto necesario para sacar adelante todo esto es de 10.000€ aproximadamente. A los que intentaremos llegar a través de alguna subvención y de un crowdfunding de 5.000€ en el que todos podremos participar aportando nuestro grano de arena y, de paso, llevarnos bonitas recompensas.

No sabemos qué va a salir de aquí. Si conseguiremos saltar este gran escalón o nos caeremos por el precipicio. Pero sabemos que no lo podremos conseguir sin vosotros. Queremos que estéis a nuestro lado, al pié del cañón en un proyecto de todos. Porque todo esto es por y gracias a vosotros.

 

NUESTRAS REDES:

Además de escucharnos en las plataformas digitales de internet, deberíais estar atentos a toda la información que os iremos dando a través de nuestras redes sociales durante los próximos meses. Además de importantes eventos y noticias que solamente podréis ver a través de éstas y del apartado ‘comunidad’ de nuestra página web (que abriremos próximamente).

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/5G8yJXcWfzrFsrz4d2aeF8

iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/es/album/el-viajero-de-sue%C3%B1os-single/1222596803

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/atlantic_music/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/atlanticmusicspain/

 

TODO EL DINERO SE INVERTIRÁ EN:

-Grabación, mezcla y mastering de las 12 canciones que conforman el disco.

-Fabricación de discos físicos.

-Fabricación (y envío) de las recompensas.

-Fotocopias de carteles, folletos, etc. de cara al concierto de presentación en Rouge (Vigo) del 20 de abril.

-Alquiler de sala, técnicos y materiales necesarios para el concierto de presentación en Rouge (Vigo) del 20 de abril.

-Sesiones de foto y vídeo.

-Realización del making-off.

-Promoción por Redes Sociales.

 

SOBRE LAS RECOMPENSAS:

Las recompensas se entregarán:

  1. En cualquiera de los 10 conciertos en acústico que se darán en la comunidad gallega antes del 20 de abril de 2018.
  2. En persona "a domicilio" para casos concretos justificados.
  3. En el propio concierto de presentación a lo largo de todo el día (hasta media hora antes del concierto) en la Sala Rouge. 

*En caso de no poder recoger tus recompensas de ninguna de las tres formas anteriores, deberás enviar un mail a info@musicatlantic.com con tus datos, dirección y código postal y te serán enviadas a tu casa a contrarrembolso*

En caso de no poder asistir al concierto de presentación, se deberá avisar al correo info@musicatlantic.com y se entregará a cambio un minipack de merchandasing.

Importante: poner nombre completo real para evitar problemas a la hora de recibir las recompensas.

¡ECHAD UN OJO A NUESTRAS MARAVILLOSAS RECOMPENSAS!

story:
About Kevin

I'm Kevin Dean, professional drummer and educator. I have been drumming for 35 years and performing live on stage with bands since 1989. I began teaching in 1999 and spent the better part of my 30s writing, recording and touring with national recording artists Brand New Sin (MTV, record labels, exciting tours opening for our heroes, sponsorships, endorsements...etc. legit rock star status haha). I also performed a short run of shows with Heart (yes, Ann and Nancy...THAT Heart) as well as 5 shows with Josh Groban.

Summer Drummers

This fundraiser is for an endeavor that is much bigger than me. I am taking my network, experience, connections, skills and uninhibited positive energy and channeling it all into a program that gives kids the spotlight and paves the way toward being a professional musician!

The Fundraiser

With YOUR investment, I hope to provide a myriad of opportunities and amenities to coincide with the amazing shows I have already booked for them (Wegmans Playground, Dinosaur BBQ, Funk N Waffles, NYS Bluesfest, Wildflowers Armory, Art On The Porches):

  • A van, sticks, drums, cymbals, heads, cowbells, congas, djembes, tambourines, shakers, insurance, a lawyer, recording gear, software, hardware, meals (feed these kids...they need energy to drum), custom T shirts, hats, and endorsement swag, a professional recording session at a world class studio, professional photography and video and so much more!
  • This program has no ceiling and we're shooting for the moon. Why not try to franchise it?
  • Would YOU sponsor a kid?

*Summer Drummers is a two week program Monday - Friday 10am-2pm

*3 sessions between July 9 and August 17

*$500 per session

[DON'T WORRY, IT DOESN'T END THERE... I own AutumnRhythms.com and IceDrummers.com so stay tuned...]

Please do what you can to help these kids!

If you cannot afford to assist financially, would you at least get behind us and share on social media please? THANKS!

-Kevin

story:
Bill Meek Jr

         Began his life long love affair with music at the tender age of 3 when no one could pull him away from the radio or the record player. He picked up piano and keyboards at age 12 and the rest is history. He majored in music at Wilmington College in Ohio and Temple University and went on to be Grover Washington's keyboard player. He performed live and on albums with Philly Joe Jones and Tyrone Brown, also cowrote the title song of Teddy Pendergrass's Christmas Album, This Christmas, with Dodd Edwards son of Patti LaBelle. Bill has also accompanied and arranged much of the material on Just Peace featuring the Late Rosella Washington who was also the velvety rich contralto you heard on the presentation video. Bill has taught jazz piano at Settlement music school and performed in all the major hotels and Jazz venues in Philadelphia and was also the house pianist at the Union League of Philadelphia for a decade.

In his own words...

The music of the church has always moved me as I'm sure it has moved many of us over the years. Faith and belief in a loving God is a sustaining force in all of our lives. This project is a lifelong dream that I am eager to finally bring to fruition. Blending traditional sacred music with America's original music Jazz.  I've assembled a talented group of singers all of whom I've worked with over the 50  years I've been composing, recording and performing.  And my hope is that it brings you as much peace and joy as working on this music has brought me.

I'm asking for a total of $8,000.00 to complete my project.

Recording, mixing and mastering $3,950.00

I've negotiated an extremely fair price for 40 hrs of estimated studio time.

CD Pressing & Printing $1,200.00

Talent Compensation $1,350

Food, transportation and parking $1,500

Contributions of less than $15 get the CD at cost which is $6

$15 to $99 Get Free CD or Download

We're working on T-shirt designs featuring some of the gorgeous stained glass windows that were shown in the video for a contribution of $100 

Contributions of $100 or more get a T-shirt and a Free CD or download.

Hell or high water this project is going forward so if we don't reach the goal it may take a bit longer to complete. 

Your contribution will:

Keep us from selling our furniture and jewelry.

Bring love, light, beautiful music, and joy to a world sorely in need of it.

If you are enthusiastic about the project but can't afford a contribution at this time please share our link on your social media pages and let your friends know what we are doing.

We Thank You Whole Heartedly and God Bless!

The beautiful images accompanying our video come from four Philadelphia churches ; African Episcopal Church of St. Thomas , St. John The Evangelist Catholic Church , St. Mark's Church , and Christ Church.'

story:
Tell Me More!

How La Guerrera EP//The Warrior EP came to be..

In case you don't know who I am, hi, I'm Gaby! 23-year-old singer-songwriter born and raised in the San Francisco Bay Area and a temporary Twin Cities transplant while I completed my Bachelor of Music in Composition and Songwriting at McNally Smith College of Music in St. Paul, Minnesota. I've been writing songs since I was 12 and performing regularly since age 14. I primarily play guitar and sing, but I also play mandolin, ukulele, and piano/keyboards. Between 2011 and 2015, I released three studio albums, and the most recent came to life with the help of Indiegogo, so I've decided to use this wonderful platform again to help fund this EP! It's been a while since I got music out to you and you deserve some new tunes!

So...how did these songs come to be?

While in college, for my senior portfolio, one of my requirements was to write a stylistic track (in other words, a song outside of my typical genre). I chose to pay homage to my Hispanic heritage and wrote a song called "Guerrera." This song, as the title suggests, is about being a warrior and knowing your worth. I was raised in a family of feminists and powerful women on both sides of my family, so it has always been instilled in me that I can do whatever I want and achieve whatever I want by my own means. Equality and justice are two words I heard a lot growing up. This is the first song where I've written lyrics in Spanish, and that was very empowering in itself.

The next song, "Stronger," is actually one of my oldest songs that was on my first album but I'm re-recording it since it's changed a bit over the last almost 10 years. I wrote this song about one of my best friends who saved my life back in middle school. Sometimes in order to be strong, you have to let someone be strong for you. Friendships are absolutely essential in life and I wrote this song to reflect that.

"Thrill," lyrically, is probably the most risqué song I've ever written. This song touches on sexual empowerment, a topic I never saw myself writing about. But...it makes sense that my lyrical content would go through a change between the ages of 12 and 23! So many mainstream songs these days objectify women and I'm tired of that, so this song came from my own desires and passions, from the perspective of an empowered young woman who isn't afraid to chase after what she wants.

I started writing "Goddess" and "The Fight" the same night in June of 2017. It had been months since I'd written anything, and I had lots of ideas I needed to get out. "Goddess" came from a more vulnerable spot. The chorus is essentially a chant to repeat over and over when you're feeling powerless and defenseless. No matter what, you are a goddess. You can take care of yourself, persevere, and prosper. "The Fight" came from an angrier spot. A few people from my past caused a lot of psychological damage through bullying, manipulation, and other harmful acts. Lots of people tell me I'm stubborn and tenacious; I'm never down for long. That's exactly what "The Fight" is about.

Successfully reaching the goal for this campaign will allow me to get these five extremely personal songs out to you in mid-2018!! I want to leave about a year and a half between this EP and my fourth studio album, which is still being written.

What's the Bang for My Buck?

Let me break it down:

  • In order to get this EP out into the world and your hands/smartphones/laptops, I need to raise $6000. These funds will be divided between recording, mixing, mastering, photography, graphic design, CD pressing, digital distribution, and copyright. Believe it or not, there's a TON of steps involved in getting music out!
  • PERKS PERKS PERKS. I love giving. By helping fund this EP, you'll have exclusive access to the process of the EP, you'll be the first to hear the songs, I'll send you digital and physical copies of the EP, and more, based on the contribution level. This wouldn't be possible without YOU.
  • If I don't reach my goal, the EP release will be pushed back by a few or several months, depending on how far we get. I'm a recent college graduate working two day jobs along with gigging weekly, so my funds are very tight. I want this EP to happen and soon, but unfortunately, money plays an enormous role in the timing. The funds will go to studio time first, and once that's done, we'll move on to other essentials like EP artwork and distribution.

Help Me Help Others

My music has never been about me. I write and perform to make a difference:

  • Songwriting allows me to connect with people living through a hard time and needing a shoulder to lean on. Music is very therapeutic and these five songs have the potential to connect with many, many people. All I want is for my personal experiences to resonate with someone and make them feel.
  • Funding this album would allow me to get these songs out and reach thousands, if not millions, of people around the world.

Hurdles & Obstacles

There are challenges that come with releasing new music.

  • There's a few hurdles to jump before getting these songs out. The biggest hurdle is the financial one. Without sufficient funds, the EP simply can't happen. After that, it's time and commitment. Without organization and planning, the process will be much messier.
  • In order to overcome these obstacles, I'll be setting a timeline for myself on when to get everything done. By sticking to this timeline, the EP will be done in an organized and timely manner. In order to raise the funds, I'll be combining promotion efforts via social media, word of mouth, email blasts, and a YouTube video or two to get the word out. The more people who see this, the more people will contribute and help make this EP a reality!

Other Ways To Spread the Word

If you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't help! The most successful campaigns are a community effort of combined sharing and donating.

  • Tell your friends!

  • Share this project on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, and any social network you use

  • Share this project using the Indiegogo share tools

  • Like my Facebook page (facebook.com/gabycastromusic) for updates

  • Follow me on Twitter (twitter.com/gabycat94) for updates

  • Follow me on Instagram (instagram.com/gabycastro94) for updates and maybe an Insta story shoutout!

  • Subscribe to me on YouTube (youtube.com/gabycastro94) for video updates

  • Sign up on my mailing list to get email updates! I don't spam...in fact...I send 2-3 emails per year and I'm trying to get into a routine of 1 every couple of months...

Tell Me More!
How La Guerrera EP//The Warrior EP came to be..
In case you don't know who I am, hi, I'm Gaby! 23-year-old singer-songwriter born and raised in the San Francisco Bay Area and a temporary Twin Cities transplant while I completed my Bachelor of Music in Composition and Songwriting at McNally Smith College of Music in St. Paul, Minnesota. I've been writing songs since I was 12 and performing regularly since age 14. I primarily play guitar and sing, but I also play mandolin, ukulele, and piano/keyboards. Between 2011 and 2015, I released three studio albums, and the most recent came to life with the help of Indiegogo, so I've decided to use this wonderful platform again to help fund this EP! It's been a while since I got music out to you and you deserve some new tunes!
So...how did these songs come to be?
While in college, for my senior portfolio, one of my requirements was to write a stylistic track (in other words, a song outside of my typical genre). I chose to pay homage to my Hispanic heritage and wrote a song called "Guerrera." This song, as the title suggests, is about being a warrior and knowing your worth. I was raised in a family of feminists and powerful women on both sides of my family, so it has always been instilled in me that I can do whatever I want and achieve whatever I want by my own means. Equality and justice are two words I heard a lot growing up. This is the first song where I've written lyrics in Spanish, and that was very empowering in itself.
The next song, "Stronger," is actually one of my oldest songs that was on my first album but I'm re-recording it since it's changed a bit over the last almost 10 years. I wrote this song about one of my best friends who saved my life back in middle school. Sometimes in order to be strong, you have to let someone be strong for you. Friendships are absolutely essential in life and I wrote this song to reflect that.
"Thrill," lyrically, is probably the most risqué song I've ever written. This song touches on sexual empowerment, a topic I never saw myself writing about. But...it makes sense that my lyrical content would go through a change between the ages of 12 and 23! So many mainstream songs these days objectify women and I'm tired of that, so this song came from my own desires and passions, from the perspective of an empowered young woman who isn't afraid to chase after what she wants.

That's exactly what "The Fight" is about.

These funds will be divided between recording, mixing, mastering, photography, graphic design, CD pressing, digital distribution, and copyright. If I don't reach my goal, the EP release will be pushed back by a few or several months, depending on how far we get. I'm a recent college graduate working two day jobs along with gigging weekly, so my funds are very tight. I want this EP to happen and soon, but unfortunately, money plays an enormous role in the timing. The funds will go to studio time first, and once that's done, we'll move on to other essentials like EP artwork and distribution.


Help Me Help Others
My music has never been about me. I write and perform to make a difference:

Songwriting allows me to connect with people living through a hard time and needing a shoulder to lean on. Music is very therapeutic and these five songs have the potential to connect with many, many people. All I want is for my personal experiences to resonate with someone and make them feel.
Funding this album would allow me to get these songs out and reach thousands, if not millions, of people around the world.
